                     CO U N C IL M EETING S
      S TAN DI NG OR D KR S F OR T H K C O N D U C T O F B l ' Sl N F SS
                  AT MF . F TI NGS O F T H F C O I N C I I .

1.    M eetings o f Council
    All M e e t i n g s o f th e C o u n c i l shal l b e h e l d at e l e v e n (11)
o ’c lock in t h e m o r n i n g , at t h e H e a d Of f i c e o f t h e A s s o ci at i o n ,
e xc e pt u n d e r s pecial ci r c u m s t a n c e s , w h e n t h e C h a i r m a n o r t h e
C o unc il m a y fox s o m e o t h e r h o u r o r p l a c e . M e e t i n g s o f t h e
C ouncil shall be re s tr ic t e d t o n o t m o r e t h a n five ( 5) a sea s o n
(e xc luding S u m m e r M e e t i n g ) a n d b e h e l d o n s u c h d a t e s as t h e
C ouncil shall d e c i d e a n n u a l l y at t h e first m e e t i n g h e l d af t e r t h e
A n n u a l G e n e r a l M e e t i n g . T h e Co u n c i l o r E m e r g e n c y C o m ­
m it te e m a y a r r a n g e ad d i t i o n a l m e e t i n g s o r c a n c e l a m e e t i n g at
the ir dis cre tion* . A r e c o r d shal l b e k e p t o f t h e a t t e n d a n c e o f
M e m b e r s at e a c h m e et i n g .

2.    N otice o f M eetings— A gen da
   T h e S ecr et ary shall give seven (7) d a y s no ti c e t o each
M em be r o f every me e ti n g o f the Co u n c i l , t o g e t h e r with
A g en da o f the bus iness.


3.     N o tices o f M otion s
    N otices o f all int end e d m o t i o n s shall be given in wr it i ng to
the S ecr et ary not less t h a n f ou r t e e n (14) d a y s b e f o r e the
meeting o f the Co uncil. T h e Se c r e t a r y shall place t he no ti ces
on the A g e n d a in the o r d e r received.
   All p ro p o s a ls o f C o m m itte e s an d M e m b e rs o f the C o u n ­
cil i n v o l v in g a n y a l t e r a t i o n o f R u l e s a n d R e g u l a t i o n s o f T h e
F o o tb a l l A s s o c i a t i o n shall, a fte r C o u n c il h a s d e c id e d the
poli cy, be r e f e r r e d to t h e R u l e s R e v i s i o n C o m m i t t e e f o r
the ir c o n s i d e r a t i o n a n d r e p o r t b e f o r e b e i n g f i n a l l y a d o p t e d
by t h e C o u n c i l .

4.    Order o f Proceedings
   (i) M inutes
   At all meetings o f the Co u n c i l t he S e c r e t a r y shall pr esen t
the Mi nu tes o f the last p r e c e d i n g Co u n c i l meeti ng.

*Being revised.
IX                                SI ANDINO ORDF.RS


     (li) Correspondence
   T h e S e c r e t a r y shall read such letters as m a y be necess ary
or t h a t an y M e m b e r of the Co u n c i l desires to have read.
     liii) Reports o f Committees
     T h e R e p o r t s of C o m m i t t e e s shall next be co n s i de r e d ; the
C h a i r m a n o f e a c h C o m m i t t e e or in his a b s e n c e a M e m b e r of
the C o m m i t t e e , shall p r o p o s e the a d o p t i o n o f the R epor t and
M e m b e r s m a y then speak on a n y m a t t e r m e n t i o n e d in the
R e p o r t s or mo v e a resolution thereon.
     Q u e s t i o n s m a y b e a s k e d o f w h i c h n o t i c e is gi v e n in w r i t ­
ing n o t l ess t h a n t h r e e ( 3 ) d a y s b e f o r e t h e m e e t i n g o f t he
Council.
     V erbal R e p o r t s of meetings o f C o m m i t t e e s which have
n o t b e e n c i r c u l a t e d sh a l l b e r e g a r d e d a s f o r i n f o r m a t i o n
only unless, on g r o u n d s of urgency, an im m e d i a te decision
is n e c e s s a r y , in w h i c h c a se a c t i o n r e c o m m e n d e d in s u ch
R e p o r t s m a y be p r o c e e d e d w i t h i m m e d i a t e l y if t he C o u n c i l
g i v e s its sp e c i f i c c o n s e n t .
     (iv) The Business
    T h e busi ness on the Agenda shall be p r o c e e de d u,ith in such
o r d e r as the C h a i r ma n may direct.


5.       M o d e o f Discus si on
    E a c h M e m b e r on speaki ng shall rise a nd a d d r e s s himsel f to
the C h a i r m a n , a n d not to an;,' other M e m b e r o f the Council.
    D u r i n g the time any M e m b e r is speaki ng, al! the ot he r
M e m b e r s shall remain seated, unless a M e m b e r rises to a
point o f order.
    W h e n e v e r the C h a i r m a n rises to s peak, no one shall
c o n t i n u e st a nding, nor shall a n y o n e rise until the C h a i r has
been r e s u me d .


6.    Mode of Proceeding with Motion
   Ail mo t i o n s , whe t he r original o n e s or a m e n d m e n t s , shall, if
the C h a i r m a n reques t s it. be r e d u c e d to writing, signed by the
mo v e r, a n d h a n d e d to the Secret ary i mmedi at e l y on being
m o v e d a n d every M e m b e r p r o p o s i n g such mot i on or
a m e n d m e n t shall1 read the s a m e before s p e aki ng on it.
                               S T A N D I N G O R DK RS                             19



7.    Order of Speaking
   T h e m o v e r of ever y ori ginal Re s o l u t i o n , but n ot o f any
a m e n d m e n t (unless it b e c o m e s an original m ot ion) , shall h av e the
right to reply, not int ro du ci ng t he r ei n any new ma t ter , but
confining himself strictly to the a n s wer i n g of p r ev i ou s
obje ctions, immediatel y af t er which the q u es t io n shall be put
from the Chair.
    N o othe r M e m b e r shall be a l l o we d to s pe a k m o r e t h an
onc e on the s a m e qu e s t i o n , u nl ess p er m i s s i o n be given to
explain, or the attentio n o f t h e C h a i r m a n be called t o a poi nt
of order.


8.    Amendments
   W he n an am e n d m e n t is m o v e d up o n a p r op os i ti on, no f u r th er
a m en dm en t shall be m o v e d or t a k e n int o c o ns i d e r a t i o n until the
first is dis pos ed of, but any n u m b e r of a m e n d m e n t s may be
brought forward in s ucc e s s i o n , a nd the q u es t io n mus t be put in
such a man ner that if one a m e n d m e n t be negat ived a n o t h er may
be moved upon the original p r op o s i ti o n , but if an a m e n d m e n t be
affirmed it shall form the p r op os i t i o n u n d e r c o ns i der at i o n ,
w h ere u po n further a m e n d m e n t s may be m o v e d , and if aft er the
disposal of an a m e n d m e n t no s e c o n d o r f u r t h e r a m e n d m e n t be
move d, the ques tion mu st ult imatel y be put up o n the original or
a m e n d ed proposition, as the c a se ma y be, in o r d e r to its being
pa sse d as a Res olution.


9.  Discussion on Amendments
  Wh en dis cuss ion ari ses up o n an a m e n d e d p r op o si ti o n, the
move r of the a m e n d m e n t which has dis plac ed the original
proposition may s peak in reply, a n d so in like m a n n e r with
respect to any further and d isplaci ng a m e n d m e n t s .


10.    Voting
    All qu es ti o ns shall be d e t e r m i n e d by a s ho w o f h an d s,
unless either (a) a bal l ot , o r (b) t he r e c o r d i n g o f vo tes, be
re que s ted by an y M e m b e r s u p p o r t e d by at least t w o (2) o t h e r
M e m b e rs , a nd in the e v e n t o f v o t e s be ing r e c o r d e d u n d er (b),
the na m es for, a n d a g a i n s t , shall be r eg is t er ed by the
Sec r eta ry an d en te red in t he M i n ut es .

1 7.   Urgent Business
   M a t te r which is not on the A g e n d a o r S u p p l e m e n t a r y

without dis cus s ion, a m a j o r i t y o f t h r e e- f o ur t h s ( | ) o f the
Me m b er s pre s e nt by vo t e c o ns e nt .

18.     Rescinding Resolu tion
   A R es o lut ion shall n o t be r e s c i n d e d at the M e e t i n g o f t h e
C o un cil at which it h a s b een p a s s e d , unless the m o t i o n to
resci nd shall be carr ied by t h r e e - f o u r t h s ( | ) o f t he M e m b e r s
pr e sent an d voting.
    N o m a tt e r whi ch h a s be en d i s c u s s e d by t he Co u n ci l , a n d
on wh ich a Res o lutio n h a s be en p a s s e d , m a y be b r o u g h t up
again for dis cus s ion wi th in a p er i od o f twel ve ( 1 2 ) m o n t h s
from the da te on wh ic h t he Re s o l u t i o n w a s p a s s e d unless the
motion to dis cus s shall be c a r r i e d by t h r e e - f o u r t h s ( |) o f the
M e m b er s pres ent and voti ng.

             STANDING C O M M IT TEES
              P O W ER S AND DUTIES
    No t i c e of the dat e s o f me eti ngs o f C o m m i t t e e s shall be
given to M e m b e r s as s o o n as possi ble befor e t h e meeti ngs,
an d A g e n d a an d a c c o m p a n y i n g d o c u m e n t s shall be sent to
M e m b e r s at least o ne (1) week before a me eti ng unless the
n a t u r e o f the busi ness a n d c i r c u ms t a n c e s m a k e this i m ­
possible.

Challenge C u p Commit tee
   To control and ma n a g e the Chall enge Cup Compet i t i on on
behalf of the Council a nd to give deci sions on ma tte rs arising out
of the Compet i t i on which shall be d e e me d to be decisions of the
Council.
   T h e duties shall include, a c c e p t i n g entries, m a k i n g ex­
e mp t i o n s . ma k i n g the d r a w : a n d a p p o i nt i n g officials to
ma t c h e s .

Challenge T ro p hy Co mmit tee
   T o control and ma na ge the F. A. Challenge Tr ophy
Co mp e t i t i o n on behalf of the Council and to give deci sions on
matters arising out of the Compet i t i on w hich shall be de e me d to
be decisions of the Council.
   The duties shall include accept ing entries, making e x e m p ­
tions, making the d r a ws and appointing match officials to
matches.

Challenge Vase Co mmit tee
   To control and ma nage the F.A. Challenge Vase Compet i t i on
on behal f of the Council and to give deci sions on ma tters arising
out of the Compet i t i on which shall be d e e m e d to be deci sions of
the Council.
   The duties shall include accept ing entries, making e x e m p ­
tions. making the dr a ws and appoi nting match officials to
ma tches.

A ffiliation o f A sso cia tio n s
4. (a) C o n d itio n s o f A ffilia tio n
   All A s s o c i a t i o n s a f f i l i a t e d t o T h e A s s o c i a t i o n sh al l

according to the L aw s o f th e G a m e a n d c o n f o r m in g to the

Rule s a nd R e g u la t io n s of T h e A s so ci at io n a n d the Statutes
a nd R e g u la t io n s of the W or ld ( F . I . F . A . ) an d E u r o p e a n
( U . E . F . A . ) F o o t b a l l A u t h o r i t i e s ' 1. T h e R u l e s o f all affili­

Powers o f Council

all affiliated A s s o c i a t i o n s a n d C l u b s a n d all M e m b e r s t h e r e o f ,

p r e s e n t a n d v o ti n g at a G e n e r a l M e e t i n g .

    sp o r ts d a y s , th e y m u s t be s a n c t i o n e d by T h e A s s o c i a ti o n

    C o m p e t i t i o n in this c as e shall a u t o m a t i c a l l y a c c o r d to the

    C o m m itte e o f the sa n c tio ned C o m p e titio n subject alw ays
    to t h e o v e r r i d i n g a u t h o r i t y o f T h e A s s o c i a t i o n o r t h e

    the responsibility of the san ctio ning body:
       (iv) the p la yi n g o f m a t c h e s a r r a n g e d b y priv ate
    ind ividuals for sp e c u l a ti v e p u r p o s e s shall n o t be p er m it te d ;

       (v)         for small side g a m e s pl a y e d for c ha r i ta b l e objecti ves
   a s t a t e m e n t o f a c c o u n t s o f the event shall be suppl ied to
   the sa n c t i on i ng b o d y c o n c e r n e d within t we nt y one (21)
   d a ys.
   W h e r e t wo (2) affiliated A s s o c i a t i o n s c o v e r the s a m e area,
the permi s si on m u s t be o b t a i n e d f r om the a p p r o p r i a t e p a r e n t
Associ at i on.
   T h e r e shall be n o close sea s o n for s mall side g a m e s .
   T h e L a ws a p p l i c a b l e to t h e playing o f small side g a m e s shall
 be as p r i n t e d on p a g e s 247— 253.

T h e Playing Season
 16. (a ) C o u n c i l to D e t e r m i n e
     T h e C o u n c i l o f T h e A s s o c i a t i o n shal l d e t e r m i n e a n n u a l l y
t h e d a t e o n w h i c h t h e p l a y i n g s e a s o n shall c o m m e n c e a n d
t h e s e a s o n shal l t e r m i n a t e n o t l a t e r t h a n t h e f o l lo wi n g
f i f t e e n t h ( 1 5 t h ) J u n e . E a c h L e a g u e o r C o m p e t i t i o n shall
w i t h i n t h e limit laid d o w n b y T h e A s s o c i a t i o n , d e t e r m i n e
t h e l e n g t h o f its o w n p l a y i n g s e a s o n .
      ( b) T he Close Sea so n
     T h e C l o s e S e a s o n sh a l l be d e f i n e d as t h e p e r i o d b e t w e e n
s i x t e e n t h ( 16th) J u n e a n d f i f t e e n t h ( 15th) J u l y. N o m a t c h e s
o t h e r t h a n t h o s e p e r m i t t e d a n d p l a y e d in a c c o r d a n c e w i t h
s u b - p a r a g r a p h s (i ), (ii) a n d (iii) o f p a r a g r a p h (e) o f this
R u l e m a y be p la y e d d ur i n g the C lose Season.
      ( c)        M a t c h e s w h i c h m a y be p l a y e d in the C l o s e S e a s o n
      N o m a tc h e s o t h e r tha n the following may be p l a \ e d
d ur i n g the C lose Se a so n: —
           (i) S ma l l s i d e m a t c h e s as s p e c i f i e d in R u l e 15 a n d
      t h o s e o r g a n i s e d in c o n n e c t i o n w i t h w o r k s ' c l u b s s p o r t s
      d a y s o n p r i v a t e g r o u n d s a n d at f e t e s a n d s i m i l a r s p o r t s
      functions.
         (ii) M a t c h e s b e t w e e n A r m y , N a v y a n d R o v a l A i r
     F o r c e t e a m s a n d t e a m s o f t h e A u x i l i a r y F o r c e s in
     C o m p e t i t i o n s w h i l s t in c a m p . S u c h C o m p e t i t i o n s shal l be
     stri c t l y c o n f i n e d t o t h e u n i t s c o n c e r n e d a n d g a t e m o n e y
     shal l n o t b e t a k e n .

     in c a m p .

   (J) Eligibility o f Players
    Players w h o have not previously b e e n reg istered or
recognised playing M e m b e rs of C lub s, o r w h o have not
b e e n e n g a g e d fo r t h e f o l l o w i n g s e a s o n m a y p la y in m a t c h e s
after fifte e n th (15th) Ju ly an d p r io r to th e c o m m e n c e m e n t
of the Season.

    (g) Special Provisions
    (i) T h e A s s o c i a t i o n m a y g r a n t s p e c i a l p e r m i s s i o n f o r
C o m p e t i t i o n a n d o t h e r m a t c h e s t o b e p l a y e d p r e c e d i n g th e
d a te s fixed by the C o u n c il of T h e A sso c ia tio n for the
o p e n i n g o f t h e S e a s o n a n d sh a l l a t t a c h t o t h e g r a n t i n g o f
s u c h p e r m i s s i o n w h a t e v e r c o n d i t i o n s it m a y d e e m
expedient.
   (ii) N o t w i t h s t a n d i n g t h e p r o v i s i o n s o f R u l e 1 1 ( b ) T h e
A s s o c i a t i o n sh a l l d e t e r m i n e in e a c h y e a r t h e d a t e o n w h i c h
and th e financial c o n d itio n s u n d e r w hich T h e F o o tb all
A sso c ia tio n C h a rity S h ie ld m a tc h shall be p la y e d .

C u p m a t c h e s sh a l l b e p l a y e d .

   t h e C l u b ’s o f f e r o f r e - e n g a g e m e n t w i t h i n t h e t i m e li m it
   t h e n t h e o f f e r sh al l a u t o m a t i c a l l y l a p s e a n d t h e C l u b ' s
   c o m p e n s a t i o n r i g h ts sh al l n o t b e a f f e c t e d a n d t h e e x i s t i n g
   a g r e e m e n t sh al l b e d e e m e d to c o n t i n u e f o r t h e f u r t h e r
   p e r i o d o f r e - e n g a g e m e n t s p e c i f i e d in t h e n o t i c e b y t h e
   C lu b a n d o n the te r m s a n d c o n d itio n s o f the existing
   A g r e e m e n t s a v e f o r a n y o p t i o n p r o v i s i o n . If w i t h i n t h e
   p e r i o d o f t w e n t y - e i g h t (2 8 ) d a y s o f r e c e i p t o f t h e n o t i c e
   by th e C lu b m a k in g the o f f e r th e P la y e r notifies th e C lu b

      A Pi a v e r u n d e r w r i t t e n c o n t r a c t m a y o n o r a f t e r first (1 s t )

Rule Relating to Schoolboys and Associated Schoolboys

     (i) P r i o r i t y m u s t at all t i m e s b e g i v e n to s c h o o l o r s c h o o l

22. (a) Qualification
    A P l a y e r w h o is a c i t i z e n o f a c o u n t r y b y v i r t u e o f his b i r t h
o r b y t h e n a t i o n a l i t y o f his f a t h e r o r b y t h e l a w o f t h a t
c o u n t r y w h e r e b y h e h a s o b t a i n e d n a t u r a l i s a t i o n is q u a l i f i e d
to p l a y in I n t e r n a t i o n a l a n d R e p r e s e n t a t i v e t e a m s f o r t h a t
country.

    ( b ) Responsibility o f Selected Players
     A n y P l a y e r s e l e c t e d to a t t e n d a n y I n t e r n a t i o n a l o r o t h e r

( w i t h o u t g o o d a n d s u f f ic i e n t c a u s e ) r e f u s i n g t o c o m p l y w i t h
the a rr a n g e m e n ts o f th e C ouncil for playing the m a tch, or
f a i li n g to a t t e n d s u c h m a t c h , m a y b e a d j u d g e d b y t h e
C o u n c i l to h a v e b e e n g u il ty o f m i s c o n d u c t , a n d a n y C l u b o r
O ff ic ia l w h o m a y b e d e e m e d t o h a v e e n c o u r a g e d o r
in stig ated su c h P la y e r to c o m m it a b r e a c h o f in s tru c tio n o r
r u l e , sh a l l b e d e e m e d g u il ty o f a s i m i l a r o f f e n c e .

    (i) A n y M e m b e r c h a r g e d w i t h m i s c o n d u c t sh al l b e

c h a r g e d . W i t h i n f o u r t e e n (1 4 ) d a y s f r o m t h e p o s t i n g
t h e r e o f t h e M e m b e r s o c h a r g e d sh al l s e n d t o T h e A s s o c i a ­
tion a n a n s w e r t h e r e t o in w r i t i n g a n d t h e a n s w e r m a y b e
a c c o m p a n i e d b y a w r i t t e n a p p l i c a t i o n t h a t s u c h c h a r g e sh al l
be heard before a C om m ission.
    (ii) U p o n r e c e i p t o f s u c h a p p l i c a t i o n t h e C o u n c i l shal l
a p p o i n t a C o m m i s s i o n to d e a l w i t h t h e m a t t e r a n d n o t i f y
th e M e m b e r c h a r g e d o f t h e d a t e a n d p l a c e o f t h e H e a r i n g .
    (iii) T h e M e m b e r c h a r g e d a n d if n e c e s s a r y its D i r e c t o r s
a n d O ff i c ia l s, sh a l l a t t e n d s u c h H e a r i n g a n d gi v e t h e

C o m m i s s i o n or al e v i d e n c e ol th e ta ct s o f th e c h a r g e a n d

c r o s s - e x a m i n a t i o n a n d shall p r o d u c e a nv b o o k s o r p a p e r s
they c o n s i d e r n e c e s s a r y .
    ( i v ) T h e M e m b e r c h a r g e d s h a h h a v e th e right to give

    (J) Notification

consent of T h e A ssociation.

A s s o c i a t i o n o r a n a f f il ia t e d A s s o c i a t i o n . A D i r e c t o r ,

s u m m o n e d to a tte n d a p ersonal h earing , or at a hearing of
a n a p p e a l , c o m p l a i n t , o r c l a i m , o r at a n y e n q u i r y , m u s t

   (ii)       A p p e a l s a g a in s t         D e c is i o n s o f C o u n t y       a n d O ther

the decision of that A p p e a ls B o ard .
   (c) A p p e a l s shaft n o t be e n t e r t a i n e d w ith r e g a r d to

a t e d A s s o c i a t i o n s m a d e in a c c o r d a n c e w ith this R u l e shall
u n d e r t h e R u l e s o f s u c h a ff il ia t e d A s s o c i a t i o n s b e p e r m i t ­

        ( 1) t h e a f f il ia t e d A s s o c i a t i o n fa i le d to give th e a p p e l ­

    ( e ) E v e r y A p p e a l u n d e r this s e c t i o n o f t h e R u l e m u s t be

     U n l e s s t h e C o u n c i l sh all o t h e r w i s e d e t e r m i n e , su c h

       (1 ) to a l lo w o r d is m i s s t h e a p p e a l ;
       ( 2 ) t o v a r y t h e d e c i s i o n o f t h e a f f il ia t e d A s s o c i a t i o n ,
              or
       (3 ) o r d e r a r e - h e a r i n g o f t h e o r i g in a l c a s e b y t h e
            a f f il ia t e d A s s o c i a t i o n o r b y a n o t h e r A s s o c i a t i o n
            w h o s e d e c i s i o n s h a ll b e fin a l a n d b i n d i n g o n all
            p arties.
   F u r t h e r , in t h e e v e n t o f t h e A p p e a l s B o a r d d i s m i s s i n g
th e A p p e a l o r v a r y i n g t h e d e c i s i o n o f t h e a f f i l i a t e d
A s s o c i a t i o n , t h e A p p e a l s B o a r d m a y o r d e r t h e a p p e a l fee
to b e f o r f e i t e d t o w a r d s t h e c o s t s o f t h e B o a r d o f A p p e a l
a n d m a y m a k e a f u r t h e r o r d e r f o r p a y m e n t o f c o s ts .
    A n affiliated A s s o c ia tio n shall n o t b e o r d e r e d to p ay
c o sts, u n l e s s t h e A p p e a l s B o a r d f i n d t h a t it h a s a c t e d
w h o lly u n r e a s o n a b l y a n d / o r f a i l e d t o c o m p l y w i t h t h e
p ro v i s io n s o f t h e M e m o r a n d u m o f P r o c e d u r e s ( s e e p a g e s
316— 3 2 3 ) w h e n d e a l i n g w i t h a c a s e c o n c e r n i n g a l l e g e d
field o f f e n c e s .

C o m p la in ts a n d C la im s by C lu b s a n d P la y e r s
32. ( a ) C o m p la in ts a n d C laim s
    A n y c o m p l a i n t o r c l a i m m a d e b y a C l u b , o r O ff i ci a l o f a
C l u b , o r P l a y e r o r R e f e r e e m u s t b e in w r i t i n g , a n d
d u p l i c a t e c o p i e s m u s t b e s e n t to t h e S e c r e t a r y o f T h e
A sso ciatio n a c c o m p a n ie d by a deposit o f T w enty-five
P o u n d s ( £2 5) w h i c h d e p o s i t m a y b e f o r f e i t e d if t h e
c o m p l a i n t o r c l a i m is n o t s u s t a i n e d .
    In t h e e v e n t o f a f r i v o l o u s o r v e x a t i o u s c o m p l a i n t b e i n g
m a d e o r a c o m p l a i n t n o t b e i n g s u s t a i n e d , t h e C o u n c i l sh a ll
h a v e p o w e r to c o m p e l t h e c o m p l a i n i n g C l u b , O ff i c ia l ,
P lay e r, R e f e r e e o r o th e r re sp o n sib le p e rs o n to p a y such
e x p e n s e s , e i t h e r w i t h o r w i t h o u t a n y o t h e r p e n a l t y , as m a y
be d eem ed appropriate.
     ( b ) N o n - F u lfilm e n t o f M a tch Fixtures
    A n y c o m p la in t relating to th e n o n -fu lfilm e n t o f a m a tc h
fixture, o r claim u n d e r g u a r a n t e e m u s t b e m a d e w ithin
t w e n t y - e i g h t (2 8) d a y s f r o m t h e d a t e u p o n w h i c h t h e m a t c h
w as p la y e d , o r s h o u ld h a v e b e e n p la y e d , unless special
g r o u n d s a r e s h o w n fo r d e l a y .
     (c) C laim s b y Players a b o u t W a ges o r E x p e n se s
   All claims by P layers against C lu b s fo r w ag es o r e x p e n s e s
m u s t b e s u b m i t t e d t o T h e A s s o c i a t i o n w i t h i n t h r e e (3)
m o n t h s of the te rm in a tio n o f th e A g r e e m e n t to w h ich they
refer, unless special g r o u n d s a re s h o w n fo r th e delay.

       (v i)         Winding-up o fth e C om pany — O n th e w in d in g - u p

   sh ares r e s p e c t iv e l y , a n d if su c h a s s e ts shall b e in s u ffic ie n t
   to r e p a y th e sa id a m o u n t in fu ll, t h e y shall b e a p p lie d
   r a te a b ly , s o th a t th e lo s s sh all fall u p o n th e M e m b e r s in
   p r o p o r tio n to th e a m o u n t c a lle d u p o n th eir sh a r e s
   r e s p e c t iv e ly a n d n o M e m b e r sh all b e e n t it le d to h a v e an y
   call u p o n o t h e r M e m b e r s fo r th e p u r p o s e o f a d ju stin g his

   paid b y s o m e o f th e M e m b e r s su c h call b e e n f o r c e d
   ag ain st th e r e m a in in g M e m b e r s fo r th e p u r p o s e o f
   a d ju stin g th e rights o f th e M e m b e r s b e t w e e n t h e m s e lv e s .

  R U L E S, R E G U L A T IO N S AND LA W S O F T H E G A M E

35.    (a ) A l t e r a t i o n s to R i d e s
     T h e C o u n c i l m a y m a k e a l t e r a t i o n s t o t h e s e R u l e s as a n d
w h e n c o n s i d e r e d n e c e s s a r y , s o as t o c o n f o r m to a n y
a l t e r a t i o n s to t h e M e m o r a n d u m o r A r t i c l e s o f A s s o c i a t i o n
of T h e A ssociation. A ny proposal to alter the M e m o r a n ­
d u m o r A r t i c l e s o f A s s o c i a t i o n o r R u l e s sh a ll r e q u i r e t h e
a p p r o v a l o f T h e A s s o c i a t i o n in G e n e r a l M e e t i n g b y a
R e so lu tio n o f T h e A ssociation passed by a m a jo rity of not
less t h a n t h r e e f o u r t h s (j) o f t h e M e m b e r s fo r t h e t i m e b e i n g
e n t i t l e d to v o t e w h o m a y be p r e s e n t in p e r s o n o r b y p r o x y .

  (b) Form s
  T h e C o u n c i l shal l s e t t l e t h e F o r m s r e q u i r e d by t h e s e
Rules.

     (r) Regulations
     T h e C o u n c i l shal l h a v e th e p o w e r to m a k e s u c h R u l e s
and R eg u latio n s d e e m e d necessary to p ro v id e for m atters
a r i s i n g f r o m o r t o i m p l e m e n t t h e s e R u l e s in so f a r as a n v
                        RULES OF THE ASSOCIATION                                        71


su ch R u l e o r R e g u la t i o n is n o t in c o n flic t w ith a n y R u l e o f
T h e A s s o c i a t io n . C o u n t y A s s o c i a t i o n s a n d C lu b s in
M e m b e r s h ip w ith T h e A s s o c i a t i o n sh all b e d e e m e d t o h a v e
k n o w l e d g e o f a n d b e b o u n d b y th e sa id R u l e o r R e g u l a t i o n
if th e s a m e shall h a v e b e e n p u b li s h e d in th e M i n u t e s o f th e
C o u n c il, th e p r o d u c t i o n o f w h ic h sh all c o n s t it u t e at all
tim e s u n d is p u t e d p r o o f o f th e v a lid ity o f su c h R u l e or
R e g u la t i o n .

   (d ) Rules and Regulations Concerning Cup C o m p e ­
      titions and Officials
   T h e C o u n c il are a u th o r is e d to m a k e su c h R u l e s a n d
R e g u la t i o n s w ith r e f e r e n c e to th e C u p C o m p e t i t io n s a n d
O ffic ia ls o f th e G a m e , as th e y m a y d e e m e x p e d ie n t .

   (e) Laws o fth e Game
    T h e L a w s o f th e G a m e a s a m e n d e d at th e m e e t i n g o f th e
In te r n a tio n a l F o o t b a ll A s s o c i a t i o n B o a r d in J u n e in e a c h
y e a r shall c o m e in t o f o r c e o n a n d after tw e n ty -f ift h (2 5 t h )
July f o l lo w in g e a c h A n n u a l M e e t i n g o f th e B o a r d .

     (b) O n any such subm ission o r re f e re n c e , th e C ouncil

r e f e r re d to th e Council w h e re th e y are o b lig e d to be

q u estion s d o not con cern any decision of th e C ouncil.

thereto an d w ith th e fo l lo w in g p r o v is io n s :—

      Memorandum of Association of
    THE FOOTBALL ASSOCIATION,
              LIMITED

    1. T h e n am e of the A sso ciatio n is “ T H E F O O T B A L L
A SSO C IA T IO N , L IM IT E D .”
   2. T h e R eg istered Office o f th e A ssociatio n will be situate in
E ngland.
   3. T h e o b je c ts fo r w hich th e A sso cia tion is established
a re :—
    (1) to a c q u ire a n d u n d e r t a k e th e p ro p e r tie s a n d liabilities
a n d to e ffectu ate a n d c a r r y in to e x ecu tio n the po w ers,
ob lig atio n s, duties, a n d g e n e ra l o b je c ts o f th e p re s e n t
F o o tb a ll A s s o c i a ti o n ;
    (2) to p r o m o t e th e g a m e o f A s s o c i a ti o n F o o tb a l l in every
w a y in w h ic h the A s s o c ia tio n o r the C o u n c il o f the
A s s o c ia tio n shall thin k p r o p e r , a n d to ta k e all su c h step s as
shall b e d e e m e d n e c e s s a ry or a d v isa b le for p rev e n tin g
in frin g e m en ts o f th e R u les a n d L a w s o f the G a m e , o r o th e r
im p r o p e r m e th o d s o r p ra c tic e s in s u c h g a m e , a n d for
p ro te c tin g it fr o m a b u s e s ;
     (3) to m a k e , a d o p t, v a r y , a n d p u b lish R u le s, R eg u la tio n s,
B y e -L a w s a n d C o n d it io n s for th e re g u la tio n o f th e sa id g a m e
o r o th e rw ise, a n d to ta k e all su c h step s as shall be d e e m e d
n e c e s s a r y o r a d v isab le for e n fo rcin g s u c h R u le s, R e g u la tio n s ,
B y e -L a w s a n d C o n d itio n s ;
     (4) to m a in ta in , c o n tin u e, o r p ro v id e for th e affiliation o f
A sso ciation s a n d C lub s fo r p ro m o tin g o r playing A ssociation
F ootball, an d to ta k e o v e r an d con tin u e the p r e s e n t Register of
such A ssociatio ns an d C lub s as k e p t by T h e F ootball
A s so c ia tio n ;

p re s e n t R egisters o f such P layers as k e p t by T h e F ootball
A s s o c ia tio n ;
     (6) to ta k e ov er a n d c o n tin u e with su c h v a ria tio n s as from
time to tim e m a y be decided, either by th e A s s o c ia tio n o r the
C oun cil, all the R u le s, R eg isters, B o o k s, A c c o u n t s a n d o th e r
d o c u m e n ts o f T h e F o o tb a l l A s s o c ia tio n ;
     (7) to p r o m o te , p ro v id e for, reg u late a n d m a n a g e in all or
a n y o f th e re q u ire d details o r a r r a n g e m e n t s , inc luding any
a r r a n g e m e n t s for th e benefit o f A s s o c i a ti o n s o r C lu b s,
F o o tb a ll C o m p e t it io n s , C o n te s t s an d M a t c h e s , In te rn a tio n a l
or o th e rw ise, an d in E n g la n d o r elsew here, an d to d o or
prov id e fo r all o r an y su c h m a tte r s an d th in g s as m a y be
c o n sid e re d n e c e s s a r y for or ancillary to the c o m fo rt, c o n d u c t,

Public, or o f a n y o th e r p e rs o n s c o n c e r n e d o r e n g a g e d in su ch
C o m p e titio n s , C o n te s t s o r M a t c h e s ;
     (8) to a c c e p t, ta k e over, o r o th e rw ise a c q u ire all suc h
C u p s , Shields a n d o th e r P rizes as m a y be a p p r o v e d by the

p ro tec tio n , exhibition, aw a rd in g , distribu tio n o r loa n o f or
o th e r d ealing w ith all or an y suc h C u p s , Shields, o r Prizes as
aforesaid;
     (9) to p ro v id e for re p r e s e n ta tio n at the G e n e ra l M eeting s,
an d on the C o u n c il, o f Affiliated A s s o c i a ti o n s a n d C lu b s by
the issue a n d tr a n s fe r o f sh a r e s in th e C a p ita l o f the
A s so cia tio n , o r by su c h o th e r m e a n s a n d in su ch m a n n e r as
shall be d e t e rm i n e d from tim e to tim e by the R ules,
R e g u la tio n s o r B y e -L a w s o f the A s s o c i a ti o n ;
     (10) to p ro v id e for, m a k e a n d v a ry all su c h R ules,
R egulations, an d B y e -L aw s as to A m a te u r and P rofessional
P layers as th e A ssociation o r Council shall fro m tim e to time
de term ine;
    (11) to p ro v id e b y R ules, R e g u la tio n s, a n d B y e -L aw s , or
oth erw ise, for deciding an d setting all differences th a t m ay arise
betw e en F ootball A ssociations, C lubs, or Players, o r any
p e rs o n s w ho a re M e m b e r s o f or alleged to be M e m b e r s o f or

or an y o th e r p e r s o n s in referen ce to d u e c o m p lia n c e with the
L a w s o f the G a m e , or th e R ules, R e g u la tio n s , or B y e -L a w s o f

the A s s o c i a t i o n , o r in r e f e r e n c e to c o n t r a c t s , o r to a n y o th e r

     (12) to c o -o p e r a te w ith o r assist an y F o o tb a ll A s s o c ia tio n

    (13) to c o - o p e r a te w ith th e                       I n te rn a tio n a l F o o tb a ll

    (14)          to a d o p t a n d c a r r y o u t              all su c h R ules a n d
Regulations, B y e-L a w s , A g r e e m e n t s a n d A r r a n g e m e n ts o f

 ac corda nce w ith the te rm s the reo f, o r with the R e g u la tio n s
for the tim e being o f th e A s s o c i a ti o n ;
    ( 15) to a c q u ire , lay o u t, im p ro v e , hold, use, o r tu r n to
acco u n t in an y w a y F o o tb a l l G r o u n d s o r o th e r A thletic
G r o u n d s , w ith all su c h P a vilio ns, B uildings, E re ctio n s an d
E asem en ts, a n d w ith all n e c e s s a ry fittings a n d ac cess o ries as
the C o u n c il shall d e e m a dv isable;
    (16) to p r o m o te , s u p p o r t, o r assist in all o r a n y su c h
athletic c o n te sts o r s p o r ts fo r w h ic h an y p r o p e r ty o f T h e
A sso c ia tio n m a y b e a vailable, o r w h ich m a y be d e te rm in e d
on or a p p ro v e d b y th e C o u n c il;
    (17) to a c t as T r u s t e e s fo r a n y A s s o c ia tio n o r C lu b s, a n d
as su c h T ru s te e s to h o ld a n y real or p e rs o n a l p ro p e r ty u p o n
such tr u sts a n d w ith an d sub ject to su c h p o w e rs an d
pro visions as shall be a p p r o v e d b y the C o u n c il;
    (18) to s u b sc rib e o u t o f th e fu n d s o f T h e A s s o c ia tio n to
an y such F u n d , C lu b , or Institution , ch arita b le o r o therw ise
a n d in su c h m a n n e r as th e C o u n c il shall dee m advisable;
    (19) to a m a lg a m a te , o r c o -o p e r a te with an y A s so cia tio n ,
C lu b, o r B o dy hav in g all o r a n y o f their objects similar to an y
o f the o b je c ts o f T h e A s so c ia tio n ;

     (20) to c a r r y o u t such o p e r a t io n s a n d to m a n u f a c t u r e or
deal with such g o o d s and to p u r c h a s e o r o th e rw is e acquire,

alter, develop, e x c h a n g e o r deal with su ch p r o p e r t y , rights or

p ro p e r ty o r liabilities o f a n y o th e r p e rs o n o r c o m p a n y ) as
m a y seem to the C ou nc il directly o r indirectly to a d v a n c e the
interests o f T h e A s s o c i a ti o n ;
     (21) to c a r r y on any o t h e r tr a d e o r b us in ess w h a te v e r
w hich, in the opin io n o f the C ou nci l, c a n be a d v a n t a g e o u s ly

me n ti o n e d bu sine sses o r is ca lc ula te d directly o r indirectly to
a d v a n c e the interests o f T h e A s s o c i a ti o n ;

m a y se em desi rab le to the C o u n ci l for the p u r p o s e o f T h e
A s s o c i a t i o n ’s affairs;
     (23) to apply for, p u r c h a s e or o th e rw is e acquire, pro te ct ,
m a in ta in a n d rene w a ny p at en ts , p at en t rights, tr a d e m a rk s ,

so ac q ui re d :

Exclu sion of T a b le A
   1. T h e pr ov is io ns o f T a b l e A o f th e C o m p a n i e s A c t s . 1862
to 1985 shall n o t a ppl y to T h e A s s o c i a ti o n , b u t in lieu t h e r e o f
the fo ll ow ing shall b e th e Arti cle s of A s s o c i a ti o n .

I n t e r p r e t a t i o n C lau se

Share Capital and Membership
    3. T h e s h a r e C a p i t a l co n sists o f o n e h u n d r e d p o u n d s
(£100) d iv id e d in to tw o t h o u s a n d (2 ,0 0 0 ) s h a r e s o f five (5)
p e n c e e a c h . N o p a r t o f t h e s a i d s h a r e C a p i t a l sh a ll b e ca lle d o r
p a id u p w ith o u t t h e p r e v i o u s sa n c tio n o f T h e A s s o c i a ti o n in
G e n e r a l M e e t i n g . N o s h a r e sh all e n t itl e t h e h o l d e r t h e r e o f to
an y p a y m e n t in r e s p e c t o f p a i d - u p c a p ita l (if a n y ) , d iv i d e d ,
b o n u s , p ro fit, o r o t h e r w i s e .

   4. N o in v ita tio n t o t h e p u b li c t o s u b s c r ib e f o r s h a r e s in t h e
said C a p it a l sh all b e is su e d w i t h o u t t h e s a n c t io n o f a S p e c ia l
R e s o lu t io n o f T h e A s s o c i a ti o n .

ca pi tal d i v i d e n d be paid.

a n d shall on such t r a n s fe r be en t it l e d to b e p a i d by the
t r a n s f e r e e t h a t a m o u n t (if any) at t h e ti m e o f such t r a n s f e r paid
up on such s h ar es an d if no a m o u n t shall at t h a t ti m e be so paid
up th e n shall n o t b e e n t it l e d to any p a y m e n t .
     (c) W h e r e a p e r s o n w h o h o ld s a s h a r e as R e p r e s e n t a t i v e of
a n affiliated A ss o ci at i o n cea ses to be a m e m b e r o f th a t

General Meetings
     16. E v e r y n o ti c e c o n v e n i n g a m e e t i n g shall c o m p l y w ith
the p ro v isio n s o f S e c tio n 372 o f t h e A c t , as to givin g such
i n f o rm a tio n to M e m b e r s in r e g a r d to t h e i r r i g h t to a p p o i n t

any M e e t in g w h ic h a n y M e m b e r is e n t i t l e d to r e c e i v e sh all b e
sent to th e A u d i t o r fo r th e ti m e b e i n g o f T h e A s s o c i a ti o n .

 18. O fficers
     T h e n a m e s o f p r o p o s e d O fficers, w ith th e n a m e s o f th e ir
p r o p o s e r s a n d s e c o n d e r s , shall b e s e n t to th e S e c r e t a r y n o t
l a te r t h a n sixty (60) d a y s p r i o r to t h e d a t e f ix ed f o r t h e A n n u a l
G e n e r a l M e e t i n g in e a c h year.

19. B u s in e s s — P r o p o s a l s a n d A m e n d m e n t s
     (a) N o tic e o f a n y b u s i n e s s ( o t h e r t h a n E l e c t i o n o f O fficers
a n d t h e c o n s i d e r a t i o n o f th e R e p o r t o f th e C o u n c i l ) to be
s u b m i t t e d a t t h e A n n u a l G e n e r a l M e e t i n g shall b e g iv e n to th e
S e c r e t a r y n o t l a te r t h a n sixty (60) d ay s p r i o r to th e d a t e fixed
f o r th e A n n u a l G e n e r a l M e e t i n g in e a c h y e a r a n d a c o p y o f
su ch n o ti c e , w ith th e n a m e s o f th e p r o p o s e r a n d s e c o n d e r ,
shall b e s e n t to all affil ia ted A s s o c i a ti o n s a n d Fu ll M e m b e r
C lu b s n o t l a te r t h a n fift y-tw o (52) d a y s p r i o r to th e d a t e so
fixed. N o t i c e o f a n y A m e n d m e n t to t h e b u s i n e s s to b e
s u b m i t t e d shall b e giv en to t h e S e c r e t a r y n o t l a t e r th a n
th i rt y -s e v e n (3 7 ) d a y p r i o r to th e d a t e so fixed.
     (b) T h e C o u n c i l , w h e n e v e r t h e y t h i n k fit o r w h e r e so
r e q u i r e d p u r s u a n t to t h e p r o v isio n s o f t h e A c t , shall c o n v e n e
an E x t r a o r d i n a r y G e n e r a l M e e t i n g f o r t h e p u r p o s e o f c o n ­
s i d e rin g such m a t t e r s as m a y p r o p e r l y b e s u b m i t t e d a t su ch
M e e t in g .
     (c) All b u s i n e s s shall b e d e e m e d sp ecial t h a t is t r a n s a c t e d at
a d u ly c o n v e n e d E x t r a o r d i n a r y G e n e r a l M e e t i n g ( a n d su ch
b u s i n e s s m a y in c lu d e an y p r o p o s e d a l t e r a t i o n in th e R u le s
a p p r o v e d o r r e c o m m e n d e d b y the. C o u n c i l ) a n d all b u sin e ss
shall b e d e e m e d sp ecial t h a t is t r a n s a c t e d a t a d u ly c o n v e n e d
A n n u a l G e n e r a l M e e t i n g w ith t h e e x c e p t i o n o f th e
a p p o i n t m e n t o f th e A u d i t o r s , a n d t h e c o n s i d e r a t i o n o f th e
A c c o u n t s a n d B a l a n c e S h e e t s , a n d o f t h e R e p o r t o f th e
C o u n c il , a n d o f a n y p r o p o s e d a l t e r a t i o n in th e R u l e s o f T h e
A s s o c i a ti o n a p p r o v e d o r r e c o m m e n d e d b y th e C o u n c il.
     (d) If t h e b u s in e s s o f th e E x t r a o r d i n a r y G e n e r a l M e e t i n g
in c lu d es a n a l t e r a t i o n o f th e R u l e s o f T h e A s s o c i a t i o n
a p p r o v e d o r r e c o m m e n d e d b y th e C o u n c il , t h e n u p o n th e
C o u n c il d e t e r m i n i n g th e d a t e o f su ch M e e t i n g t h e S e c r e t a r y
shall b e in s t r u c t e d to give n o t less t h a n fift y-tw o (52) day s

preliminary n otice to all affiliated A sso c ia tio n s and Full
M em b ers Clubs o f the d ate s o d e te rm in ed and shall set o u t in
such prelim inary n o tice the nature o f such p r o p o se d alteration
o f the R ules.
   (,e) N o tic e o f any a m e n d m e n t to such p r o p o se d alterations
o f the R u le s shall b e giv e n to the Secretary n o t less than
thirty-seven (37) days prior to that d ate fixed for th e E x tra ­
ordinary G e n e r a l M ee tin g .

20.   Notice and Agenda
   (a) T h e Secretary shall s u b seq u e n tly give tw e n ty -o n e (21)
clear days’ n o tice to all M e m b e r s o f T h e A s s o c ia tio n o f the
place, the d ay and the h o u r o f ea c h A n n u a l G en e ra l M e e tin g
or Extraordinary G e n e r a l M e e tin g . Such n o tice shall b e
d e e m e d to h ave b e e n duly g iv e n to any R e p r e se n ta tiv e if sent
to the affiliated A s so c ia tio n or M e m b e r C lub o f w hich h e is a
R ep resen ta tive. T h e A g e n d a specifying the nature o f the
business to b e transacted at such M e e tin g shall ac co m p a n y th e
last m e n tio n e d n otice.
    ( b ) In the case o f special b u sin ess the gen eral nature o f such
business shall b e giv e n to th e M e m b e r s as required by the A c t ,
or any statutory m od ifica tion or r e-en ac tm en t th er eo f b e fo r e
every G e n e r a l M e e tin g . T h e n on -r ec eip t o f n otice b y any
person en titled to re ceiv e n o tice shall n o t invalidate the
pro ceed in gs at any G e n e ra l M e e tin g .

R e so lu tion o f T h e A s so c ia tio n p a sse d by a m ajority o f n o t less
than three-fourths (|) o f th e m e m b e r s for the tim e b ein g
entitled to v o te w h o m ay b e p resen t in person or by proxy.

a L ife -M e m b er shall b e called a L ife V ice-P resid en t.

h e c e a se to b e a m e m b e r o f the C o u n cil by reason o f his
b ec o m in g a L ife M e m b e r or a L ife V ice-P resid en t.

    T h e W o m e n ’s F ootball A sso c ia tio n shall b e d e e m e d to be a

to tim e be d e e m e d appropriate.

such R ep r ese n tativ es m ay not be ch a n g ed e x c e p t w ith the
con sen t o f th e C o u n c il.

      Z ea la n d .

D ivision o r A ffiliated A s s o c i a ti o n b y w h ich h e w a s e l e c t e d or
the C o m m ittee of M an ag em en t of T he Football L eague,
L im it e d , as th e case m a y b e shall h a v e p o w e r to elec t a n e w
R e p r e s e n t a t i v e in his p la ce.


    40. T h e A ffa i rs o f T h e A s s o c i a ti o n shall b e g o v e r n e d by
th e C o u n c il w h o m a y a u t h o r is e all su ch acts a n d th e e x e rc is e o f
all such p o w e r s o f T h e A s s o c i a ti o n b y th e M e m b e r s o f th e
C o u n c il, o n w h o m e x e c u tiv e m a n a g e m e n t p o w e r s a re c o n ­
f e r r e d as d ir e c to r s , as m a y b e r e q u i r e d to give effe c t to t h e
o b j e c t s as d e s c r ib e d in t h e p ro v i s io n s o f th e M e m o r a n d u m o f
A s s o c i a ti o n , a n d w h ich a r e n o t b y s t a t u t e r e q u i r e d to b e d o n e
o r e x e rc ise d b y T h e A s s o c i a ti o n in G e n e r a l M e e t in g .


   41. (a) T h e r e shall b e a m a x i m u m o f six ( 6 ) e l e c te d
V ic e - P r e s id e n t s o f th e A s s o c i a ti o n w h o shall b e e l e c t e d in th e
m a n n e r p e r m i t t e d by A rti c le 42 o f th e s e A rticle s .
  (b) T h e P r e s i d e n t o f T h e F o o t b a l l L e a g u e , L i m i t e d shall be
ex-officio a n a d d i tio n a l V i c e - P r e s i d e n t o f T h e A s s o c i a ti o n .
     (c) T h e C o u n c il shall el ect by ballo t a n n u a l l y a C h a i r - m a n
a n d a V ic e - C h a i r m a n f r o m M e m b e r s o f th e C o u n c il. If th e
C h a i r m a n a n d / o r V ic e - C h a i r m a n o f t h e C o u n c il d o n o t
a l r e a d y h o ld office o f V ic e - P r e s i d e n t o f T h e A s s o c i a t i o n th e
C o u n c il shall h a v e p o w e r to a p p o i n t t h e m as V i c e - P r e s i d e n t s
in a d d itio n to t h e V ic e - P r e s id e n t s r e f e r r e d to in p a r a g r a p h s (a)
a n d ( b ) o f this A rtic le . A n y p e r s o n a p p o i n t e d a V ic e - P r e s i d e n t
by th e C o u n c il p u r s u a n t h e r e t o shall h o ld office as V ic e-
P r e s id e n t as lo n g as h e c o n t in u e s as C h a i r m a n o r V ice -
C h a i r m a n o f t h e C o u n c il o r, if e a r l ie r , u n til b e b e c o m e s a L ife
V ic e - P r e s id e n t u n d e r A rti c le 3 6(b ).


   42. T h e P r e s i d e n t a n d t h e V ic e - P r e s id e n t s r e f e r r e d to in
p a r a g r a p h 41 (a) of th e s e A rtic le s shall be e l e c t e d a n n u a l ly at
th e A n n u a l G e n e r a l M e e t in g .


    43. (a) R e t i r i n g M e m b e r s o f th e C o u n c il sh all b e eligible
fo r r e - e le c tio n . E l e c t e d O fficers a n d R e p r e s e n t a t i v e s shall
c o n t in u e in office until th e ir su ccesso rs a r e d u ly a p p o i n t e d .
                      ARTICLES OF ASSOCIATION                              99


   (ib ) S ectio n 293 o f the A c t, relating to the retirem en t o f
Directors by reason o f their h aving attained th e age o f sev en ty
(70) years or any o th er age and any statutory m od ifica tion or
re-en actm en t th e r e o f for the tim e b ein g in force shall n o t apply
to T h e A ssoc ia tion .


   44.      B e t w e e n tw en tieth (20th) and thirty-first (31st) M a y in
each year a m ee tin g o f the Officers shall be h e ld to divide the
area c ov ered by the C lubs in Full M e m b er sh ip with T h e
A sso ciatio n into ten (10) divisions.

  (a) Nomination o f Candidates—Form ‘F’
   T h e Secretary shall im m e d ia te ly after the m e e tin g held
according to this A rticle send a form o f n o m in a tio n with a list
o f all the D iv isio n s an d the C lubs co m p o s in g th em , to each
Club in Full M em b er sh ip with T h e A s so c ia tio n , and such form
shall be duly c o m p le te d and returned to th e Secretary o n or
before a date to b e therein n a m ed n ot b ein g less than sev e n (7)
nor m ore than fou rteen (1 4 ) days after the d ate u p o n which the
sam e shall b e so sent by th e Secretary.
  E very ca ndidate shall b e n o m in a te d by three (3) C lu b s on
the form m arked ‘F ’.
  Such no m in atio n shall b e sign ed by the C hairm an or
Secretary o f each Club for and on b eh a lf o f the Club.
  If o n ly o n e (1) can d id ate is n o m in a te d for a D iv is io n , the
Secretary shall declare h im e lected .

   (b) Voting
   If m ore than o n e (1 ) ca ndidate is n o m in a ted for any
D ivision the Secretary shall forthwith, after the tim e fixed for
the close o f n o m in atio n s, sen d a list o f the candidates
n om inated and a form o f votin g paper to ea ch C lub in every
such D iv isio n , and such vo tin g paper shall be duly filled up and
returned to the Secretary n ot later than ten (10) days after the
date upon which the sa m e shall be sen t by the Secretary. E v ery
such votin g paper shall b e m ark ed on the o u tsid e “ V o tin g
Paper” and shall b e o p e n e d o n ly by the R etu rn in g O fficer, or
his D e p u ty . T h e P resident shall b e the R etu rn in g Officer, and
he m ay appoint a D ep u ty .
100                          AR TICLES OF A S S O C IA T IO N



   (c) Counting Votes
     T h e R e t u r n i n g O fficer o r his D e p u t y shall, im m e d i a t e l y
aft e r th e d a t e fixed f o r t h e r e t u r n o f V o t i n g P a p e r s , o p e n an d
e x a m i n e su c h V o tin g P a p e r s . W h e r e t h e r e a r e tw o (2)
c a n d i d a t e s fo r any D iv is io n, th e c a n d i d a t e re c e iv in g th e
g r e a t e r n u m b e r o f v ote s shall b e d e c l a r e d d u ly e l e c te d . If t h e r e
is a ti e, t h e electio n shall b e d e t e r m i n e d b y a v o te o f th e
M e m b e r s p r e s e n t at t h e first m e e t i n g o f s u c h M e m b e r s o f th e
C o u n c il , as shall h a v e b e e n d u ly e l e c t e d . W h e r e t h e r e a re
m o r e t h a n tw o (2) c a n d i d a t e s f o r an y D iv is io n , un le ss o n e (1)
c a n d i d a t e h a s an a b s o l u te m a j o r i t y o f v o te s c ast in th e
D iv is io n , th e c a n d i d a t e receiv in g th e le a st n u m b e r o f v o te s
shall r e tir e . T h e D iv is io n shall b e p o l l e d ag a i n until t h e r e is
e i t h e r a n a b s o l u te m a jo r i ty o r a tie.

   (d) Bribery
    N e i t h e r a c a n d i d a t e n o r an y p e r s o n o r C l u b , o n b e h a l f o f
a n y c a n d i d a t e , shall o ff e r an y b r i b e , c o n s i d e r a t i o n o r o t h e r
i m p r o p e r i n d u c e m e n t to a n y C l u b fo r t h e p u r p o s e o f p r o c u r in g
t h e v o te o f t h e said C l u b in t h e electio n o f su c h c a n d i d a t e to
t h e C o u n cil. B r e a c h o f this R u l e shall b e d e e m e d serio us
m i s c o n d u c t . In a d d i tio n to a n y o t h e r p e n a l t y w h ic h th e
C o u n c il m a y d e e m fit to im p o s e , th is o f f e n c e shall r e n d e r void
t h e e le c tio n o f su ch c a n d i d a t e , if h e shall h a v e b e e n e l e c t e d a
M e m b e r o f th e C o u n c i l .

    (<?) Objection
    In case o f an o b j e c t i o n to a n y e l e c t i o n t h e C o u n c il m a y
o r d e r a n e w el e c ti o n , o r fill u p a v a c a n c y i n s t e a d o f o r d e r i n g a
n e w e le c tio n if th e y shall th i n k p r o p e r .
    (f) N o Nom ination
   If in a n y D iv is io n no c a n d i d a t e is n o m i n a t e d t h e S e c r e t a r y
shall r e p o r t t h e c irc u m s ta n c e s to th e C o u n c il w h o m a y fill th e
v acan cy .


    45.            A n y A s s o c i a ti o n o r C l u b p la y in g A s s o c i a ti o n F o o tb a l l
a n d b e i n g o th e rw ise q u alified a c c o r d i n g to t h e R u le s o f T h e
A s s o c i a t i o n , m a y if t h e C o u n c il t h i n k fit, b e aff iliated to T h e
A s s o c i a t i o n b y th e C o u n cil.

    46. T h e C o u n c i l shall also h a v e p o w e r t o a p p o i n t a n n u a l l y
H o n o r a r y V i c e - P r e s i d e n t s a n d n o t m o r e t h a n e i g h t (8)
H o n o r a r y M e m b e r s o f T h e A s s o c i a t i o n w h o shall b y v ir tu e
t h e r e o f n o t h a v e a n y v o t e a n d shall n o t b e e n t i t l e d t o a t t e n d
m e e ti n g s o f t h e C o u n c il . T h e y shall b e e n t i t l e d to a t t e n d
M e e t in g s o f T h e A s s o c i a t i o n b u t shall n o t b y v i r t u e t h e r e o f b e
e n t itl e d to v o t e t h e r e a t . N o s h a r e q u a lific a tio n sh all at a n y
tim e b e r e q u i r e d o f t h e m .

   47. N o share qualification shall b e required fo r th e e l e c ­
tion o f a M e m b e r o f th e C o u n c il, but from and after first (1st)
S ep tem b er in ea ch year (or such later d a te as in special
circumstances th e C o u n cil m a y r eso lv e to b e ap p ro p riate), no
person e le c te d such M e m b e r shall b e qualified to v o t e at a
m eetin g o f th e C ouncil un less or until h e shall h av e b e e n
registered as the h old er o f o n e (1) share in the Capital o f T h e
A ssociation .

  48. Subject to A r tic le 47, at m e etin g s o f th e C oun cil each
M em b er th e r e o f resp ectiv ely shall h av e o n e (1) v o t e and the
Chairman shall h a ve a se c o n d or casting v o te in any case w h e r e
the v otes w o u ld o th e rw is e b e equal.

   49. T h e C ouncil shall h a v e full p o w e r to d e ter m in e in what
m anner and w ith w hat form alities all or any o f the R e p r e s e n ta ­
tives aforesaid, either fo r th e G e n era l M ee tin g s or the
C ouncil, shall b e e le c te d or registered.

   50. T h e C oun cil m a y fill any vacancy that occurs in their
b od y, appoint a Secretary and such o th er assistance as th ey
think fit, a p p oin t such C o m m itte e s or C o m m issio n s as th ey
m ay consider n ecessa ry , d e le g a te all or any o f their p o w e rs to
any such C o m m itte e or C o m m issio n o f the C o u n c il, or to any
affiliated A sso c ia tio n or A s so c ia tio n s, and m a k e such regu la ­
tions for th e m a n a g e m e n t o f T h e A sso c ia tio n and control o f
the G a m e as from tim e to tim e m a y b e necessary.

   51. T h e C ouncil m a y fix their o w n resp ective q u o ru m s,
and until oth erw ise p ro v id e d , th ree (3 ) M e m b er s person ally
p resent shall fo r m a qu oru m .

     56. N o M e m b e r o f t h e C o u n c il shall b e e n t i t l e d to receiv e
 an y r e m u n e r a t i o n in r e s p e c t o f his office as su ch M e m b e r o r as
 an e m p l o y e e o f T h e A s s o c i a t i o n b u t h e shall b e e n t i t l e d to be
 r e p a i d an y d i s b u r s e m e n t s , tr a v e llin g o r o t h e r e x p e n s e s
 p r o p e r l y i n c u r r e d b y h i m in th e p e r f o r m a n c e o f his d u tie s.

   57. T h e office o f a M e m b e r o f th e C o u n c il shall be
 vacated:—
    (a) if h e b e c o m e s b a n k r u p t o r in s o lv e n t o r c o m p o u n d s w ith
 his c re d i to r s ;
    (b) if h e b e c o m e s o f u n s o u n d m i n d ;
     (c) if h e ceases to h o l d t h e n e c e ss a ry s h a r e q u a lific a tio n or
 d o e s n o t o b t a i n th e s a m e by first (1st) S e p t e m b e r fo llo w in g th e
 d a t e h e is m a d e a M e m b e r o f t h e C o u n c i l ( o r su c h l a t e r d a t e as
 in special c i r c u m s ta n c e s th e C o u n c il m a y re s o lv e to be
 appropriate);
      (d) if h e a b s e n t s h im s e l f f r o m its m e e t i n g s f o r a p e r i o d o f six
 ( 6 ) c a l e n d a r m o n t h s w i t h o u t t h e w r i t t e n c o n s e n t o f the
 C o u n c il u n d e r th e h a n d o f its S e c r e t a r y ;
      (e) if h e b e c o m e s p r o h i b i t e d f r o m b e i n g a D i r e c t o r by
  r e a s o n o f an y o r d e r m a d e u n d e r th e p r o v i s io n s o f th e
 C o m p a n y D i r e c t o r s D is q u a l if ic a t io n A c t , 1986, o r a n y like or
  a m e n d i n g leg is lati o n ;

  (/) if he gives the C ouncil o n e (1) m o n t h ’s n o tic e in writing
that h e resigns his office;
   (g) if he b e su sp e n d ed from taking part in F o o tb a ll and/or
F ootball m a n a g e m e n t.
   But any act d o n e in g o o d faith by a M e m b e r o f th e C ouncil
w hose office is vacated as aforesaid shall b e valid un less, prior

upon T h e A sso c ia tio n or an entry m a d e in the M in u te B o o k
stating that the M e m b e r has cea sed to b e a M e m b e r o f the
Council.

   58. A ll acts d o n e by any m e etin g o f th e C oun cil or by any
person acting as a M e m b e r o f the C oun cil shall, n otw ith stan d ­
ing that it b e afterwards discovered that there w as s o m e defect
in the a p p o in tm en t o f any person so acting or that any person
so acting w a s disqualified, b e as valid as if such p erso n had
b een duly ap p o in ted and qualified.

   59. N o act, m atter or thing within the p o w e r o f T h e
A ssociation in G en e ra l M e e tin g d o n e by the C ouncil or d o n e
by any C o m m itte e or C om m issio n and a d o p te d by th e C ouncil
which shall afterwards receive th e exp ress or im p lied co n sen t
of T h e A sso cia tion in G en e ra l M e e tin g shall b e afterwards
im p eached on any grou n d w hatever.

  60. A n y C o m m itte e or C o m m issio n shall co n fo rm to any
m o d e o f p roceed in g s and regulations w hich th e C ouncil may
make in that b eh alf, and subject th ereto m ay d eterm in e and
regulate their o w n p ro c ee d in gs, in th e sa m e m an n er as the
Council m ay do.


Reference to Arbitration
  61.      T h e C ouncil shall m a k e d u e p rovision for settling
differences and disputes and m ay ap p oin t such C o m m itte e s or
C om m issions or o th er p erso n s as m ay b e appropriate for
considering and determ in in g th e sa m e and m a k e R u le s and
Regulations as to all p ro ceed in gs in r eferen ce th ereto or to
previous provisions o f th es e A rticles and as to enforcing any
awards or decisions.

    62.           T h e fact o f m e m b e r s h i p of, o r affilia tio n t o . T h e
A s s o c i a ti o n shall c o n s t i t u t e an a g r e e m e n t to re f e r all d i f f e r e n ­
ces o r q u e s t io n s c o n c e r n i n g t h e L a w s o f t h e G a m e o r a n y R u le
o r d ecisio n o f T h e A s s o c i a t i o n to t h e C o u n c il , o r to a r b i t r a t i o n
u n d e r t h e A r b i t r a t i o n A c t 1950 a n d a n y s t a t u t o r y m o d i fi c a ti o n
t h e r e t o , in a c c o r d a n c e w ith t h e r e q u i r e m e n t s o f su c h R u le s o r
p ro v isio n s as m a y f r o m t i m e to t i m e b e a d o p t e d o r m a d e by
T h e A s s o c i a ti o n .

A c c o u n ts
     63. T h e C o u n c il shall c a u s e t r u e a c c o u n t s to b e k e p t o t all
th e re c e i p ts , c r e d i ts , p a y m e n t s , assets a n d liabilities o f T h e
A s s o c i a t i o n , a n d o f all o t h e r m a t t e r s n e c e s s a r y for s h o w in g th e
t r u e s ta te a n d c o n d i t i o n o f T h e A s s o c i a t i o n , a n d t h e a c c o u n t s
shall b e k e p t in su ch b o o k s a n d in su c h m a n n e r as t h e C o u n c il
t h i n k fit, a n d to t h e satisfactio n o f th e A u d i t o r s .

     64. (1) T h e C o u n c il shall k e e p s e p a r a t e a c c o u n t s o f all
 o t h e r F u n d s t a k e n o v e r by t h e m o r r e c e i v e d f r o m th e o rig in a l
 F o o t b a l l A s s o c i a t i o n , a n d shall h o l d th e s a m e F u n d s
 r e s p e c ti v e ly , f o r such p u r p o s e s as shall b e a g r e e d u p o n b y th e
 C o u n c il a n d ’t h e T r u s t e e s o f T h e F o o t b a l l A s s o c i a t i o n , a n d if
 a n d so fa r as n o t t h e r e b y p r o v i d e d as shall b e d e t e r m i n e d by
 S p ecial R e s o l u t i o n o f T h e A s s o c i a ti o n .
      (2)            T h e C o u n c il m a y in e a c h y e a r a p p r o p r i a t e s u c h m o n e y
 as it m a y d e e m n e c e s s a r y to T h e F o o t b a l l A s s o c i a ti o n
 B e n e v o l e n t F u n d to b e d i s t r i b u t e d b y t h e T r u s t e e s in a c c o r d ­
  a n c e w ith th e p o w e r s g iven to t h e m b y t h e T r u s t D e e d .

     65. T h e b o o k s o f a c c o u n t shall b e k e p t at su c h p la c e o r
  p la ces as t h e C o u n c il a p p o i n t , a n d shall b e o p e n - t o in s p e c ti o n
  o f m e m b e r s w ith t h e c o n s e n t o f t h e C o u n c il o r o f a Special
  R e s o l u t i o n o f T h e A s s o c i a ti o n .



      66.       T h e a c c o u n t s o f T h e A s s o c i a t i o n shall b e an n u a lly
  e x a m in e d a n d the correctness of th e b alance sh e e t and
  a c c o m p a n y i n g a c c o u n t s a s c e r t a i n e d b y an A u d i t o r o r A u d i ­
  to rs to b e a p p o i n t e d b y T h e A s s o c i a t i o n at t h e A n n u a l
  G e n e r a l M e e t i n g in a c c o r d a n c e w ith t h e p r o v i s io n s o f t h e A c t.

Notices
  67. A ll n o tices m a y b e served by T h e A sso c ia tio n upon
any M e m b e r in a ccordan ce with the provision s o f the A c t.

  68. W h e r e a n o tice is sen t by p o st, service o f the notice
shall b e d e e m e d to b e effe c te d b y prop erly a ddressing,
prepaying, and p o stin g a letter co n tain in g the n o tic e , and to
have b e en e ffe c te d in the case o f a n otice o f a M e e tin g at the
expiration o f tw en ty-fou r (24) hours after the letter con tain in g
the sam e is p o s te d , and in any o th er case at the tim e at which
the letter w o u ld b e d eliv e re d in th e ordinary cou rse o f post.

  69.     A notice g iven to any M e m b e r shall be binding on any
A s s o c i a t i o n or C lub o f w hich he m a y be the R e p r e se n ta tiv e ,
and all p ro ce ed in g s ta k e n w ith o u t any further or o th er notice
shall be b inding on such A sso c ia tio n or Club.


Dissolution
   70.      If u pon th e w in d in g up or d issolu tion o f T h e A s s o c i a ­
tion there rem ains after the satisfaction o f all d eb ts and
liabilities any p roperty w h a tso e v e r , the sam e shall n o t be paid
to or distributed a m o n g th e M e m b e r s o f T h e A ss o c ia tio n , but
subject to th e n e x t p rov ision s shall b e given or transferred to
such Institution or Institutions h aving o b je c ts w h o lly or
partially similar to the o b je cts o f T h e A sso c ia tio n as shall be
determ ined by the M e m b e r s o f T h e A sso c ia tio n at or b efo re
the time o f d issolution or by the C o u n cil after such d is so lu tio n ,
or in default th e r e o f by such J udge o f the H ig h C ourt o f Justice
as may have or acquire jurisdiction in th e m a tter , and if and so
far as effect ca n n o t be given to such provision then to so m e
charitable ob ject.
A R T IC L E S O F A S SO C IA T IO N
    REGULATIONS OF ASSOCIATION
           REGULATIONS FOR THE SANCTION AND
         CONTROL OF LEAGUES AND COMPETITIONS
         EXCEPT COMPETITIONS UNDER THE DIRECT
             JURISDICTION AND CONTROL OF
               THE FOOTBALL ASSOCIATION
   1. Clubs forming a League or C om petition, all o f which
are Members o f o n e (1) C o u n ty A sso cia tion only,* shall
make application for sanction to, and the League or
Competition shall be sanctioned by* and be under the
jurisdiction o f that A ssocia tio n .
    2. Clubs forming a League or C om petition consisting o f
Clubs within the area of, or affiliated to, tw o (2) or three (3)
C ounty A sso cia tio n s, shall m ake application for sanction to
any o f such A ssoc iatio n s. The A sso c ia tio n to which
application has been m ad e shall within fourteen (1 4) d ay s o f
its receipt submit the application to the other A sso ciatio n or
A ssociations concerned. The League or C om p etition shall be
sanctioned by, and be under the jurisdiction of, a C om m ittee
o f not less than tw o ( 2) M em bers o f each A sso ciatio n .

    3. C l u b s f o r m i n g a L e a g u e o r C o m p e t i t i o n c o n s i s t i n g
of C lu b s w ith in th e a re a o f m o re t h a n th ree (3 ) C o u n ty
A sso c ia tio n s, shall m a k e a p p lic a tio n fo r sa n c tio n to, a n d
th e L e a g u e o r C o m p e t i t i o n s h a l l b e s a n c t i o n e d b y , a n d b e
u n d e r th e j u r i s d i c t i o n o f , T h e F o o t b a l l A s s o c i a t i o n , u n l e s s
The A s s o c ia tio n directs th a t the L eag u e o r C o m p e titio n
m a y b e s a n c t i o n e d u n d e r R e g u l a t i o n 2. A n a n n u a l s a n c t i o n
fee w ill b e d e t e r m i n e d b y T h e A s s o c i a t i o n .
    4. A C o m p e t i t i o n m a y b e u s e d f o r t r a d e o r a d v e r t i s i n g
p u r p o s e s a n d t h e n a m e o f th e d o n o r o f a C u p o r T r o p h y o r
a n y o t h e r p e r s o n m a y f o r m p a r t o f t h e titl e o f a C o m p e t i t i o n
o n ly w i t h t h e p r i o r c o n s e n t o f T h e A s s o c i a t i o n o r a p p r o p r i ­
a te C o u n t y A s s o c i a t i o n .

H h e A r m y F o o tb a ll A ssociation, T h e R o y al N a v y F o o tb all A ss o ciatio n , T h e R o y al
A ir F o rce F o o tb all A ssociation, T h e A m a t e u r F o o tb all Alliance a n d T h e English
Schools’ F o o tb all A ss o ciatio n are C o u n ty A ss o ciatio n s within th e m e an in g o f these
Regulations.
108                    L E A G U E S A N D C O M PE TI TI O N S


    5. A Cup or Tr o ph y pres ent ed to a Compet it ion shall be
vested in the Association or Associ ati ons sanct ioni ng the
Compet it ion, as Trust ees. If a Compet i t i on be dis conti nued from
any c aus e, the C u p or T r o p h y shall be r et ur ne d to the d o n o r
if the co ndi ti ons a t t a c h e d to it so provide, held in trust, or
o t he r wi se dealt with as the A ss o c i a t i on or A s s o c i a ti o n s ma y
decide.

   6. T he sanctioning Association or Associ ati ons may not allot
a Club to a League but may permit a Leag ue to make provi sion in
its Rules to restrict the n umb er of Compet it io ns, in addition to
the F.A. and Coun t y Compet i t i ons, in which its Clubs take part.

  7. A Player without a written co nt r a c t is not restricted as to
the Clubs for which he may play, provi ded he complies with the
Rules and Regulations of any Compet it ion in which his Club or
Clubs may be engaged.

  8. A League or Compet it ion may p r omot e and manage
Compet it ions restricted to Clubs playing in its L eagu e or
Compet it ion. A separate application must be made and consent
obtained for each Compet it ion.

   9. Application for sanct ion of a League or Compet i t i on
(ot her t ha n a C h a r i t y C o mp e t i t i o n ) shall be m a d e on a for m
m a r k e d " D , ” as schedu l ed to the Rul es o f T h e Foo t bal l
Associ at i on . T w o (2) copi es o f the p r o p o s e d R ul e s must
a c c o m p a n y the appl icat ion.

    10.     A pp l i c at i on for sanct ion o f a C h a r i t y C o m p e t i t i o n
shall be m a d e on a for m m a r k e d " E , ” as s ch edul ed to the
Rules o f T h e Foot bal l A ss oc i at i on. T w o (2) copies o f the
p ro p os e d Rules m u s t a c c o m p a n y the appl icat ion.

   11. W h en an application for sanction is made by a Junior
League or Compet it ion u nd e r Regulations 1 and 2, the
Association or Associ ati ons c on c e r ne d may require that the
Rules of the League or Compet it ion shall provi de that a Me m b e r
of the C o un ty Association or Associ ati ons shall sit upon the
C ommi t te e of the League or Compet it ion. This arr angement
shall be for the guidance and instruction of the L e ag u e or

Rules affected.

    27 .        In c h arity C o m p e titio n s c o n d u c t e d o n a L e a g u e
p r i n c i p l e , n o t less t h a n o n e - t e n t h (jg) o f t h e g r o s s g a t e

n o t s u f f i c i e n t to c o v e r t h e g r o u n d e x p e n s e s o f t h e m a t c h ,

n o t include any ex p e n se s o f th e c o m p e tin g te am s.

    28 .       In c h a r i t y C o m p e t i t i o n s c o n d u c t e d as a C h a l l e n g e
C u p at le ast o n e - t e n th (4 ) o f th e gross g ate re c e ip ts o f the

g a t e r e c e i p t s o f t h e S e m i - F i n a l a n d F i n a l T i e s m u s t g o to
charity.

C o m petition.

tio n fro m w hich san ctio n was received.

   31.    L e a g u e s and C o m p e t i t io n s shall fix th e f e e s to be
paid to R e f e r e e s and L in e s m e n o ffic ia tin g in their m a t c h e s
within the lim its laid d o w n b y th e S a n c tio n in g A s s o c i a t io n .
O fficials shall n e it h e r ask fo r, n o r r e c e i v e , a larger fe e than
that fix ed b y th e L e a g u e or C o m p e t i t io n .*

   32.    R e f e r e e s m u s t n o t b e c a lle d u p o n to p e r fo r m any

    33. L e a g u e s and C o m p e t i t io n s shall n o t im p o s e b o n d s

b e h a v io u r o f th eir P la y ers.

            REGULATIONS FOR THE REGISTRATION
                AND CONTROL OF REFEREES

Registration
1. (a) E x cep t by p erm is sio n o f T h e F o o tb a l l A s s o c i a ti o n or a
C o u n t y A ss o c i a ti o n , n o p e rs o n shall officiate as a R eferee in
a n y C o m p e t i t i o n u n d e r th e ju r isd ic tio n o f T h e F o o tb a ll
A s s o c ia tio n unless he o r she* is regist ered with a C o u n t y
A s s o c ia tio n o r Service A sso ciatio n .
    (b) A Refe re e must be registered with the C o u n ty Association
within w h o se a rea he resides and may be re q u ire d to pay an
annu al subscriptio n, su b ject th ere to , he m a y also be registered
with any oth er C o u n ty Associatio n on p a y m e n t o f the
su bscriptio n fixed by such A ssociation. In cases w h e re the
b o u n d aries o f C o u n ty Associati ons o verl ap, th e C oun ties
c o n c e r n e d m a y m u tu a lly agree a b o u t the re g istra tio n of
Referees within the o v e rla p p in g areas. (See S e c tio n 7) A
Referee w h o c h a n g e s his residence fr o m otie C o u n t y to
a n o t h e r shall n o t be re q u ire d to p a y a reg i s t ra ti o n fee to his
new A s s o c i a ti o n d u r i n g the c u rr e n t s e a s o n b u t m u s t register
with the C o u n t y A s s o c i a ti o n into w h o se a r e a he m o v e s. T h a t
C o u n t y shall then be his p a r e n t A s s o c i a ti o n a n d shall deal
with all m a tte r s c o n c e rn i n g him as a Referee. (T his re gulation
shall n o t ap p ly to a Refe re e b elo n g in g to th e Services'
A s s o c i a ti o n s a n d T h e A m a t e u r F o o tb a l l Alliance.)
   T h e Football A ssociati on o r the re lev an t C o u n ty Football
Associati on shall be respo nsible fo r the recru itm e n t, training,
qualification a n d re g istratio n o f Referees, b ut m a y a rr a n g e
for th e c o -o p e r a ti o n o f su ch bo d ie s as th e Referees'
A s s o c ia tio n an d R eferees' Societies in these activities.
   (c) R efe re es ap p o in ted to m a tc h e s by A sso c ia tio n s or
C o m p etit io n s un d er the jurisdiction of T h e Football A ssociation
m ust be registered with a C ounty A ssociati on but C om petitio ns
or Clubs may ag ree fo r so m e o th e r p ers o n to act in an
em erg ency.
  (d) R efe re es shall no t be registered until they are ab le to satisfy
the C o u n ty A ssoci ation of their date of birth.

‘ W h e n e v e r the w o r d “ h e " ap pea rs in th e s e R eg u la ti o n s read " h e or
  s h e " . For “ h i m " read “ him or h e r ” , etc.

Examination
2. (a) A ll candidates shall be e x a m in e d as to their suitability
to officiate. A ca ndidate failing to pass an e x a m in atio n m ay
not present h im se lf a se c o n d tim e within a p erio d o f three (3)
months unless his ex a m in er re c o m m e n d s oth erw ise. T he
initial exa m in a tio n shall be both oral and written in the form
p r e s c r i b e d by T h e F ootball A sso cia tio n and shall include an
eyesight and colour test by the card issu ed by T h e F ootball
Association. A fter passing an e x a m in a tio n a candidate shall
be advised by his C o u n ty A sso c ia tio n o f the L e a g u e s and
C om petitions with which he m ay obtain a p p oin tm en ts.
  (b)    T h e R egu latio n s o f th e S erv ices’ A sso c ia tio n s provide
that none but S ervicem en shall be ex a m in e d or classified by
the Service A sso cia tio n . A ll o th er C o u n ty A sso c ia tio n s are
requested to inform the Service A sso c ia tio n co n ce rn ed shou ld
they exam in e a S ervicem an .
Classification
3. (a) E ach C o u n ty A sso c ia tio n shall, o n or before the 1st
June in each year, classify their R e fe r e e s according to the
reports received during the p revious sea so n as follow s:—
     Class 1: R e fe r e e s , w h o s e ages d o not e x c e e d fifty and
   who have attained and m ain tain ed the standard necessary
   for this senior classification and th o se w h o have b ee n
   promoted from C lass 2 for outstan d in g ability.
     A co m p lete list sh ow in g the ages o f Class 1 R e fe r e e s shall
   be forwarded to T h e F ootb all A sso c ia tio n annually.
     Class 2: R e fe r e e s , w h o s e ages d o not e x c e e d fifty w h o
   are senior but not o f the qualifications necessary for Class 1
   and th ose w h o h ave b e e n p ro m o te d from Class 3 for
   outstanding ability.
     Class 3: A ll other R e fe r e e s not in clu d ed in Class 1, Class
   2, the Special x List or Y o u t h C a teg ories.
      Class 3 (Y o u th ): T o include ages b e tw e e n fou rteen and
   sixteen as at the 1st A u g u st o f each se a so n . A Class 3
   (Y outh) R e fe r e e will autom atically b e c o m e a Class 3
   R eferee o n his sixteenth birthday.
  County A sso cia tio n s m a y co m p ile a Special x List o f
Referees over the ag e o f fifty, p reviously Class 1, Ix , 2 , 2x or 3;
such R e fe re es to be classified as l x or 2 x , but their n a m es are

n ot to be in c lu d e d in th e a n n u a l r e t u r n to T h e F o o tb a l l
A ss o c i a ti o n . R e f e r e e s m a y b e p r o m o t e d in to a n d w ith in t h e x
classifications. T h e g ra d i n g o f a R e f e r e e by a C o u n t y A s s o c i a ­
tion m u s t be a c c e p t e d by all t h e o t h e r A s s o c i a ti o n s t h r o u g h o u t
th e c o u n t r y . (S ee clau se 3(b).)
    (b) W h en a R eferee chang es his res idence from o n e C ounty
or Service Association to a n o t h e r C o u n ty Association the latter
must accept in th e first instance the classification of th e fo rm er
C ounty o r Service Association. If, after trial or ex a m in a tio n ,
the R efe re e is not d e e m e d to be o f the s ta n d ard of their

seasons shall not be re- registered until the application has bee n
consi dered by the a p p ro p r iate C o m m ittee o f th e C o u n ty
Association within whose are a th e R efe re e now resides.
    (d) N o p e r s o n b e l o w f o u r t e e n y e a rs o f ag e shall be
r e g i s t e r e d as a R e f e r e e .
    (e) R e f e r e e s u n d e r six teen y e a rs o f age a r e o n ly eligible to
o ff iciate as r e f e r e e s o r lin esm en in C o m p e t i t i o n s in volving
p la y e rs o f s ix teen y ears o f ag e o r less.

4.     Disqualification
     (a) C o u n t y A s s o c i a ti o n s m u s t , o n re m o v i n g th e n a m e o f a
R e f e r e e f r o m th e ir List o f r e g i s t e r e d R e f e r e e s , n o tify T h e
F o o tb a l l A s s o c i a ti o n w'ho m a y ta k e such actio n as it d e e m s
d esirab le.
     ( b ) C o m p e t i t i o n s r e m o v in g th e n a m e o f a R e f e r e e o r
L i n e s m a n f r o m th e ir reg ister fo r an y r e a s o n m u s t noti fy th e
C o u n t y A s s o c i a ti o n with w h o m h e is reg istered .
     (c) C o u n t y A s s o c i a ti o n s a n d C o m p e t i t i o n s m u s t r e m o v e
f r o m t h e ir re g isters th e n a m e o f an y Official p r o v e d to h a v e

en g agem ent or atte m p te d transfer and/or eng ag em en t of a
P la yer.
     (d) C o m p l a i n t s by o r ag ain st R e f e r e e s a n d L i n e s m e n shall
b e m a d e to t h e p a r e n t C o u n t y A s s o c i a ti o n with w'hich th e
O fficial is re g i s t e re d o r to T h e F o o tb a l l A s s o c i a ti o n .

age will be ca n ce lled a n d th e y will not be a llo w e d to re-register

tion if th ey re-instate a R e fe r e e w h o had p rev io u sly b een

unaffiliated Clubs c o m p e t e .

that d ecision or action.
  T h e A p p e a l shall b e lo d g e d w ith the S ecretary o f the
sanctioning A sso c ia tio n w ith in fo u rteen (14) days o f the
decision and shall b e a c c o m p a n ie d by a fe e o f T w en ty -five

in part, at the discretion o f th e B o a rd o f A p p e a l, w h o shall
decide by w h o m the costs o f the A p p e a l shall b e b o r n e . T h e
Football A sso cia tio n or th e re le v a n t A sso cia tio n shall appoint
the B o a rd o f A p p e a l w h o s e d ecisio n shall be final and binding
on all con cern ed .
    (/) If a Player w h o is also a registered R e fe r e e v io la te s the
Laws o f the G a m e to such a d e g r e e that a D isciplinary

Disciplinary Procedure
6. W h e n e v e r a R e f e r e e caution s or dismisses fr om the field o f
play a Player, h e shall p repare in dupli cate and within tw o (2)
days o f th e m atch (Su n day not included) s e n d by first class
mail add ressed to th e Secreta ry o f the appropriate A sso cia tio n
or such person as is n o m in a te d by such A s s o c i a tio n , a report o f
the incident or incidents in which the Player was involved . A ll
such reports shall b e m a d e on the standard M iscondu ct R ep o rt
F orm as a pp roved by the C ouncil and as m ay be a m e n d e d
from tim e to tim e. T h e F ootball A s so c ia tio n s shall en su re that
R e f e r e e s are is su ed with the form s. T h is p ro ced u re shall apply
to L in e s m e n w h e n such reports are required.
  If m o r e than o n e (1) pla yer is cau tion ed or dis mis sed from
the field o f play fo llo w in g se parate in cid ents during a m atch,
separate reports co n cernin g ea ch incident must be sent.
   R e f e r e e s and L in e s m e n (if qualified R e f e r e e s ) must atten d
P ersonal H e arin gs w he n required so to do. If a R e f e r e e or
L in esm an fails to a tten d he shall be reporte d to the
appropriate authority.
   W h e n a R e f e r e e has a ccep ted a request to atten d a
D isciplinary C o m m i s s i o n , he sh ould close the date with his
various co m p etition s.
   R e f e r e e s must su b m it reports o n ly to the appropriate
C o un ty F ootb all A s s o c ia tio n or T h e F ootb all A sso cia tio n
con cern in g ca uti ons, dismissals and other m isc onduct. C o p ies
o f such reports must not b e su bmitted to L e a g u e s or oth er
bodies.
