        REGULATIONS FOR THE CONTROL OF
               YOUTH FOOTBALL

(Players under the age of eighteen (18) years on first (1st)
               A ugust in the current season)


  1. A County Association may form a County Youth Football
Association, or carry out the duties by a Committee of its own
Association.


 2. T he constitution of the Youth Association, or Committee,
must be submitted to T he Football Association.
             YOUTH RULES FOR THE GUIDANCE
                   OF COUNTY ASSOCIATIONS

  T he following Y ou th Rules are for the guidance of County
A sso ciations:—

  1. T he Association shall be called “ T h e               Cou nty Youth
Football A s so ci at io n .”

   2. Th e Officers of the Youth Association shall consist of a
President, V ice-P resident s, C h ai r m an , Ho n. Secretary and
T re a s u r e r, and Ho n. R e f e r e e s ’ Sec retary.

    3. T h e Y o u th A ss oc i at i on for the p u rp o s e s o f general
m a n a g e m e n t shall be g ov er n ed by a C ou nc il consisting of
tw o (2) M e m b e r s from e a c h Division elected ann u al ly in
a c c o r d a n c e with these Rules, fo ur (4) M e m b e r s nom in ate d
by the --------- C o u n t y F oo tba ll A sso ci atio n, the President,
C h a i r m a n , Fion. R ef er ee s’ S e c re ta ry a nd the H on . Secretary
and Treasurer of t h e               C o u n t y F oo tba ll Association.

    4. All Cl u bs havi ng their h e a d q u a r t e r s within the area of
the — C o u n t y A ss oc ia tion , the whole o f w ho se players are
males un de r eighteen (18) years o f age o n first (1st) August,
o f the then c u rr e n t season, shall be eligible for Mem bership,
subject to the ap p ro v a l of the Council.

   5. All Cl u bs up on appl ication for affiliation to the Youth
Associati on, an d at a ny time ther ea fte r when so required,
shall satisfy the C ou nc il tha t they are pr operly constituted
and also play Footbal l a c c o rd in g to the Rules and
R eg ula tion s o f T h e Football Associ ation.

  6 . Each affiliated League, Competition and Club shall pay an
annual fee.

    7. E ac h affiliated Clu b shall fo rw a rd on or before the
first (1st) d a y o f S e pt e m be r in eac h year, to the Fion.
Secret ary, a ret u rn in a c c o r d a n c e with F o r m “ A ” in the
Schedule which is an ne xe d to and for ms p a r t o f these Rules.
            YOUTH G UIDANC E FOR ASSOCIATIONS                  125

  8. For the purposes of management, the Youth Association
shall be divided into Divisions, geographically as defined by the
Council, the Division to which a Club belongs being determined
by the situation of its ground or, in the event of a Club having no
ground, by the situation of its headquarters.

   9. The A nn ual General Meeting shall be held not later
than the -------- in ea ch year. A printed balance sheet o f the
accounts, certified by the Auditor, shall be sent out with the
notices co nvenin g the meeting fourteen (14) days prior to the
date o f same. E ach affiliated Lea gue, Com petition and Club
shall be entitled to send tw o (2) duly appointed
Representatives. All Representatives appointed under this
Rule must be M em bers o f the Club they represent. An
individual M ember shall only represent on e (1) affiliated
Club. The C o un t y Officers shall be entitled to vote at any
Ordinary and/o r Special General Meeting. Councillors may
attend any G ene ral Meeting but may not vote in that
capacity.

   10. [Each County Association will frame its own Rule, as
circumstances may require, to provide the method by which the
Council shall be elected.]

   11. The duties o f the affiliated Leagues or Competitions may
be generally defined as fo llo w s:—
  To investigate and (if so instructed by the Council) to deal with
reports of misconduct, protests, complaints, or other matters
referred to them by the Council, or by the Secretary in cases
when delay would appear detrimental. The League or
Competition shall, with as little delay as possible, report the
results of their investigations and determinations to the
Secretary. The Council shall have power to amend or revoke any
decision of a League or Competition when they deem it
advisable.

   12'. A ny Appea l against a decision o f a Leagu e or
Competition must be sent to the Secretary, a ccom p anied by a
deposit o f Fifty Pence ( £ 0 .5 0 ) which m ay be forfeited to the
funds o f the — C oun ty A ssociatio n if the Appea l is
successful. M embers o f a League or Com petition w hose
126            Y O U T H G U I D A N C E FOR A SS O C I A T I O N S



d eci sio n is ap p eal ed agai n st shall not sit on. or be pr es ent at,
the C o u n ci l Meet i n g d u r i n g the d e t er m i n a tio n o f s uch
A p p eal . All A p p e al s u n d er this Rule m u s t be lodged with the
S ec r e t a r y withi n seven (7) d a y s o f the d eci sion being given,
w h ich it is desi red to ap p eal agai nst.

   13. If an insufficient n u m b e r of can d i d at es is no mina ted , the
H on . S ecr et ar y shall r ep o r t the ci r cu m s t an c e s to the retiring
C o u n c i l , w h o shall elect M e m b e r s t o fill the v acancies .

     14.    Five (5) M e m b e r s o f the C o u n c i l shall f or m a
q u o r u m for the t r a n s a c t i o n o f b usi ness. T h e C o u nc il shall

el ected M e m b e r s in their b o d y d u r i n g t he year . T h e Cou nc il

co n si d er n eces sa r y an d p r o v i d e su ch secr etarial as s is t an ce as
they t hi nk fit.

    M EM ORANDUM ON AREAS AND OVERLAPPING
                      OF ASSOCIATIONS

           (Rule 4 of the Rules of the Association)
          (25th August, 1950, and 12th January, 1951)

   1. A County Association is not permitted to alter or extend
its area without the consent of T he Football Association.
Consent shall be given only after a Commission of Inquiry is held
at which all parties concerned shall have an opportunity of
attending.

 2. District, Junior and Y outh          A ssociatio ns   must   be
Members o f a C oun ty A ssociatio n.

   3. A n y District, Junior or Youth A ssociatio n operating
in tw o (2) or more Counties shall affiliate to the Senior o f the
two (2) C oun ty A sso cia tio n s concerned.

  4. The playing ground shall constitute the Headquarters o f
Clubs with the following exceptions:—
    (a) Clubs concerned with Public Offices, Banks, Rail­
  ways, Business Houses and similar institutions;
    (b)   Clubs which have not a recognised playing ground;
    (c) Clubs which cannot obtain a suitable and convenient
  ground within the area of their County Associations.

  The Headquarters of the excepted Clubs shall be within the
area of the County Association to which they claim to belong.

  5.     T he Members hip o f Clubs with A sso cia tio n s which
overlap shall be restricted to the areas determined by the
Overlapping R eports o f 1908 and 1927 as follows:—
  Amateur Football Alliance-     See N ote 1.
  Army F.A.     See N ote 1.
  Birm ingham C oun ty    F .A .   Area: T he C ounty o f
Warwick and thirty (3 0 ) miles from Stevenson Place,
Birmingham   (except   that     part o f the  C oun ty of

W o rc e s te rs h ir e wh ich is in the ar e a o f the W o rc es te rs h ir e
F o o tb a l l Association).
   Cambridge University F.C.                 See N o te 1.

          MEMORANDUM OF AGREEMENT
       BETWEEN THE FOOTBALL ASSOCIATION
        AND THE RUGBY FOOTBALL LEAGUE

   1. Susp en sion o f a Club or Player by on e authority shall
be recognised by the other.

  2. A Club or Player expelled from one authority shall not
be allowed to play under the other for a period o f twelve (12)
months.

   3. A professional Player o f one authority shall not be
allowed to play under the other as an amateur or as a
professional during the sam e season. The definition o f a
professional shall be in accordance with the Rules o f the
authority to which he belongs.

  4. Each authority shall send to the other lists o f
expulsions, and shall supply any information asked for in
respect o f suspensions.

  5. Clubs shall not be allowed by on e authority to take a
name identical with a name held under the other; the term
"Association’' or " R u gb y" is not a sufficient distinction.
                                132


                        MEMORANDUM
           SCHOOLBOYS AND SCHOOL GAMES

  One o f the important aspects o f games in school is the
opportunity they afford o f developing a b o y ’s sense o f loyalty
and honour. It is therefore o f concern when interest in games
outside the school conflict with a b o y ’s loyalty to his school
and/or school organ isations’ activities.

    1. It is usually the boy o f outstanding Football ability
w h o se services are sought by any Club, and he is most likely
to be a member o f the school or association team. While
sc h o o ls’ matches are often arranged on Saturday mornings
and Club match es take place in the afternoon, it is considered
that a boy should not play in two matches on the same day,
for the one match is likely to affect his play in the other.

   2. An outside Club or organisation should consult the
headmaster before selecting any S c h o o lb o y to play for a
team, and should accept the head teacher’s decision on these
matters.

    Headteachers o f schools should not restrain boys, who are
not selected for school games o f any kind, from playing for an
outside organisation during their free time.
                              133


               A G R E E M E N T B E TW E EN
         THE F O O T B A L L A S S O C IA T IO N A N D
              TH E F O O T B A L L L E A G U E


  The control o f football under the jurisdiction o f The
Football Association within the framework o f The Football
League is carried out by The League under the following
conditions:

  1. The Football League shall have its independent
administration and control o f finance in accordance with its
Regulations.

  2. The President and Members of The League Management
Committee not exceeding nine (9) in number shall be Members o f
the F .A . Council.

   3. T h e President o f T h e League shall be a V ice-
President o f the F .A ., a M em ber o f the F .A . E xecutive
C om m ittee and a M em ber o f the International F .A . B oard.

  4. A Joint Liaison Committee o f members o f the F.A.
and The League shall be appointed each season to discuss
matters o f policy and com m on interest and, where appro­
priate, to make recommendations to the respective
Governing Bodies.

   5. The following procedure shall be followed in cases o f
alleged breaches by Clubs in membership o f The Football
League o f the Rules o f The Football Association or o f the
Regulations o f The Football League:—
  Whichever organisation receives information o f alleged
  breach o f such Rules and Regulations by a Club in
  membership o f The Football League shall at once inform
  the other body. Where a preliminary examination reveals a
  breach o f the Rules and Regulations o f The Football
  Association only, an F .A . C om m ission m ay be appointed
  to deal with the matter in accordance with its Rules.
  Where a preliminary examination reveals a breach o f the
134                                   AGRKKMtNT



      Regulat ions of T h e Footbal l League only. The Football
      League may deal with the m att er u nd er its own Regulations,
      subj ect alwavs to the right of the C lub con cer ned to appeal
      against the decision o f the Ma n ag em en t C ommittee to an
      appeal s body ap p o in ted by T h e Football Association. Wher e a
      prel iminary exami nat i on reveals that b o th the Rules of The
      Football Association an d the Regu lat i on s of The Football
      L eague have been co n t r av en ed, each bod y shall act inde pen ­
      dent ly in accordance with its own Rules or Regulations.
   6.    All p lay er s u n d er w ri t ten c o n t r a c t m u s t be registered
as su c h with T h e F o o t b a l l A ss o c i a t i o n a n d T h e F ootb al l
L eag u e.
     7.     P l ay er s u n d er w r it t en c o n t r a c t shal l be placed at the
d i sp o sal o f T h e F o o t b a l l A ss o c i a t i o n at all times in
a c c o r d a n c e wi th t he p r o g r a m m e o f m a t c h e s laid d o w n in
S ect i on 8.
     8. T h e F o o t b al l A ss o c i a t i o n will e n d e a v o u r to ens ur e
t h a t I n t er n at i o n al M a t c h e s (Full, ‘B ’ a n d U n d e r - 2 1) will only
be p l a y ed o n the i n t e r n a t i o n al d at es ag r e e d u n d er C la u s e 11
a n d t h a t the p r o c e d u r e shall o n l y be d e p a r t e d f r o m in
 ex c ep t i o n al c i r c u m s t a n c e s an d t h en o n l y in full cons u lt at ion
wi th T h e F o o t b al l L e a g u e M a n a g e m e n t C o m m it te e.
     I n t er n a t i o n al M a t c h e s at o t h e r levels shall be pla ye d on
d at es m u t u a l l y ag r eed b et w e en t h e p ar t i es f r o m time to time.
    9. T h e L eag u e m a y p lay I n t e r - L e ag u e M a t c h e s with

 m u s t n o t be in conflict w i t h I n t e r n at i o n al B o a r d A gr ee m en ts .

                            AGREEMENT                                135


  12. All referees officiating in matches played under the
League's jurisdiction shall be registered with a County
Association.

    13. Th e Football Association shall pay to Football League
Clubs providing players an d /o r staff for the Eng land ' A ' or B'
teams an agreed sum p er match. If these p ay m ent s a m o u n t to less
than 25% of the International Match A cco un t surplus, the
balance will be distributed pro rata to the clubs involved,
d e p en de n t on the n u m b e r of players provided. T h e Football
League are entitled to a full disclosure of all figures relating to this
payment. Pa yme nt will be m ad e to the Clubs concern ed within 28
days following the said A cc oun t being certified by T he Football
Association Au d ito rs for the period en ding 31st D e c e m b e r each
year.

   14. Mat ters of co m m o n interest involving commercial activi­
ties, including the broadcast o f football matches, by television,
radio, close circuit, cable, satellite o r video, in live o r recor ded
form, must be negotiated jointly and ap pro ved by the Joint
Liaison C om m it te e for rec om m en da tio n to the respective
Governing Bodies.
AG REFM F.N T
            R U L E S O F TH E C H A L L E N G E C U P
                        C O M PE TIT IO N


1.   Nam e o f Cup
  T he Cup shall       be   called   “T he   F ooball   A sso cia tio n
Challenge C u p ”.

2.   Cup Ownership
   T he Cup is the property o f T he F ootb all A sso cia tio n
Limited.
    W hen the winning Club shall have been ascertained, the
A sso cia tio n shall deliver the C up to such Club, w hich shall be
responsible for its return to the A sso cia tio n on or before the
first d a y in March in the ensuing year in g o o d order and
condition.
   Should the C up be lost, d est royed or d am aged by fire or any
other cause whilst under the care or c u st o d y o f the Club the
latter shall refund to the A sso cia tio n the amount o f its current
insured value or the cost o f thorough repair in addition to any
other penalty w hich the F ootball A sso cia tio n m a y impose.
3.   Medals
   In addition to the C up, the A ssociation shall present
medals to the players and substitutes in the Final Tie. W hen a
player taking part is ordered to leave the field o f play for
miscon duc t, the medal to w hich he m a y be entitled m a y be
withheld at the discretion o f the Council.

4.   Control o f Competition
   T he entire control and m an agem en t o f the Competition
shall be vested in the C ouncil. The C ouncil shall have pow er
to formulate the R ules o f the C om peti tion and to alter or add
to the Rules as they, from time to time, deem expedient. The
Council shall appoint a C hallenge C up C om m ittee to control
and m an age the C om peti tion on their behalf and to give
decisions on matters arising out o f the C om peti tion which,
within the Rules laid d o w n by the Council, shall be deemed
decisions o f the Cou nci l. Clubs shall be boun d by any
Contract entered into b y the C oun cil in relation to the
Competition. In any matter not specifically men tioned in
these Rules, the C hallenge C up C om m ittee shall have the
138          RULES o r THE CHALLENGE CUP COMPETITION


p o w e r to t a k e su ch act i o n a n d i m p o se su ch penalties as it
d e e m s n ec essar y .

     T h e C o m p e t i t i o n shal l b e o p e n (i) to all C l u b s b e i n g
M e m b e rs o r A ssociate M e m b e rs of T h e Football A ssocia­
t i o n a n d t a k i n g p a r t in a S e n i o r C o m p e t i t i o n o f a n a ff il ia t e d

all o t h e r C l u b s t a k i n g p a r t in a S e n i o r C o m p e t i t i o n o f an
a f f i l i a t e d C o u n t y A s s o c i a t i o n ; (iii) t o s u c h o t h e r C l u b s

the C u p T ie, h a v in g regard to all the c ir c u m s ta n c e s , the

(d) Playing Condition o f the Ground
    E a c h C lu b m u s t t a k e e v e r y p r e c a u t i o n to k e e p its g r o u n d
in p la y i n g c o n d i t i o n a n d , if n e c e s s a r y , e i th e r C lu b m a y
a p p e a l t o th e A s s o c i a t i o n a n d th e S e c reta ry shall requir e
th e R e f e r e e or s o m e o t h e r R e f e r e e t o e x a m i n e th e g r o u n d
a n d d e c i d e as to its fitn ess for p la y in su ff ic ie n t ti m e to s a v e
e x p e n s e s o f u n n e c e s s a r y j o u r n e y s b e in g in cu rr ed by th e
C lu b s. S u b j e c t t o this R u l e , t h e R e f e r e e shall h a v e p o w e r
to d e c i d e as t o t h e fitn ess o f t h e g r o u n d in all m a t c h e s a n d
m u st r ep o rt t o th e g r o u n d w h e r e t h e m a t ch is to b e p la y e d
at le ast o n e a n d h a l f h o u r s b e f o r e th e ti m e o f k ick -o ff.
    D u r in g the m o n t h s o f N o v e m b e r , D e c e m b e r , J anua ry
a n d F e b r u a r y , th e R e f e r e e shall visit th e g r o u n d t w o h o u rs
b e f o r e th e t i m e o f k ic k - o ff. If n e c e s s a r y th e h o m e C lu b m a y
r eq u ir e th e R e f e r e e t o visit th e g r o u n d t w o h o u rs or m o r e
b e f o r e th e t i m e o f k i c k - o f f a n y t i m e d urin g t h e s e a s o n .

    (e ) Artificial Pitches
    T h e R u l e s for v e n u e a n d c h o i c e o f g r o u n d are s u b j e c t to

o f a n y tie o r ti es o n a p articula r artificial pit ch.

    In t h e e v e n t o f t h e C l u b s n o t a g r e e i n g u p o n t h e c o l o u r s to
b e w o r n b y t h e i r r e s p e c t i v e t e a m s t h e A s s o c i a t i o n shall
d ecide. G o a lk e e p e r s m ust w e a r colours w hich distinguish
t h e m f r o m t h e o t h e r p l a y e r s a n d t h e M a t c h Offi cia ls .
    P l a y e r s ' s h i rt s shall b e n u m b e r e d f r o m 1 to 13/14.
    A d v e r t i s i n g u p t o a m a x i m u m o f 32 s q ins (2 0 0 sq c m s)
m a y be w o r n o n p l a y e r s ' c l o t h i n g .

b e h alf of o ne spo nsor only p er season.
11.      Duration o f Matches
     T h e D u r a t i o n o f e a c h m a t c h shall be o n e h o u r a n d a half,
exc ept t h a t in special cases , p ro v i d e d fo r in these Ru les , an
e x t ra h a l f- h o u r m u s t be pl ay ed. T h e R efe ree shall allow for
ti me w a s t e d o r lost t h r o u g h a c c i d e n t o r o t h e r caus e. T h e
Re fer ee is the sole j u d g e o f a llo w a n c e o f time w h e t h e r lost
t h r o u g h a cc id en t o r o t h e r c a u s e a n d his decision o n this
m a t t e r is n o t su bj ect to appeal.
 12.     Provision for Matches Preceding Semi-Final Ties
    F o r all m a t c h e s p re c e d i n g the S em i- F in al Ties, the
following pro v is io ns shall a p p l y : —
    (i) C lu b s shall n o t m u t u a ll y a r r a n g e to p la y a m a t c h in lieu
o f a C u p Tie.
    (ii) A n y late k ic k -o ff m u s t be re p o r t e d b y the Re fer ee to the
F o o t b a l l A s s o c i a ti o n a n d the C ou n c il shall h a v e p o w e r to
i m p o s e a fine.
      E x tra T im e in F irst M atches
     (iii) W h e n a first m a t c h h a s res ulted in a dr aw , a n ex tr a
 h al f- ho ur m a y be pl a y e d p ro v i d e d the tw o C lu b s m u t u a ll y
 ag ree a n d in ti m at e the ir deci sion to the R e fe re e b ef o re the
 m atch commences.
    First M a tch e s w hich are P o s tp o n e d o r A b a n d o n e d
      (i v ) W h e n a fi rs t m a t c h h a s b e e n p o s t p o n e d o r a b a n ­
d o n e d before the co m p letio n of 90 m inutes and neither
C l u b b e i n g at f a u l t , it m u s t b e p l a y e d o n t h e s a m e g r o u n d o n
o r b e f o r e t h e f o l l o w i n g T h u r s d a y in t h e Q u a l i f y i n g C o m p e ­
t i t i o n a n d o n t h e f o l l o w i n g M o n d a y in t h e C o m p e t i t i o n
P r o p e r . If e x t r a t i m e h a s n o t b e e n c o m m e n c e d o r a m a t c h
h a s been a b a n d o n e d d u rin g extra tim e a n d n eith er C lub
b e i n g at fa u l t, it m u s t b e p l a y e d o n th e g r o u n d o f th e C l u b
second d ra w n o n o r b e fo re the follow ing T h u rsd a y .
            RULES OF THE CHALLENGE CUP COMPETITION                                     143



M a t c h e s a b a n d o n e d t h r o u g h the fault o f th e C lu b s sh all be
d ealt w ith by th e C o u n c i l.
    (v ) If th e m a t c h be d r a w n o r again p o s t p o n e d or a b a n ­
d o n e d it sh all b e p la y e d o n th e f o l l o w i n g M o n d a y in the
Q u a l if y in g C o m p e t i t i o n a n d o n the f o l l o w i n g T h u r s d a y in
t h e C o m p e t i t i o n P ro p er, u n le s s the C l u b s m u t u a l ly a g ree to
a n earlier d a y a n d at o n c e j o i n t ly in t im a t e their d e c i s i o n to
th e S ecretary o f th e A s s o c i a t i o n .
    ( v i ) If a s u b s e q u e n t m a t c h is n e c e s s a r y , it m u s t be p la y ed
o n o r b e fo r e th e f o l l o w i n g T h u r s d a y in the Q u a l if y in g
C o m p e t i t i o n a n d o n o r b e fo r e th e f o l l o w i n g M o n d a y in the
C o m p e t i t i o n P rop er.
    Replays
    (vii) T h e agreem en t b etw een the C lu bs for the replaying o f
m a tch es in the C om p etition Proper shall be subject to the
app roval o f the C oun cil.
    (viii) W h en a first m a t ch has resulted in a draw, it m u st be
replayed on the follow ing T hursday, unless the Clu b s
mutually agree to an earlier day.
    (ix) If t h e s e c o n d m a t c h s h o u l d als o result in a d ra w or
e x tr a t i m e n o t b e i n g c o m p l e t e d a nd n e it h e r C l u b b e i n g at
fault, it m u s t b e r e p l a y e d n o t later th a n th e fo l lo w in g
M o n d a y . U n l e s s m u t u a l ly a g r e e d o t h e r w i s e , this will b e
p la y e d o n th e g r o u n d o f t h e C lu b w i n n in g th e to ss o f a c o i n .
T h e v e n u e for a s e c o n d rep la y m u s t be d e c i d e d at th e
c o n c l u s i o n o f t h e first m a t c h . In this c a s e , a further rep la y
w o u l d be p la y e d o n th e g r o u n d o f th e C lu b lo sin g th e to ss.
T h is p r o c e d u r e will b e r e p e a t e d until a w in n e r has b e e n
determ ined.
    (x) I f a subse quent m atch is necessary, it m ust be played
on or before the fo llo w in g T hursday.
    (xi) W h en a replayed m atch has resulted in a draw, an
extra half-hour m u st be pla yed and in this ev ent the g a m e
shall be re c o m m e n c e d as provided by L a w 8, and fifteen
minutes shall be p la y ed ea ch way.
    (xii) In a third or subse quent match, C lu bs are not required
to play for m o re than tw o hours.
13.      Floodlighting
   (i )    In the Q u a l if y in g C o m p e t i t i o n a n d in th e C o m p e ­
tition P r o p e r , e x c e p t in th e c a s e o f m a t c h e s s c h e d u l e d t o b e
144           R U L E S OF T H E C H A L L E N G E C U P C O MP E T I TI O N



p la y e d on the g ro u n d of a Football L e a g u e C lu b , m a tch es
m a y b e p l a y e d u n d e r f l o o d l i g h t c o n d i t i o n s p r o v i d e d tha t
the installation m e e ts with the a p p ro v a l o f T h e A ssociation
o r b y m u t u a l a g r e e m e n t o f th e t w o C l u b s .
     (ii) E x c e p t w h e r e t h e t w o C l u b s m u t u a l l y a g r e e o t h e r ­
w i s e , C l u b s w i s h i n g to pl ay m a t c h e s e i t h e r w h o l l y o r pa rt ly
u n d e r f l o o d l i g h t c o n d i t i o n s m u s t h a v e th e a p p r o v a l o f the
C o u n c i l to u s e t h e i n s t a l l a t i o n . C l u b s m u s t s u b m i t a n n u a l l v
to t h e S e c r e t a r y o f T h e A s s o c i a t i o n d e t a i l s o f t h e i n s ta l l­
a t i o n , w h i c h m u s t c o n f o r m to th e r e q u i r e m e n t s laid d o w n
by the C ouncil.
    (iii) C l u b s m a y a p p e a l to t h e C o u n c i l w it h i n t h r e e davs
o f t h e r e c e i p t o f t h e official i n t i m a t i o n o f t h e d r a w if th e y
c o n s i d e r th e f l o o d l i g h t s o f t h e C l u b o n w h o s e g r o u n d th e tie
is to b e p l a y e d to b e b e l o w th e r e q u i r e d s t a n d a r d . Su ch
a p p e a l m u s t b e a c c o m p a n i e d by a f e e o f £ 2 5 , w hich m a y be
f o r f e i t e d if th e a p p e a l is n o t s u s t a i n e d .

     (iv) In t h e C o m p e t i t i o n P r o p e r m a t c h e s s c h e d u l e d to be
p l a y e d o n th e g r o u n d o f a F o o t b a l l L e a g u e C l u b m u s t be
p la y ed e i th e r partly o r wholly u n d e r floodlighting condi­
t i o n s , k i c k i n g - o f f , in th e c a s e o f m i d w e e k m a t c h e s , at 7.30
p .m . o r 7.45 p.m .

     (v ) F lood lighting m a y be used p r o v id e d that:-
     ( a ) A n e m e r g e n c y li g h ti n g s y s t e m ex i st s w h i c h m e e t s
 w i t h th e a p p r o v a l o f t h e local p o l i c e o r o t h e r r e s p o n s i b l e
 authorities.
     ( b ) C o - o p e r a t i o n w it h t h e T r a n s p o r t A u t h o r i t i e s an d
 p o l i c e is a s s u r e d .
     (c ) A w h i t e bal l is u s e d f o r t h e e n t i r e m a t c h a n d a
 r e p l a c e m e n t is a v a i l a b l e f o r use if r e q u i r e d .

     (v i) T h e R e f e r e e will d e c i d e at w h a t p o i n t in t h e g a m e
t h e lights shal l b e s w i t c h e d o n . T h i s will n e c e s s i t a t e a
d i s c u s s i o n w i t h r e s p o n s i b l e officials o f t h e c o m p e t i n g C lu b s
b e fo r e th e g a m e w h e n an a g re e d signal m u s t be arran g ed .
T h e c o s t o f f l o o d l i g h t i n g n o t e x c e e d i n g (i) in t h e Q u a l i f y i n g
C o m p e t i t i o n £ 5 0 a n d (ii) in t h e C o m p e t i t i o n P r o p e r £100,
m a y be c h a rg e d to m a tc h expenses.

14.     R eporting Results
    (i) T h e S e c r e t a r i e s o f e a c h C lu b shall s e n d n o t i c e o f the
result w ith th e n a m e s o f th e P la yers c o m p e t i n g , o n th e form
s u p p l i e d , to th e S e c r e t a r y o f the A s s o c i a t i o n s o that it is
r e c e i v e d w ith in t w o d a y s o f the m atch (S u n d a y s not
in c l u d e d ).
   (ii) C lu b s failin g to c o m p l y with this R u l e shall be
su b j e c t to a fi ne o f £ 1 0 . 0 0 a nd in d efau lt o f p a y m e n t shall be
struck o u t o f the C o m p e t i t i o n .
     (iii) T h e S e c r e ta r i e s o f C lu b s draw n at H o m e m ust
t e l e p h o n e th e result to T h e F o o t b a l l A s s o c i a t i o n as s o o n as
p o s s i b le aft er ties.

15.     Provisions for Sem i-Final Ties
    (i) T h e C o u n c i l shall fix th e g r o u n d for all S e m i -F in a l
T i e s , a n d shall h a v e d ir ect c o n tr o l o f the a r r a n g e m e n t s .
    (ii) W h e n a m a t c h h a s r e su lte d in a d r a w , an extra
h a lf -h o u r m u st be p l a y e d , and in this e v e n t , the g a m e shall
r e c o m m e n c e as p r o v i d e d by L aw 8, an d fifteen m i n u t e s
shall b e p la y e d e a c h w a y .
     (iii) W h e n a m atch has r e su lted in a d raw after ex tra
t i m e , it m u st be r e p l a y e d o n or b e f o r e the f o l lo w in g
Thursday.
   (i v) If the s e c o n d m a t c h s h o u l d als o result in a d r a w , it
m u st b e r e p l a y e d o n o r b e f o r e th e fo l l o w i n g M o n d a y .

16.     Provisions for Final Tie
  (i) T h e C o u n c i l shall fix the g r o u n d for the F in al T i e and
shall h a v e d ir ect c o n t r o l o f th e a r r a n g e m e n t s .
   (ii) If th e result is a d r a w , an extra h a lf -h o u r shall be
p la y e d .
  (iii) T h e C o u n c i l shall fix th e d a t e on w h i c h the m a t c h
shall b e r e p l a y e d , if th e result is still a draw.
   (iv ) W h e n a r e p l a y e d m a t c h has resulted in a d r a w , an
ex tra h a lf -h o u r m u st b e p la y e d .

    (i)    A n y C lu b i n t e n d in g t o scratch m ust g iv e in f o r m a ti o n
o f their in t e n tio n to d o s o to th e S e c r e ta r y o f th e o p p o s i n g

C l u b , n o t less t h a n e i g h t d a y s b e f o r e t h e d a t e fi xe d for
p la y in g .
    (ii) A C l u b fa ili ng to c o m p l y w i t h this ru l e sh a l l be
r e p o r t e d t o t h e C o u n c i l , w h o shal l h a v e p o w e r to c o m p e l
s u c h o f f e n d i n g C l u b to p a y t h e e x p e n s e s i n c u r r e d a n d t a k e
s u c h a c t i o n as t h e y m a y d e e m e x p e d i e n t .

 i n t i m a t i o n m u s t b e g iv e n t o its o p p o n e n t at t h e cl os e o f th e

 C o m p e t i t i o n t h e f o l l o w i n g s e a s o n a n d sha ll b e li ab le to a
 fi ne.

 p l a y w i t h o u t s h o w i n g a g o o d a n d s u f f i c i e n t c a u s e fo r such

 w i t h u n d e r R u l e 26 o f t h e A s s o c i a t i o n .


 18.      Provisions Concerning Q ualifications of Players
      (i) T h e C u p sh al l b e c o m p e t e d f o r a n n u a l l y in a c c o r d ­
 a n c e w i t h t h e s e R u l e s a n d m a t c h e s sh a ll b e p l a c e d u n d e r
 t h e L a w s o f t h e G a m e as a p p r o v e d by t h e I n t e r n a t i o n a l
 F o o t b a l l A s s o c i a t i o n B o a r d . U n l e s s a s a t i s f a c t o r y r e a s o n is
 g i v e n , e a c h t e a m shal l r e p r e s e n t t h e full a v a i l a b l e s t r e n g t h
 o f each c o m p e tin g Club.
      (ii) A c l u b m a y at its d i s c r e t i o n u s e t w o s u b s t i t u t e
 p l a y e r s at a n y t i m e in a C u p T i e , e x c e p t t o r e p l a c e a p l a y e r
 w h o h a s b e e n s u s p e n d e d f r o m t h e g a m e by th e R e f e r e e
 a f t e r p l a y ha s c o m m e n c e d . T h e s u b s t i t u t i o n c a n o n ly be
 m a d e w h e n p l a y is s t o p p e d fo r a n y r e a s o n a n d t h e R e f e r e e
 h a s g iv e n p e r m i s s i o n . O n l y t w o s u b s t i t u t e s by e a c h side will
 b e p e r m i t t e d in a n y m a t c h a n d t h e t w o s u b s t i t u t e p la y ers
 sh a ll b e n o m i n a t e d to t h e R e f e r e e at le a s t 30 m i n u t e s p ri o r
 to t h e c o m m e n c e m e n t o f t h e g a m e by t h e C l u b S e c r e t a r y or
 his d e p u t y .
    (iii) T h e p l a y e r s shall a l so b e d u l y q u a l i f i e d a c c o r d i n g to
 the R u les of the A ssociation.

    (i v) A p la y e r sh all n o t in th e s a m e s e a s o n p la y for m o r e
th a n o n e c o m p e t i n g C lu b , but the m e m b e r s o f ea c h
r e s p e c t iv e t e a m m a y b e c h a n g e d d u rin g t h e se r i e s o f
m a t c h e s.
    (v) A p la y e r w h o has b e e n s u s p e n d e d m a y p la y in
p o s t p o n e d , d raw n or r e p l a y e d ti e s aft er th e term o f his
s u s p e n s io n has e x p ir e d .
    (v i) A s u b s t itu t e w h o is n o t u s e d is e n t i t l e d t o p l a y for
a n o t h e r C l u b in th e s a m e s e a s o n .
    (vii) C lu b s m u st h a n d c o p i e s o f a list o f n a m e s o f p la y e r s
ta k in g part in th e g a m e (i n c lu d i n g the n a m e s o f the
n o m i n a t e d s u b s t itu t e s ) t o th e R e f e r e e a n d a r e p r e s e n t a t iv e
o f th eir o p p o n e n t s in th e p r e s e n c e o f the R e f e r e e at le a st 3 0
m i n u te s b e f o r e th e a d v e r t i s e d ti m e o f k ic k - o ff. A n y C lu b
failing t o carry o u t t h e s e p r o v is io n s will be f i n e d a s u m n o t
exceeding £100.
    (viii) In all ro u n d s o f the C o m p e t i t i o n a p la y e r m u st
h a v e b e e n a r e g i s te r e d m e m b e r o f his C lu b at le ast 7 d a y s
p r e v i o u s to th e t i m e f i x e d for p la y i n g th e m a tch .
    In th e c a s e o f p o s t p o n e d , d ra w n or r e p l a y e d m a t c h e s
o n ly t h o s e p la y e r s shall be a l l o w e d t o p la y w h o w e r e
el ig ib le at th e t i m e f i x e d f o r p la y in g the rou nd.
    (ix) A r e g i s te r e d m e m b e r is o n e w h o has e i th e r , in the
case o f a p la y e r u n d e r w r itt e n c o n tr a c t , r e g i s te r e d w it h th e
A s s o c i a t i o n or, in t h e c a s e o f a p la y e r w i t h o u t a w r itten
c o n tr act, r e g i s te r e d w ith a L e a g u e in w h i c h his C lu b
c o m p e t e s in th e cu rren t s e a s o n .
    (x) A p la y e r o n t e m p o r a r y ( l o a n ) tr ansfer is in e l i g i b l e to
c o m p e t e u n le s s p e r m i s s i o n is g iv e n by the l o a n i n g C lu b in
writing a nd a c o p y is s u b m i t t e d t o th e S e c r e ta r y o f T h e
A s s o c i a t i o n p rio r to th e tie.

19.      Validity o f P layers’ Qualifications
    If th e C o u n c i l h a v e an y d o u b t as to th e q u a li fi c a tio n s o f
any p la y e r t a k in g part in this C o m p e t i t i o n , t h e y shall h a v e
p o w e r to call u p o n s u c h p la y e r , o r th e C lu b t o w h i c h h e
b e lo n g s , or fo r w h i c h h e p la y e d , to p r o v e th at h e is
q ualified a c c o r d i n g t o th e R u l e s , a n d faili ng s a tisfa cto ry
p r o o f th e C o u n c i l m a y d isquali fy su c h p la y e r , a n d m a y
148        R U L E S OF T H E C H A L L E N G E C U P CO MPETITION



 rem o v e the C lub from the C o m p e titio n , an d im po se such
 o t h e r p e n a l t y as t h e y m a y t h i n k fit.

 20.      D isq u alific a tio n

 c o m p e tin g C lu b , o r p layer, or players for any c o m p e tin g
 C l u b , w h o m a y b e p r o v e d t o b e g ui l ty o f a n y b r e a c h i n g o f
 the A ssociation R ules.

 21.       P ro v is io n s C o n c e r n in g R efer ee s an d L in e sm e n
     (i) In all m a t c h e s in t h e C o m p e t i t i o n t h e R e f e r e e s a n d
 L i n e s m e n sh a ll b e a p p o i n t e d by t h e C h a l l e n g e C u p C o m ­
 m itte e . N e i t h e r p a st n o r p re s e n t m e m b e r s o f e i th e r o f the
 c o n t e n d i n g C l u b s shall b e el ig ib l e. A s t a n d - b y O f f i c i a l shal l
 b e a p p o i n t e d to o f f i c i a t e in t h e C o m p e t i t i o n P r o p e r in t h e
 e v e n t o f a n a p p o i n t e d O ff i c ia l fa ili ng to a r r i v e o r b e c o m i n g
 in c ap acitated .
      (ii) T h e f ee s a n d e x p e n s e s o f all of f ic i al s a p p o i n t e d by
  t h e C h a l l e n g e C u p C o m m i t t e e t o o f f i c i a t e in a n y m a t c h
  p r i o r t o t h e S e m i - F i n a l a n d F i n a l T i e s sh al l b e p a i d b y t h e
  C lu b u p o n w h o se g r o u n d the m a tc h ta k e s pla ce unless
  o th e rw ise in stru c ted by the Council.
      (iii) Scale o f E x p e n se s to be P aid to O fficials
           ( a ) I n t h e Q u a l i f y i n g C o m p e t i t i o n s e c o n d cl as s r a i l ­
       w a y f a r e s o p e r a t i n g o n t h e d a y o f t h e m a t c h will b e
       allow ed.
           (b) In th e C o m p e t it io n P r o p e r , th e S em i-F in al and
       F i n a l T i e s first cl as s r a i l w a y f a r e s o p e r a t i n g o n t h e d a y o f
       t h e m a t c h will b e a l l o w e d .
            (c) I n t h e e v e n t o f a R e f e r e e o r L i n e s m a n b e i n g
       u n a b l e t o r e a c h his d e s t i n a t i o n , g o i n g t o o r r e t u r n i n g
       f r o m a m a t c h , w i t h o u t s t a y i n g a t a n h o t e l , h e sh a l l b e
       e n t i t l e d to c h a r g e £ 2 4 f o r e a c h n i g h t to c o v e r his h o t e l
       expenses.

       £ 0 . 1 3 p e r m i l e will b e a l l o w e d t o all of fi ci al s o f f i c i a t i n g
       w h o travel by p riv a te car.

       p e r m i l e will b e a l l o w e d to all off icials o f f i c i a t i n g w h o
        travel by p riv a te car.

titors, o r in t e r p r e ta t io n o f th e R u le s , d r a n y d is p u te o r

    (ii) E v e r y p r o t e s t m u s t b e m a d e in w r i t i n g a n d m u s t

p ro test not being sustained.

b a r s Or o t h e r a p p u r t e n a n c e s o f t h e g a m e sh al l n o t b e
e n t e r t a i n e d by t h e C o u n c i l u n l e s s a n o b j e c t i o n h a s b e e n
l o d g e d w i t h th e R e f e r e e b e f o r e t h e c o m m e n c e m e n t o f t h e

o f t h e k i c k - o f f . T h e R e f e r e e sha ll r e q u i r e t h e r e s p o n s i b l e

w ith o u t u n d u ly d elay in g the p ro g r e s s of th e m a tch .

o f t h e p r o t e s t a n d p a r t i c u l a r s to t h e C l u b p r o t e s t e d a g a i n s t .

 25.      A d m iss io n to C u p T ies— S a le o f T ick e ts
     (i) T h e h o m e C l u b sh a ll p r o v i d e fo r t h e s a l e o f ti ck et s
 a n d fo r t h e v i s it in g C l u b to c h e c k t h e sa l e .
     (ii) A l l m e m b e r s m u s t b e c h a r g e d a d m i s s i o n to the
 g r o u n d , e n c l o s u r e a n d s t a n d s in m a t c h e s in all C u p ' l i e s .
      (iii) T h e p r i c e o f a d m i s s i o n f o r c h i l d r e n a n d s e n i o r
 c i t i z e n s sh a l l b e m u t u a l l y a g r e e d b e t w e e n t h e c o m p e t i n g
 Clubs.
     (iv) T h e p r i c e s o f t i c k e t s s h o u l d b e m u t u a l l y a g r e e d
 u p o n b e t w e e n the two C lubs in te r e s te d im m e d ia te ly after
 the d ra w .
     (v ) T h e m i n i m u m a d m i s s i o n ( e x c e p t t o c h i l d r e n a n d
 S e n i o r c i t i z e n s ) t o m a t c h e s in t h e Q u a l i f y i n g C o m p e t i t i o n
 shal l b e £ 0 . 8 0 a n d t o all m a t c h e s in t h e C o m p e t i t i o n P r o p e r
 £1.00 (c h ild re n a n d S en io r citizens e x c e p te d ) . In m a tch es
 involving a F o o tb all L eag u e C lu b th e m in im u m adm ission
 sh al l b e £ 1 . 5 0 .
    A l l q u e s t i o n s in d i s p u t e shal l i m m e d i a t e l y b e r e f e r r e d to
 T h e F ootball A ssociation for settlem e n t.
    (vi) A h i g h e r a d m i s s i o n c h a r g e m a y b e m u t u a l l y a g r e e d
 b etw een th e C lubs concerned.
 26.      D istrib u tio n o f T ick ets
      (a) A l l R o u n d s Preceding Sem i-F in a ls
     In all C u p T i e s , e x c e p t t h e S e m i - F i n a l a n d F i n a l ' l i e s , th e
 v is it in g C l u b sh a l l h a v e t h e r i g h t t o c l a i m u p t o 25 p e r c e n t

o f all a c c o m m o d a t i o n for w h ic h tick ets are is s u e d , p r o v id ­
ing t h e s e tick ets are in a fu lly s e g r e g a t e d a r e a a n d su b je c t to
th e f o l lo w in g r e g u la tio n s :—
    (i) T h e r e q u e st fo r tic k e ts shall b e m a d e w ith in th re e
d a y s o f th e draw .
    (ii) T h e tic k e ts a llo tt e d to th e v isitin g C lu b , if n u m b e r e d
a n d r e s e r v e d , m u st b e o f e q u a l v a lu e to t h o s e r e ta in e d b y
th e h o m e C lu b .
   (iii) In c a s e s o f r e p la y e d ties, th e visitin g C lu b m u st
m a k e a r e q u e st for tic k e ts i m m e d i a t e ly a fter th e d raw n
gam e.
    (iv ) T h e visitin g C lu b shall b e r e s p o n s ib le for the
p a y m e n t o f all tic k e ts a s k e d fo r a n d a llo tt e d . A l l q u e s t i o n s
in d is p u te shall im m e d i a t e ly b e r e fe rr e d to T h e F o o tb a ll
A s s o c i a t i o n for s e t t le m e n t .
     (v ) A v isitin g C lu b shall b e e n t i t l e d to o n e third o f th e
s e a t s u su a lly r e s e r v e d a n d k n o w n as th e “ H o m e and
V isitin g D ir e c to r s ' S e a t s ” .
   W h e r e it is d e e m e d d e s ir a b le , th e C o u n c i l shall h a v e th e
right to vary th e a llo c a tio n o f tic k e ts to t h e visitin g C lu b or
re q u ir e a m a tc h to b e m a d e all tick et.

   ( b ) S e m i-F in a l Ties
    In th e S e m i-F in a l T i e s th e t w o c o m p e t in g C lu b s shall be
e n t i t l e d to 5 0 p e r c e n t e a c h o f th e tick ets fo r sa le. T h e
A s s o c i a t i o n in its a b s o l u t e d is c r e tio n m a y vary t h e s e
a llo c a tio n s.

    It is th e r e sp o n sib ilit y o f th e h o m e o r h o s t C lu b in th e
C o m p e t i t io n P r o p e r to e n s u r e that a q u a lifie d m e d ic a l
p r a c titio n e r is in a t t e n d a n c e at le a s t 3 0 m i n u t e s p rio r to
k ic k - o ff a n d th r o u g h o u t th e m a t c h , a n d th a t h e is a f f o r d e d
r e a d y a c c e ss to t h e p la y in g a rea .

5.     E lig ib le C lu b s
    T h e C o m p e t i t i o n sh a l l b e o p e n (i) to all C l u b s o u t s i d e t h e
F o o t b a l l L e a g u e t a k i n g p a r t in a L e a g u e o r C o m p e t i t i o n

ba ll A s s o c i a t i o n ; (ii) t o W e l s h C l u b s o u t s i d e t h e F o o t b a l l

the e n try o f an y Club.

6.     D a te s for E n try
     E a c h C lub (oth er th a n W elsh C lubs) de siro u s o f c o m p e t­
in g sh a l l c o m p l e t e a n e n t r y f o r m a n d r e t u r n it t o T h e S e c r e t ­
a r y o f t h e A s s o c i a t i o n , t o g e t h e r w i t h t h e e n t r a n c e fee o f £ 2 0
so t h a t t h e f o r m is re c e i v e d o n o r b e f o r e t h e 1 st d a y o f A p r i l
p r e v i o u s t o t h e s e a s o n in w h i c h s u c h C l u b p r o p o s e s t o
c o m p e t e . W e l s h C l u b s d e s i r o u s o f c o m p e t i n g in a c c o r d a n c e
w i t h R u l e 5 m u s t f o r w a r d t h e e n t r y f o r m b e f o r e t h e 1 st d a y
of M arch.

tion P ro per.

    T h e C o m p e t i t io n P r o p e r shall c o n s i s t o f 6 4 C lu b s n a m e ly

m u tu a lly agree to an earlier day. C lu b s m a y m u tu a lly agree
to p l a y a r e p l a y o n t h e f o l l o w i n g S a t u r d a y , s u b j e c t to t h e i r
re l e a s e f r o m a n y e x i s t i n g f i x t u r e a n d m u s t n o t i f y t h e

 m in u te s sh a ll be p la y e d e a c h w a y .

 required to p lay fo r m o r e th a n tw o h o u r s.

 a rr a n g e m e n ts if it is d e e m e d n e c e s s a r y .

21.     Provisions Concerning Referees and Linesmen
    ( i ) In all m a t c h e s R e fe r e e s an d L in e s m e n shall be
a p p o in t e d by th e C h a lle n g e T r o p h y C o m m i t t e e . N e ith e r
p a st n o r p r ese n t m e m b e r s o f e ith er o f the c o n t e n d i n g C lu b s
shall be elig ib le .
   (ii) T h e fees and exp en ses o f all officials appointed by the
C hallen ge T ro p h y C o m m itte e to officiate in any m a tc h prior
to the Sem i-Final and Final Ties shall be paid b y the Club
upon w h o s e ground the m a tch takes place unless otherw ise
instructed by the Council.
   (iii) Scale o f Expenses to be Paid to Officials
   (a ) In th e Q u a lif y in g C o m p e t i t i o n , s e c o n d class railw ay
fare o p e r a tin g o n th e d a y o f th e m a tc h w ill b e a ll o w e d .
   ( b ) In th e C o m p e t i t i o n P r o p e r , th e S e m i-F in a l a n d Fin al
T ie s , first cla ss railw ay fa r e s o p e r a tin g o n th e d a y o f th e
m a tc h w ill b e a ll o w e d .
    (c ) In th e e v e n t o f a R e f e r e e o r L in e s m a n b e i n g u n a b le
to reach his d e s t in a t i o n , g o in g t o o r retu rn in g fr o m a
m a t c h , w i t h o u t sta y in g at an h o t e l , h e shall b e e n t i t l e d to
c h a r g e £ 2 4 fo r e a c h n ig h t to c o v e r his h o te l e x p e n s e s .
    ( d ) A n a ll o w a n c e o f £ 0 .1 3 p e r m ile w ill b e a ll o w e d to all
o fficals o ffic ia tin g w h o travel b y p riv a te car.
   ( e ) In th e C o m p e t i t i o n P r o p e r , th e S e m i-F in a l a n d Final

C o u n c i l m a y re je ct th e e n t ry o f a n y C lu b.

12.      Provision for Matches Preceding Semi-Final Ties
    For all m a tch es preceding the Sem i-F inal Ties, the
following p rovisions shall apply:—
    (i) C lu b s shall not m u tually arrange to play a m a tch in lieu
o f a V ase Tie.
    (ii) A n y late k ic k -o ff m u s t be reported b y the Referee to the
Football A sso c ia tio n and the C ouncil shall h av e p ow er to
im pose a fine.
    (iii) In th e e v e n t o f a n y m a tc h p rior to the S e m i-F in a l
r esu ltin g in a draw , e xtra tim e o f 15 m in u te s ea c h w a y shall
be p la y ed , o r if, in th e o p i n i o n o f th e R efe r e e , p rev a ilin g
  ir c u m sta n ce s w o u l d n o t p erm it th e m a t c h b e in g fin is h e d ,
10 m in u te s e a c h w a y m a y b e p la y ed . In th is c a s e th e R e fe r e e

s h a l l d e c i d e a t t h e e n d o f full t i m e a n d p r i o r to t h e c o m ­
m e n c e m e n t o f e x tra tim e an d notify b o th te am s.

    First M a tch e s which are P ostponed or A b a n d o n ed
    (iv) W h e n a first m a t c h h a s b e e n p o s t p o n e d o r a b a n d o n e d
be fo r e th e c o m p l e t i o n o f 9 0 m i n u te s a n d neith er C l u b be ing at
fault, it m u s t b e p l a y e d o n the s a m e g r o u n d on or be fo r e the
following S a t u r d a y . If e x t ra ti me h a s n o t b e e n c o m m e n c e d or
a m a t c h h a s be e n a b a n d o n e d d u r i n g e x t r a time a n d neither
C l u b being at fault, it m u s t b e p la y e d o n the g r o u n d o f the
C l u b s e c o n d d r a w n o n or b ef o r e the following S a t u r d a y .
M a t c h e s a b a n d o n e d t h r o u g h th e fault o f the C l u b s shall be
de al t with b y the C o u n ci l .
    (v) I f the m a t c h be d r a w n o r a ga in p o s t p o n e d or
a b a n d o n e d it shall b e p la y e d on the following T h u r s d a y
unless the C l u b s m u t u a l l y a g re e to an earlier d a y a n d at o n c e
joi ntl y in t im at e their de c is io n to th e S e c r e t a r y o f the
A ss o c i a ti o n .

o n or b e fo r e th e following M o n d a y .



    Replays
     (vii) T h e a g r e e m e n t b e t w e e n th e C l u b s for th e re p l a y in g of
m a t c h e s in the C o m p e t i t i o n shall be su b j ec t to th e a p p r o v a l of
th e C o un ci l.
     (viii) W h e n a first m a t c h h a s res ulte d in a d r a w , it m u s t be
r e p l a y e d o n the following S a t u r d a y unless the C l u b s m u t u a ll y
ag ree to a n earlier d a y .
     (ix) I f the s e c o n d m a t c h s h o u l d also res ult in a d r a w or
e x t ra ti m e no t be in g c o m p l e t e d a n d nei the r C l u b be ing at
fault, it m u s t be r e p l a y e d n o t later t h a n the following
T h u r s d a y . U n le s s m u t u a ll y a g re e d o th e rw is e, this will be
p la y e d o n the g r o u n d o f th e C l u b wi nn in g the to s s o f a coin,
w h ic h m u s t t a k e p la ce at th e c o n c l u s io n o f the s e c o n d m a t c h .
In this case , a f u r th e r re pl ay w o u ld be p la y e d o n the g r o u n d
o f the C l u b losing th e toss. T h is p r o c e d u r e will be re p e a t e d
until a w in n er h a s b e e n de te rm i n e d .
     (x) If a s u b s e q u e n t m a t c h is n e c e s s a ry , it m u s t be p la y e d
o n o r b ef o r e the following M o n d a y .
          RULES OF THE CHALLENG E VASE COMPETITION                                     J69


   (x i) W h e n a rep la y e d m a t c h h a s r e su lte d in a d raw , an
extra h a lf -h o u r m u s t b e p la y e d a n d in th is e v e n t th e g a m e
shall be r e c o m m e n c e d a s p r o v id e d b y L a w 8 , and fifteen
m in u te s sh a ll b e p la y e d e a c h w a y .
   (x ii) In a th ird or s u b s e q u e n t m a t c h , C lu b s are n o t
required to p la y for m o r e th a n tw o h ou rs.

13.     Floodlighting
   (i) M a tch es m a y b e played either partly or w holly under
floodlight con d ition s provided that both Clubs are in
agreement.
   (ii) F loodlighting m a y b e used provided that:—
       (a) A n em er g en cy lighting sy ste m exists which meets
   with the approval o f th e local p olice or other responsible
   authorities.
        (b) C o-o p era tio n w ith the T ransport A uthorities and
   Police is assured.
        (c) A white ball is used for the entire m a tch and a
   replacem ent is available for u se if required.
   (iii) T h e R e fe r e e w ill d e c id e at w h a t p o in t in th e g a m e th e
lights shall b e s w it c h e d o n . T h is w ill n e c e s s ita t e a d is c u s ­
sion w ith r e s p o n s i b le o ff ic ia ls o f th e c o m p e t in g C lu b s
before th e g a m e w h e n an a g reed sig n a l m u s t b e arran ged .
T h e c o s t o f fl o o d li g h t in g n o t e x c e e d in g £ 5 0 . 0 0 m a y be
ch arged to m a t c h e x p e n s e s .
   (iv ) It is th e r e s p o n s ib ilit y o f th e v is itin g C l u b ’s O f fic ia ls
to sa tisfy th e m s e lv e s p r io r to a greein g to p la y u n d er f l o o d ­
light c o n d it io n s , th at th e sta n d a r d o f fl o o d li g h t in g a v a ila b le
is, in their o p i n i o n , a d e q u a te fo r th e ir V a s e T ie .

    A s C h allen g e C up Rules.

ba sis. T h e C lu b first d raw n sh a ll p la y th e first m a t c h at
h o m e . T h e C lu b s e c o n d d ra w n shall p la y the s e c o n d m a tc h
at h o m e .
   (ii) I f th e a g g r eg a te s c o r e is level at the e n d o f th e s e c o n d
m a tch , an extra h a lf -h o u r sh all b e p la y e d a n d i f th e s c o r e is
still level at th e e n d o f th e extra tim e , th e m a t c h sh a ll be
           R U L E S O F T H E C H A L L E N G E VASE CO M P E T IT IO N



r e p l a y e d o n a n e u t r a l g r o u n d o n a d a t e t o b e fi xe d b y t h e

2 1 . Provisions C oncerning Referees and Linesm en
     (i) In all m a t c h e s , Refer ees a n d L i n e s m e n shall be
a p p o i n t e d by t h e C h a ll e n g e Vas e C o m m i t t e e . N e i t h e r p a st
n o r p r e s e n t m e m b e r s o f either o f t h e c o n t e n d i n g C l u b s shall

C h a l l e n g e V as e C o m m i t t e e to officiate in a n y m a t c h p ri o r to
th e S e m i -F i n a l a n d F in a l Ties shall be pa i d b y t h e C l u b upon
w h o s e g r o u n d th e m a t c h t a k e s p la c e unless othe rwis e
i n s tr u c te d by th e Co un cil .

   fares o p e r a tin g o n th e d ay o f th e m a tc h w ill b e allow e d.

   to reach his d e s t in a tio n , g o in g to o r retu rn in g fro m a
   m a tc h , w ith o u t sta y in g at an h o te l, he shall b e en titled to
   c h a r g e f 2 4 . 0 0 fo r each n ig h t to c o v e r his h otel e x p e n ses.

   (d ) A n a ll o w a n c e o f £ 0 .1 3 p er m ile will b e a ll o w e d to

    24.     Paym ent o f E xpenses

    o f the v is itin g C lu b ( n o t e x c e e d i n g six teen in n u m b e r ) .
        (ii) In the F o u r th R o u n d to F in a l th e e x p e n s e s o f the
    m a tc h shall in c lu d e railw a y fares o f p la y e r s a n d o f f ic ia ls o f
    th e v is itin g C lu b ( n o t e x c e e d i n g tw e n ty in n u m b e r ) .
        (iii) T h e tr a v ellin g e x p e n s e s o f th e v is it i n g C lu b to be
    a llo w e d shall b e th e l o w e s t o r d in a r y ra ilw ay fa r e s a v a ila b le
    o n the d a y travelled (in c lu d i n g p arty o r c h e a p d ay rates as
    ava ila b le) a n d a c tu a lly incu rr ed fr o m the C l u b ’s h e a d q u a r ­
    ters.

    fares the ch a rg e m u s t n o t e x c e e d th e a m o u n t w h i c h w o u l d

    (b ) H otel Expenses

    in th e F o u r th , F ifth , S ix th , S e m i-F in a l a n d F in a l T ie s ,

    c o m m e n c e th e ir o u tw a r d j o u r n e y fr o m th e C l u b ’s H e a d ­
    quarters b e f o r e 8 a . m . , or t h e y are u n a b le to arrive h o m e
    b e fo r e m id n ig h t a fter c o m m e n c i n g th e retu rn j o u r n e y ,

    (n ot e x c e e d i n g t w e n t y in n u m b e r ) shall b e a ll o w e d if
    actually in c u rr e d .

re s id u e shall be div ided eq ual ly b e t w e e n the re m ai n i n g Club
a n d the C l u b on w h o s e g r o u n d the m a t c h is to be played.

                                           175


                  RULES OF THE COUNTY YOUTH
                  CHALLENGE CUP COMPETITION

1.   Name
   T h e C o m p e t it io n shall be called “ T h e Fo otball As sociation
C o u n ty Y o u th Cha lle nge C u p C o m p e t i t i o n . ”

2.    Cup Ownership
    T h e C u p is the p r o p e r t y o f T h e F o o tb a l l A s s o c i a t i o n Ltd.
     W h e n th e w in n in g C o u n t y A s s o c i a t i o n shall h a v e been
a s c e r ta i n e d , T h e F o o t b a l l A s s o c i a t i o n shall deliver th e C u p
to su c h C o u n t y A s s o c i a ti o n , w h ic h shall be res p o n si b l e for its
re t u rn to T h e F o o t b a l l A s s o c i a t i o n on o r b e f o r e the 1st d a y
o f M a r c h in th e en su i n g y e a r in g o o d o r d e r a n d con d it io n .
    Should the C u p be lost, d e s t ro y e d o r d a m a g e d by fire or any
o th e r c a u se whilst un d er the ca re or cu st o d y of the C o u n ty the
latter shall re f un d to the Asso cia tion the a m o u n t of its curr ent
insured value o r the c o s t o f th o ro ugh repai r in addi tio n to any
o th e r penal ty which T h e Football Asso cia tion ma y imp ose .

3.    Souvenirs
   In addition to the C u p , T h e Football As soc ia ti on shall p re s en t
sou ve n ir s to the pla yers and su bs ti tu te s in the Final Tie. W h e n a
player taking part is or d e r e d to leave the field o f play for
m i s co nd uc t, the so u v e n i r to which he may be entitled shall be
withheld at the d is cre ti on o f the Council.

4.    Control
    T h e en tire co n t ro l a n d m a n a g e m e n t o f the C o m p e t i t i o n
shall be vest ed in the C o u n c il . T h e C o u n c il shall h a v e p o w e r
to f o r m u l a te the R ul es o f the C o m p e t i t i o n a n d to alter or a d d
to the R ul es as the y, f r o m time to time , d e e m e x p ed ie n t. T h e
C o u n c il shall a p p o i n t a Y o u th C o m m i t t e e w h ic h shall be
em pow 'e red to co n t ro l a n d m a n a g e the C o m p e t i t i o n o n their
b e h a l f a n d to give d e ci si on s o n m a t t e r s arisin g o u t o f the
C o m p e t i t i o n w h ich , w ithin the rules laid d o w n by the
Co u n c il , shall be d e e m e d to be d e ci si on s o f the C o un ci l. In
a n y m a t t e r n o t specifically m e n t i o n e d in th e se Ru les , the
Y o u th C o m m i t t e e shall ha ve the p o w e r to t a k e su c h act ion
a n d im p o se s u c h pe nal ti es a s it d e e m s n ec es s ar y .
176                COUNTY YOUTH CHALLENGE CUP RULES



5.  Competition— Eligible Teams
  T h e C om pet it ion shall be on a kno ck -o u t basis and shall be
confined to m a tc he s b et w ee n te am s re p r es en ta t iv e of Co unty
Football Assoc ia tio ns, each C o u n ty Asso cia tion being eligible to
submit one entry only.
  All C o u n ty As sociations in England affiliated to Th e Football
Assoc iatio n shall be eligible to co m p e te .

6.      E n tr y A p p lic a t io n — D a te a n d Fee
    E a c h C o u n t y A s s o c i a t i o n d e s i r o u s o f c o m p e t i n g shall
c o m p l e t e a n e n t r y f o r m a n d r e t u r n it to t h e S e c r e t a r y o f
T h e F o o t b a l l A s s o c i a t i o n , t o g e t h e r w i t h t h e e n t r a n c e fee o f
£ 1 0 . 0 0 , so t h a t t h e f o r m is r e c e i v e d o n o r b e f o r e t h e first
d a y o f J u n e o f t h e s e a s o n in w h i c h s u c h C o u n t y A s s o c a t i o n
p r o p o s e s to c o m p e t e .

7.     P r o v isio n s R e g a r d in g Q u a lifica tio n s o f P la y er s
    (i) T h e p l a y e r s sha ll b e d u l y q u a l i f i e d a c c o r d i n g t o th e
R u les of the A ssociation.
    (ii) A player shall play for one C o u n ty only in any seas on of
this C om pet it ion , but the m e m be rs of any re pr e se nt at iv e team
may be cha n ge d during the series of m a tc he s if consi der ed
ne ce ss a ry .
    A C o u n t y m a y a t its disc ret ion use tw o s u b s t it u te pla ye rs
a t a n y ti me in a C u p tie, e x ce p t to r ep l ac e a p l a y e r w h o has
been s u s p e n d e d f r o m the g a m e by the Refer ee af te r pla y has
c o m m e n c e d . T h e s u b st it ut io n ca n o n ly be m a d e w h e n play is
st o p p e d f o r a n y re as o n a n d the R ef ere e h a s give n pe rm is sio n .
T h e n a m e s o f n o t m o r e t h a n five p l a y e r s f r o m w h o m t h e
su b s t it u te p la y e r s shall be c h o s e n shall be n o m i n a t e d to the
Refere e at le a st 3 0 m i n u t e s p ri or to th e c o m m e n c e m e n t o f the
g a m e b y the C o u n t y S e c r e t a r y o r his d e p u t y .        ^
    (iii) Only thos e players wh o have not re ach ed the age of 18
be for e the first day of August, of the cu rr en t se as o n , shall be
eligible to co m pe te.
     (iv) N o p l a y e r u n d e r w r i t t e n c o n t r a c t i n c l u d i n g T r a i n e e
p l a y e r s sh a l l b e e li g ib le t o c o m p e t e .
    (v) T h e S ec re t ar y of each C o u n ty Asso cia tion shall be the
p ers on held res pon sib le for ensur ing tha t each pla yer taking part
in his C o u n ty te am in any match in the C o m pe t it io n is qualified to
do so.
           COUNTY YOUTH C H A L LEN G E CUP RULES               177


  (vi) Birth Certificates or other satisfactory proof o f date of
birth must be produced for scrutiny by a representative o f the
opposing Association if requested providing that such request be
made at least five days prior to the match.
  (vii) Any County Association proved to have played any
ineligible player or to have knowingly contravened any Rule o f
the Competition shall be dealt with at the entire discretion o f the
Council.
  (viii) A player shall be eligible to play for the County o f his
birth, or he must be a recognised playing mem ber o f a club in
membership with the County Association for which he is
selected to play at least 14 days prior to the date fixed for the
playing o f any round. Providing he is qualified as above, a player
shall have the choice o f the County Association for which he
wishes to play.
   All clubs in current m em bership with a C o u n ty Minor
A ssociation are, ipso facto, considered to be in mem bership
with their C o u n ty A ssocia tio n .
  (ix) In the case of postponed, drawn or replayed matches only
those players shall be allowed to play who were eligible on the
date fixed for the playing o f the round.
  (x) A player w ho has been suspended may pla.y in postponed,
drawn or replayed ties after the term o f his suspension has
expired.


8.   Validity of Qualifications
   If the Council have any doubt as to the qualifications o f any
player taking part in this C ompetition, they shall have power to
call upon such player, or the County Association for which he
played, to prove that he is qualified according to the Rules, and
failing satisfactory proof, the Council may disqualify such
player, and may remove the County A ssociation from the
Competition, or im pose such other penalty as they may think fit.

9.   Disqualification
  The Council shall have the p ow er to disqualify any competing
County Association, or player, or players o f any competing
County Association, who may be proved to be guilty o f any
breach o f the Rules o f The Football Association.
178              COUNTY YOUTH C H A L L E N G E CUP RULES



 10. The Draw—Notification
   Im m ed iate ly after e ac h draw is m a d e , the S ec retary shall
intim ate to each C o u n ty A sso ci atio n, th e n a m e of its o p p o n e n t
and the d at e by which th e ma tc h is to be played.
   In the earlier ro u n ds th e d ra w may be m a de divisionally.
    W here alternative dates are allowed, the ‘H o m e ’ C oun ty
A sso cia tio n shall have the choice o f date, and its o p p on en ts
shall receive not less than 14 d a y s ’ notice in writing o f the
date selected. A ll m atches are to be p layed on a Saturday
unless m utually agreed otherwise.
   T he ‘H o m e ’ C o u n ty A ssociati on shall a rr a n ge for th e gro u n d
and o th e r m a tc h re q u ire m en ts .

 11. Ground for Ties and Replays
     (i) In e ac h tie th e ga m e shall be played on a g r o u n d w h ere a g a t e
 mu st be ta k e n of the C o u n ty Asso ci atio n first d r a w n unless
 othe rwise, mutually arran ged and th e c o n s e n t of the Council
o b ta in ed , s u b je c t as he re in af ter pro vid ed .
     In th e cas e of repla yed m a tc h e s, th e C o u n ty A ssociati on
 which had not the ch oi ce o f gro u nd for the first ma tch shall have
 ch oi ce of groun d for the seco nd ma tch .
    (ii) T h e dim en si on s of the field of play for ties shall b e:—
M ax im u m length - 120 ya rd s, m in im um length - 110 yards,
m a x im u m b re a d th - 80 y a rd s, mi nim um b re a d th - 70 yards. The
playing a re a mus t be en c lo se d by ro p e or othe r fence.
    Goal nets m u s t be used in all ties.
     (iii) If the g r o u n d o f th e C o u n ty A s s o c i a t i o n h a v in g
c h o ic e o f g r o u n d is c o n s id e r e d u n su ita b le for a tie, the
o p p o s i n g C o u n ty A s s o c i a t i o n m a y a p p e a l to the C o u n c il at
le a st seven d a y s b e fo r e the tie is du e to take p lace. Such
a p p ea l m u s t b e a c c o m p a n ie d by a fee o f £ 1 0 . 0 0 , w h ic h m ay
b e fo rfeited if the a p p ea l is n o t su sta in ed .                 ^
    T he Council ma y o rd e r the match to be played on a g ro u n d of
the ap pe alin g C o u n ty Associ atio n, or o n a neutral g rou n d . The
 p a y m e n t of the ex p e n se s incidental to the appeal shall be at the
d is cretio n of th e Council.
    (iv) Ea ch C o u n ty A ssociation should ask the Club on whose
g ro u n d a tie is due to be played to ta ke e v ery p re ca u tio n to keep
the pitch in playing condition , and if n e c e s s a ry , eith er C ou nty
 A ssoc ia tion may apply to T h e Fo otball Associ atio n and the
S e cre tary shall require th e R e fe re e or som e othe r Official to
                 COUNTY YOUTH CHALLENGE CUP RULES                            17 9


  exa m in e the groun d and d ecid e as to its fitness for play in
  sufficient tim e so as to save the e x p e n se s o f unnecessary
  jou rn eys b ein g incurred b y the C ou n ty A sso cia tio n s.
     Subject to this R u le th e R e fe r e e shall h av e p o w e r to d ecide
  as to th e fitness o f th e grou n d in all m atches.


  12.    Provisions for Final Tie
  T h e C oun cil shall fix th e date on w hich the m atch shall be
  p layed and shall also ap prove the c h o ic e o f grou n d s e le c te d by
  the C oun ty A sso c ia tio n first drawn and also th e tim e o f
  kick-off.


  13.    Colours
     In all m atches prior to th e Final T ie , w h e re the colours o f
  two c o m p etin g C ou n ty A sso cia tio n s are similar, the ‘H o m e ’
  side shall ch an ge its colours, u nless alternative arrangem ents
  are m utually agreed. In Final T ies b o th tea m s shall ch ange
  their colours.
     In th e e v en t o f the C o u n ty A sso c ia tio n s in th e Final T ie not
  agreeing upon the colours to b e w orn , T h e F o o tb a ll A s s o c ia ­
  tion shall decide.
     G o a lk eep ers m u st w ear colours w hich distinguish th em
  from the o th er players an d the M atch O fficials. P layers’ shirts
  should b e n u m b ered 1— 16.
     (Shirt advertising regulations as C h allen ge C up R u le s.)


  14.    Laws of the Game
    E x cep t as is p ro vid ed for in th ese R u le s, the L aw s o f th e
; G am e shall apply.


  15.    Duration of Matches
     T h e duration o f each m atch shall b e o n e hour and a half, but
  if local circum stances d e m a n d it, a m in im u m o f 80 m in u tes, in
  equal halves, m ay b e p layed . A n y decision h er e o n m ust b e
  mutually ag reed by the c o m p e tin g C oun ty A sso c ia tio n s, and
T notified to the R e fe r e e b e fo r e the c o m m e n c e m e n t o f the
  match. T h e R e fe r e e shall allow for tim e w asted o r lost through
%accident or o th er ca use, and his decision on this m atter is not
  subject to appeal.

16. Provisions for M atches
  In all m a t c h e s t h e fo llo w in g p ro v i s io n s shall ap pl y.
    (i) In th e e v e n t o f an y m a t c h in t h e C o m p e t i t i o n re s u lt in g in
a d r a w , e x t r a ti m e of 15 m i n u t e s e a c h w a y shall b e p l a y e d . If
p re v aili n g c i r c u m s ta n c e s w o u l d n o t p e r m i t t h e m a t c h b e i n g
fi nis h e d, 10 m i n u t e s e a c h w ay m a y b e p la y e d . In this ca se th e
R e f e r e e shall d e c i d e at t h e e n d o f Full ti m e a n d p r i o r to th e
c o m m e n c e m e n t o f e x t r a ti m e a n d n o ti fy b o t h te a m s .
    (ii) W h e n a m a t c h h as b e e n p o s t p o n e d o r a b a n d o n e d
b e f o r e th e c o m p l e t i o n o f 90 m i n u t e s a n d n e i t h e r C o u n t y b e i n g
at fau lt, it m u s t b e p l a y e d w it h in 14 days o f th e d a t e fi xe d fo r
t h e first m a tc h . If e x t r a ti m e h a s n o t b e e n c o m m e n c e d o r a
m a t c h h a s b e e n a b a n d o n e d d u r i n g e x t r a ti m e a n d n e i t h e r
C o u n t y b e i n g at fa u lt, it m u s t b e p l a y e d o n t h e g r o u n d o f t h e
C o u n t y s e c o n d d r a w n w ithi n 14 d ay s o f th e d a t e fi xe d f o r t h e
first m a tc h . M a t c h e s a b a n d o n e d t h r o u g h t h e fa u l t o f th e
C o u n t i e s shall b e d e a l t w ith by t h e C o un c il .
   (iii) If a m a t c h h as re s u lt e d in a d r a w it shall b e r e p l a y e d
w it h in 14 d ay s o f t h e d a t e fi xe d f o r t h e first m a t c h .
     (iv) If t h e s e c o n d m a t c h s h o u l d also r es u lt in a d r a w o r e x t r a
t i m e n o t b e i n g c o m p l e t e d a n d n e i t h e r C o u n t y b e i n g a t fa u l t, it
m u s t b e r e p l a y e d w ithi n 14 days. U n le s s m u t u a l l y a g r e e d
o t h e r w i s e , this will b e p la y e d o n t h e g r o u n d o f t h e C o u n t y
w in n in g th e toss o f a coin , w h ic h m u s t t a k e p la c e at t h e
c o n c l u sio n of t h e s e c o n d m a t c h . In this ca se, a f u r t h e r r e p l a y
w o u l d b e p l a y e d on t h e g r o u n d o f t h e C o u n t y los ing t h e toss.
T h is p r o c e d u r e will b e r e p e a t e d until a w i n n e r h a s b e e n
determ ined.


17. Results of M atches
    (i) T h e S e c r e t a r i e s o f e a c h c o m p e t i n g C o u n t y sh al l s e n d
n o ti c e o f t h e r e s u lt w it h th e n a m e s o f th e p la y e r s c o m p e t i n g ,
o n th e f o r m s u p p l i e d , to t h e S e c r e t a r y o f T h e A s s o c i a t i o n so
t h a t it is re c e i v e d w ithin tw o d ay s o f t h e d a t e o f t h e m a t c h
( S u n d a y s n o t in c lu d e d ) .
    (ii) C o u n t i e s failing to c o m p ly w it h this R u l e shall b e
s u b j e c t to a fine o f £10 a n d in d e f a u l t o f p a y m e n t shall b e
st ru c k o u t o f t h e C o m p e t i t i o n .

   (iii) Secretaries o f C o u n ties drawn at H o m e m ust te le ­
p h o n e the result to the F o o tb a ll A sso c ia tio n as so o n as
possible after ties.

18.   Provisions for Scratching
   (i) A n y C oun ty A sso cia tio n inten din g to scratch m ust give
inform ation o f its intention to d o so to the Secretary o f the
o p p o sin g C oun ty A sso cia tio n n o t less than eight days before
the date fixed for playing.
    (ii) A C ou n ty A sso c ia tio n failing to com p ly with this R u le
shall b e reported to the C o u n cil, w h o shall h a v e p o w e r to
co m p el such o ffen d in g C o un ty A sso c ia tio n to pay the
e x p en ses incurred and take such action as they m ay d e e m
ex p ed ient.
  (iii) If a C oun ty A sso c ia tio n d ecid e s to scratch after a
drawn g a m e , intim ation m ust b e given to its o p p o n e n ts within
24 hours (Sun days n ot inclu d ed ) o f the close o f the match.
   (iv) C o un ty A sso cia tio n s failing to give a satifactory reason
for scratching or w ithdraw ing w ith ou t first obtain ing the
co n sen t o f the C ouncil shall n ot b e allo w e d to en ter the
C om p etitio n the fo llow in g s eason .
   (v) In the S em i-F in al and F inal T ie s any C ou n ty A s s o c ia ­
tion failing to play, w ith o u t sh ow in g a g o o d and sufficient
cause for such failure to play, m ust b e a d ju d g ed by the C ouncil
to have b een guilty o f seriou s m iscon d u ct, and liable to be
d ealt w ith u nder R u le 35 o f T h e F o o tb a ll A sso cia tio n .

19. Provisions Concerning Referees and Linesmen
  (i) In all m atch es R e feress and L in esm en shall                  be
ap p ointed by the Y o u th C o m m ittee.
   (ii) R e fe r e e s and L in esm en shall b e entitled to 2nd Class
rail fares operating on the day o f the m atch.
  (iii) A n allow ance o f £0 .13 per mile will b e allo w e d to all
Officials officiating in the com p etitio n w h o travel by private
car.

in g fees:—

     a n d a S o u v e n i r in e a c h case;

A s s o c i a ti o n .

e x p e n s e s if i n c u r r e d a n d h alf o f t h e ir fe e if t h e m a t c h to w hich

     (vii) In t h e e v e n t o f a R e f e r e e o r a L i n e s m a n b e i n g u n a b l e
to r e a c h his d e s t i n a t i o n goin g to o r c o m i n g f r o m a m a t c h ,

j o u r n e y e x c e e d s six h o u r s , (i n clu din g tr a v e ll in g t i m e to a n d

S e c r e t a r y of t h e F o o t b a l l A s s o c i a ti o n . T h e ‘H o m e ’ C o u n t y

L i n e s m e n w h o shall a c k n o w l e d g e r e c e i p t.

d e f i n e d in L a w s 5 a n d 6 o f t h e L a w s o f t h e G a m e .

20. Provisions R elating to Protests
    (i) A ll q u e s t i o n s r e l a ti n g to m a t c h e s , t h e d is q u a li fic a ti o n of
p la y e rs, o r t h e i n t e r p r e t a t i o n o f t h e R u l e s , o r a n y d is p u te ,

C o u n c il , w h o s e de cisio n s shall b e final a n d b in d i n g o n b o th
C o u n t y A s s o c i a ti o n s .

m a d e in w ri tin g a n d m u s t c o n t a in t h e p a r t i c u l a r s o f th e
g r o u n d s u p o n w h ic h it is f o u n d e d . T w o c o p i e s o f t h e p r o t e s t o r
c o m p l a i n t m u s t b e lo d g e d w it h T h e F o o t b a l l A s s o c i a ti o n ,

which it relates (Su nd ays not in clu d ed ). T h e f e e shall be
forfeited to T h e F o o tb a ll A sso c ia tio n in the e v en t o f the
protest not b ein g sustained or th e co m p lain t co n sid ered to be
u n rea son ab le.
    (iii) A n y protest relating to th e gro u n d , g o a l-p osts or bars,
or o th er app u rten an ces o f the g a m e , shall n ot b e en tertain ed
by the C o u n c il, unless n otice w ith particulars h as b e e n g iven to
the H o m e C o u n ty A sso c ia tio n im m ed ia tely it c o m e s to the
k n o w led g e o f the O p p o s in g C ou n ty A sso c ia tio n , and an
ob jectio n has b een lo d g ed with th e R e fe r e e b efo re the
c o m m e n c e m e n t o f the m a tch , and not later than o n e hour
b efo re th e official tim e o f kick -off. T h e referee shall require
the resp on sib le C o u n ty A sso c ia tio n to correct th e cau se o f
o b je c tio n , if this is p o ssib le , w ith out unduly d elayin g th e
progress o f the m atch.

en g a g ed in a d isp u te, p rotest or c om p lain t, to pay such sum as
m ay b e co n sid ered necessary tow ard s defraying th e e x p e n se s
incurred.
    (v) W h en an o b jectio n has b e e n lo d g ed with th e R e fe r e e , a
protest m u st b e m a d e to T h e F o o tb a ll A sso c ia tio n and no
ob jectio n or protest shall b e w ithdraw n e x cep t by le a v e o f the
C ouncil.
    (vi) In d ealin g w ith any pro test th e C oun cil m a y ta k e in to
con sid era tion th e p o sse s sio n by th e protestin g C ou n ty
A sso c ia tio n o f any k n o w le d g e w hich , if prop erly u sed , m ight
have ob v ia ted th e protest.
    (vii) T h e S ecretary o f T h e F oo tb all A sso c ia tio n shall sen d a
c o p y o f th e pro test and particulars to th e C o u n ty A sso c ia tio n
p r o tested against.
    (viii) E a c h C o u n ty A sso c ia tio n m ay sup po rt its case by
w itn esses.
    (ix) If a m e m b e r o f th e C ouncil is c o n n e c te d w ith a C oun ty
A sso c ia tio n c o n c e r n e d in a disp ute or p ro test, h e shall not sit
on th e C ouncil w hile th e dispute or p rotest is b ein g c o n ­
sidered.
    (x) A C o u n ty su m m o n e d to a ttend a H ea rin g o f a dispu te or
protest m ay b e rep resen ted by o n e (1) or m o re o f its M em b ers.
A Barrister or S olicitor m a y rep resen t a C o u n ty o f w hich h e is
a M e m b e r at th e tim e o f th e alleged o ffe n c e but oth er w ise o n ly

w it h t h e p r i o r c o n s e n t o f t h e C o u n c il . A n y p e r s o n s u m m o n e d

p r i o r w r it te n c o n s e n t o f t h e C ou n cil .

21. Proceeds o f M atches*
     (i) T h e F o o t b a l l A s s o c i a ti o n shall t a k e t h e re c e i p t s f r o m all
m a t c h e s a n d shall p a y t h e e x p e n s e s .
     (ii) T h e fo llo w in g sh al l b e c h a r g e s o n t h e m a t c h : —
     (a) T r a v e l li n g e x p e n s e s o f t h e visit ing C o u n t y A s s o c i a ti o n
to b e a l lo w e d shall b e t h e lo w e st o r d i n a r y ra i lw a y fa res

quarters.

o f t h e g ro u n d .

c h a r g e d , if u se d.

p e r h e a d f o r 18 p e r s o n s , a n d f o r m e a ls a f t e r t h e m a t c h ea c h

which neither C ou n ty A sso cia tio n has co n tro l, th e e x p e n se s
shall b e paid o u t o f the receipts o f the se c o n d m atch.

a breach o f R u le , th e C o un ty A sso cia tio n in defau lt shall o n ly

                                  MEMORANDUM

   T h e fo llo w in g it e m s m u s t n o t b e c h a r g e d u n d e r R u l e 21 —
Proceeds of M atches:—
  (a) T e l e p h o n e calls.
  (£>) P r i n ti n g o f P r o g r a m m e s .
  (c) S te w a rd s .
  (d) G r o u n d s m e n .
  (<?) D r e s s i n g R o o m A t t e n d a n t s .                          v
  (f) L ig h t R e f r e s h m e n t s b e f o r e , d u r i n g a n d a f t e r a m a t c h .
  (g) G ra t u i t i e s .
  ( h ) F o o tb a l ls .
  ( i) C o s t of D r e s s i n g R o o m s .
  (j) E x p e n s e s o f a d v e r t is in g , p r i n t i n g a n d p o s t a g e .
  (k) P olic e a n d g a t e m e n .
    C o u n t y S e c r e t a r i e s a r e a s k e d t o n o t e t h a t tr av ell in g
e x p e n s e s a n d m e a l s m u s t n o t b e o v e r c h a r g e d a n d t h a t th e
tr a v e ll in g e x p e n s e s o f t h e i r p la y e r s s h o u l d b e ite m ise d .
                       RULES OF THE YOUTH
                CHALLENGE CUP COMPETITION

1.     Name of Cup
     A s C h allen ge Cup R u le s.

2.     Ownership of Trophy
     A s C h allen ge Cup R u les.

3.     Souvenirs
  In addition to the C u p , the A sso cia tio n shall presen t
Souvenirs to th e P layers and Substitutes in th e Final T ie.
W h en a Player taking part is ordered to leave the field o f play
for m isco n d u ct, the m ed al or souvenirs to w hich h e m ay b e
entitled m ay b e w ith held at th e d iscretion o f the C ouncil.

4.     C ontrol of C ompetition
     A s C hallen ge Cup R u les.

5.     Eligible Clubs
   T h e C om p etitio n shall b e o p e n to C lubs b ein g Full or
A sso cia te m em b ers o f T h e F ootb all A sso cia tio n an d to such
oth er C lubs as the C o un cil m ay ap prove. T h e C oun cil m ay
reject th e entry o f any C lub. Y o u th T ea m s m ust play in Y o u th
L ea gu es or an eq u ivalen t C o m p etition . Y o u t h T ea m s
applying to en ter m ust b e currently com p etin g in a L ea g u e.
Y o u th T ea m s must b e properly integrated w ithin the m ain
structure o f the Senior C lub.

6.     Date and Fee for Entry
   E a ch C lub w ishing to c o m p e t e shall com p lete an entry form
and return it to the S ecretary o f T h e A sso cia tio n to g eth er with
an entrance f e e o f £ 2 0 .0 0 to b e received on or b efo re th e 1st
day o f April previous to th e seaso n in w hich such Club
p rop oses to co m p ete.

7.     Organisation of the Competition
  T h ere shall b e a Q u alifying C om p etitio n and a C o m p etitio n
Proper. T h e C o m p etitio n P rop er shall consist o f 80 Clubs
selected by the C ouncil and ex e m p te d from playing in the
