C o -o p era tio n b etw een L in e sm e n and R eferee
W h e n pl ay h a s b e e n s t o p p e d t h e L i n e s m e n s h o u l d a s s i s t t h e
R e f e r e e by s i g n a l l i n g in t h e f o l l o w i n g m a n n e r f o r t h e f o l l o w ­
ing i n c i d e n t s :
1. O ff-sid e. T h e L i n e s m a n s h o u l d l o w e r h i s i l ag a t full
a r m ’s l e n g t h t o t h e p o s i t i o n s i l l u s t r a t e d , a n d p o i n t a c r o s s
t h e field o f p l a y to i n d i c a t e the s p o t f r o m w h i c h t h e k i c k
s h o u l d be t a k e n . T h e o n l y e x c e p t i o n w o u l d b e w h e r e t h e
R e f e r e e h a s d e c i d e d to p o s i t i o n h i m s e l f to j u d g e o f f - s i d e
w h e n pl ay d e v e l o p s f r o m a e o r n e r - k i e k , p e n a l t y - k i c k o r
f r e e - k i c k c l o s e t o g oal .
2. T h r o w - in . W h e n t h e bal l g o e s o u t o f p l a y o v e r t h e
t o u c h - l i n e o n h is s i de o f t h e field, the L i n e s m a n s h o u l d
i n d i c a t e t h e d i r e c t i o n o f t h e t h r o w . H e s h o u l d a l so s i g n a l if
t h e t h r o w e r ’s feet, at t h e m o m e n t o f r e l ea se o f t h e bal l, a r e
incorrectly placed.
3. C o rn er an d g o a l-k ick s. W h e n t h e w h o l e o f t h e bal l g o e s
o u t o f play o v e r t h e g o a l - l i n e t h e L i n e s m a n s h o u l d i n d i c a t e
w h e t h e r a c o r n e r - k i c k o r g o a l - k i c k s h o u l d be g i v e n.
4. G oal. W h e n t h e R e f e r e e i n d i c a t e s t h a t a g o a l is s c o r e d
the L i n e s m a n s h o u l d r e t u r n q u i c k l y t o h is p o s i t i o n t o w a r d s
t h e h a l f - w a y line.
L aw 12. If t h e L i n e s m a n s e n s e s t h a t t h e R e f e r e e h a s n o t
se en a n i n f r i n g e m e n t h e s h o u l d r a i se his flag h i g h . I f t h e
R e f e r e e s t o p s p l a y t h e L i n e s m a n s ha l l i n d i c a t e t h e d i r e c t i o n
o f t h e fr ee- ki ck ( d i r e c t o r i n d i r e c t ) , o t h e r w ise he s h al l l o w e r
h i s flag.
5. S u b stitu tio n . W h e n a s u b s t i t u t i o n is t o be m a d e th e
L i n e s m a n n e a r e s t t o t h e p o i n t o f s u b s t i t u t i o n shal l a t t r a c t
t h e a t t e n t i o n o f t h e R e f e r e e by r a i s i n g h is flag as s h o w n in
t h e i l l u s t r a t i o n i n c l u d e d in “ S i g n a l s by L i n e s m e n ” .


 L aw 14.          P en a lty -k ick
     A p e n a l t y - k i c k s ha l l be t a k e n f r o m t h e p e n a l t y - m a r k a n d
w h e n it is b e i n g t a k e n , all p l a y e r s w i t h t h e e x c e p t i o n o f the
p l a y e r t a k i n g t h e k i c k, p r o p e r l y i d e n t i f i e d , a n d t h e o p p o s i n g
g o a l k e e p e r , shal l b e w i t h i n t h e fi eld o f p l a y , b u t o u t s i d e the
penalty-area, a n d at least ten y a rd s fr om th e penalty-m ark.

T h e o p p o s i n g g o a lk e e p e r m u st sta n d (w it h o u t m o v in g h is
feet) o n h is o w n g o a l- lin e , b e tw e e n th e g o a l- p o s t s , un til the
ball is k ick ed . T h e p la y er ta k in g the k ick m u st k ic k th e ball
forw ard; he shall n o t p la y th e b all a s e c o n d tim e until it h a s
been to u c h e d o r p la y e d by a n o th e r player. T h e b a ll sh a ll be
d e e m e d in play d irectly it is k ic k e d , i.e., tra v elled th e d i s ­
ta n ce o f its c ir cu m feren c e. A g o a l m a y be sc o r e d d irectly
from a p e n a lty -k ic k . W h e n a p e n a lty -k ic k is b e in g ta k en
d u rin g the n o r m a l c o u r s e o f p la y , o r w h e n tim e h a s b een
ex te n d e d at h a lf-tim e o r fu ll-tim e to a llo w a p e n a lt y -k ic k to
b e ta k e n o r reta k en , a g o a l sh all n o t b e n u llifie d if, b e fo r e
p a s s in g b e tw een th e p o s t s an d u n d er th e c r o ss -b a r , th e ball
to u c h e s eith er o r b o t h o f th e g o a l- p o s t s , o r the c r o ss -b a r , or
the g o a lk ee p e r, o r any c o m b i n a t io n o f th ese a g e n c ie s , p r o ­
v id in g th at n o o th e r in fr in g e m e n t h a s o c cu r r ed .
   Punishment — F o r an y in fr in g e m e n t o f th is L aw:
         (a ) by th e d e fe n d in g te a m , th e k ic k sh all b e retak en , if
    a g o a l h a s n o t resulted .
         (b ) by the a tt a c k in g tea m , o th e r th a n by th e p layer
    ta k in g th e k ick , if a g o a l is sc o r e d , it sh all be d is a llo w e d
    and th e k ick reta k en.
        ( c ) by th e p la y er ta k in g th e p e n a lty -k ic k , c o m m itt e d
   after th e ball is in p lay, a player o f th e o p p o s i n g te a m shall
   tak e an in direct free-k ic k fro m th e sp o t w h e r e the
   in frin g em en t o c c u r r e d , su b je c t to th e o v e r -r id in g c o n d i ­
   ti o n s im p o s e d in L a w X III.
  If, in the c a s e o f p a ra g ra p h (c ) th e o ffe n c e is c o m m itt e d
by the player in h is o p p o n e n t s ’ g o a l area, th e free-k ick shall
be tak en from a p o in t a n y w h e r e w ith in that h a lf o f th e g o a l
area in w h ic h th e o f f e n c e occu rred .
International Board Decisions on Law 14
    1. W h en th e referee h a s a w a rd e d a p e n a lty -k ic k , h e shall
not signal fo r it to b e ta k e n , u n til th e p la y er s h a v e ta k e n up
p o s it io n in a c c o r d a n c e w it h the L aw.
    2. (a) If, after th e k ic k h a s b een ta k en , th e ball is s t o p ­
    ped in its c o u r s e t o w a r d s g o a l, b y an o u t s i d e a g en t, the
    kick shall be retaken.
        (b )     If, after th e k ick h a s b een ta k en , th e b all r e b o u n d s
    in to play, from th e g o a lk e e p e r , th e c r o ss -b a r o r g o a l- p o s t,
    and is th en s to p p e d in its c o u r s e by an o u t s i d e a g en t, the

n e a r e s t to w h e r e t h e b al l w a s w h e n pl ay w a s s t o p p e d .

 ", ( a ) If a f t e r h a v i n a siiven t h e s i g n al f o r a p e n a l t y - k i c k
 to be t a k e n , t h e r e f er ee sees t h a t t h e g o a l k e e p e r is n o t in

     ( b ) If. a f t e r t h e r ef e r e e h a s give n t h e s i g n a l f o r a

 k i c k e d , t h e g o a l k e e p e r m o v e s h i s feet, t h e r c t e r ^                g

 r e t a k e n , if a g o al is n o t s c o r e d .
      ( c ) If, a f t e r t h e r e f e r e e h a s g i ve n t h e s i g n al foi a
  p e n a l t v - k i c k t o b e t a k e n , a n d b e f o r e t h e b a l l is in P l a >-, ^
  plaver' of the d efen d in g te a m en c ro a c h e s into                                   he
  p e n a l t v - a r e a . o r w i t h i n t e n y a r d s of t h e p e n a l t y - m a r k t h e
  re feree s hal l, n e v e r t h e l e s s , a l l o w t h e ki ck to p r o c e e d ,
  s hal l b e r e t a k e n , if a g o a l is n o t s c o r e d .
   T h e p la y e r c o n c e r n e d shal l be c a u t i o n e d .

   4 ( a ) If, w h e n a p e n a l t y - k i c k is b e i n g t a k e n , t h e p l a y e r
   t a k i n g t h e k i c k is g u il t y o f u n g e n t l e m a n l y c o n d u c t , t h e
   k i c k , if a l r e a d y t a k e n , s ha l l b e r e t a k e n , if a g o a l is s c o r e d .
    T h e p l a y e r c o n c e r n e d s ha l l be c a u t i o n e d .
        ( b ) If a f t e r t h e r e f er ee h a s g ive n t h e s i g n al f o r a
    p e n a l t v - k i c k t o b e t a k e n , a n d b e f o r e th e b a l l is m p ay. a
    c o l l e a g u e o f t h e p l a v e r t a k i n g t h e k ic k e n c r o a c h e s i n t o t h e
    penaltv-area o r w ithin ten y a r d s of the pe n a ltv -m a rk . the
    ref er ee s ha l l, n e v e r t h e l e s s , a l l o w t h e k i c k to p r o c e e d . If a
    go al is s c o r e d , it s h al l be d i s a l l o w e d , a n d t h e k i c k r e t a k e n .
        T h e p l a y e r c o n c e r n e d s ha l l be c a u t i o n e d .
           '(c ) If in t h e c i r c u m s t a n c e s d e s c r i b e d in t h e f o r e - g o i n g
        p a r a g r a p h , th e -b all r e b o u n d s into play fro m the g o a l­

L a w 15. T h r o w - i n
    W h e n the w h o l e o f t h e bal l p a s s e s o v e r a t o u c h - l i n e e i t h e r
o n t h e g r o u n d o r in t h e air, it shall be t h r o w n in f r o m the
p o i n t wLiere it c r o s s e d t h e line, in a n y d i r e c t i o n , by a p l a y e r
o f t h e t e a m o p p o s i t e to t h a t o f th e p l a y e r w h o l a s t t o u c h e d
it.

f ac e t h e field o f p l a y a n d p a r t o f e a c h f o o t sh al l be e i t h e r o n
the touchline or on the g r o u n d o u ts id e th e touch-line.
   T h e t h r o w e r s hal l u se b o t h h a n d s a n d shal l d e l i v e r t h e
ba l l f r o m b e h i n d a n d o v e r h i s h e a d . 1 he ba ll sha ll b e in play
i m m e d i a t e l y it e n t e r s t h e field o f p l a y, b u t t h e t h r o w e r shal l
n o t a g a i n p l a y t h e bal l u n t i l it h a s b e e n t o u c h e d o r p l a y e d by
a n o t h e r p la yer .
    A g o a l s ha l l n o t be s c o r e d d i r e c t f r o m a t h r o w - i n .
      P u n ish m e n t
         ( a ) If t h e ba l l is i m p r o p e r l y t h r o w n - i n t h e t h r o w in
      s ha l l b e t a k e n by a p l a y e r o f t h e o p p o s i n g t e a m .

Law 16.        Goal-kick
    W h e n the w h o l e o f th e b all p a s s e s o v e r th e g o a l-lin e ,
e x c lu d in g th at p o r t i o n b e tw e e n the g o a l- p o s t s , eith er in the
air o r o n the g r o u n d , h a v in g la s t b e e n p la y e d by o n e o f the
a tta ck in g tea m , it sh all b e k ic k e d dire ct in to p la y b e y o n d the
p enalty-a rea , fro m a p o i n t w ith in th a t h a lf o f the g o a l-a r e a
n ea rest to w h e r e it c r o s s e d th e lin e, by a p la y er o f the
d efe n d in g tea m . A g o a lk e e p e r sh all n o t r e c eiv e th e b all in to
his h a n d s fr o m a g o a l- k ic k in o r d er th at h e m a y th ereafter
kick it into p la y . I f th e b all is n o t k ic k e d b e y o n d the
penalty-a rea , i.e., d ire ct in t o p la y , t h e k ic k sh all b e retak en .
T h e kicker sh all n o t p la y th e b a ll a s e c o n d tim e u n til it h as
b een to u c h e d o r b een p la y e d by a n o th e r p layer . A g o a l shall
n o t b e sco red direct fr o m s u c h a k ick . P la y e rs o f th e team
o p p o s i n g th a t o f th e p la y er ta k in g th e g o a l- k ic k shall
rem ain o u t s i d e the p e n a lt y -a r e a u n til the b all h a s b een
k ick ed o u t o f the p en a lty -a r e a .
  Punishment .— If a p la y e r ta k in g a g o a l- k ic k p la y s th e ball
a s e c o n d tim e after it h a s p a s s e d b e y o n d the p en a lty -a rea ,
but b efo re it h a s t o u c h e d o r b een p la y e d b y a n o th e r p layer
an in d irect free-k ick sh a ll be a w a r d e d t o th e o p p o s i n g team ,
to be tak en fro m th e p la c e w h e r e th e in fr in g e m e n t o c c u rred ,
subject to the o v e r -r id in g c o n d it io n s im p o s e d in L a w X III.


International Board Decision on Law 16
  1.    W h en a g o a l- k ic k h a s b e e n ta k e n an d th e p la y er w h o
has kicked the ball, t o u c h e s it a g a in b efo r e it h a s left the
penalty-area, th e k ick h a s n o t b e e n ta k en in a c c o r d a n c e w ith
the L aw a n d m u s t be reta k e n .

                   KNOCK-OUT COMPETITIONS—
                          OBTAINING A RESULT

     TAKING OF KICKS FROM THE PENALTY MARK

   T h e In ternatio nal B oard at its M eeting on the 27th J u n e , 1970
a cc e p te d a p roposal by th e F e d e ra t io n Internatio nale d e Foo tb all
A ssociati on that th e pra ctic e o f dra w in g lots to d eterm in e which
of tw o te a m s in a dra w n m a tch should p ro c e e d to a later stage o f a
k n o ck -o u t com p etitio n o r receive th e t r o p h y (if any ) be
dis c o n ti n ued and re placed by the taking o f kicks fr o m the
pe nalty m a rk which shall not be co n sid ered p art of th e m atc h ,
su b j e c t to th e follow ing conditions:
  1. T h e re feree shall ch o o se the goal at w hic h all o f the kicks
shall be taken.
  2. H e shall to s s a coin, and the t e a m w h o se captain wins the
toss shall ta ke th e first kick.
   3. (a) S u b je c t to the te rm s o f the following p a ra g r a p h s (c) and
   (d) b o th team s shall ta ke five kicks.
       (b) T h e kicks shall be ta k e n alternately.
       (c) If, b efo re b o th te am s hav e taken five kicks, one has
   sco red m ore goals th a n the oth er could, even if it w ere to
   c o m p le te its five kic ks, th e takin g of kicks shall cease.
       ( d ) If, a ft e r b o th te a m s have ta k en five kic ks, b o th hav e
   sc ored the sam e n u m b e r of goals, or have not sco red any
   goals, the taking of kicks shall contin ue, in th e sam e o rd e r ,
   until su c h times as b o th have ta ken an equal n u m b e r o f k ic ks
   (not necessarily five more kicks) and one has scored a goal
   more than the other.
   4. T h e te a m whic h sc ores th e greater n u m b e r of goals,
w h eth e r the n u m b e r of kicks ta k en is in a c c o r d a n c e with the
te rm s of the for egoing p arag r ap h (3a), (3c) or (3d) shall qualify
for the n ext ro u n d of the C o m petit io n, or shall be declared
winner of th e com petition , as th e case may be.
   5 («) With th e exception re ferred to in the following p a ra g r a p h
   (b) only the pla yers w h o are on the field of play at the en d of
   the m a tch , which shall m e a n at th e end of e x t ra time in so far
   as a ma tc h in w hic h e x t r a time is a u t h o r is e d , is c o n c e r n e d , an d
246       K N < x 'K -o rrco M P in n io v s   o b t a i n i n g a r i -.s u i   i




  any who , ha vi ng left the field t e m p o r a r i l y , with or w it hou t the
  r e f e r e e ’s p er mi s si on , are not on the field of play at that time,
  shall take part in the taking of the kicks.
       (b)        P rov ide d that his te am has not al ready made use of the
  m a x i mu m n u m b e r of subst it utes p ermit ted by the rules of the
  co mp et i ti on u n de r which the ma tch was pla ye d, a goa lk ee per
  wh o sust ains an injury during the taking of the kicks, and who,
   b eca us e o f the injury, is unable to con ti nu e as goal -keeper,
   may be rep lace d by a substitute.
   6. E a ch kick shall be t aken by a different player, and not until
all eligible players of any t e a m, including the go al k ee p er or the
na med sub st it ute by w h o m he w-as re pl ac ed in t e r ms of
pa ra gr a ph (5) as the case may be, h ave e ac h t ak en a kick, may a
player of the s am e te am ta ke a s e c on d kick.
   7. Su bj ec t to the terms of parag raph (5) any player w h o is
eligible ma y cha n ge places with his g oal keep er at any time during
the taking of the kicks.
      8. (a) O t h e r than the player taking the kick f r om the penal ty
      ma rk, an d the t wo g oal k ee pe rs , all players shall remain within
      the c e n t re circle whilst the taking of kicks is in progr ess.
         (b)       T h e go al k ee pe r wh o is a colleague of the kicker, shall
      take up position within the field of play, ou ts ide the penalty
      area at whi ch the kicks are being t aken, behi nd the line which
      runs parallel with the goal line, and at least 10 yards f r om the
      penal ty mark.
   9. U n l e ss st ated t o t h e c ont r ar y in the for egoing p a r ag r ap h s 1
 to 8, the L a w s of the G a m e , a nd the Int ernat ional Board
 Decisi ons relating the re to , shall, in so far as they c a n, appl y at
 the taking of the kicks.
   N .B. In the e ven t of the light failing be fo re the end of the
 taking of kicks f rom the penalty mark, the result shall be dec ided
 by a drawi ng of lots.

              LAWS FOR SMALL SIDE MATCHES OR
                                COMPETITIONS
                            SIX-A-SIDE FOOTBALL
Rules
    E x c e p t w h e r e o t h e r p r o v i s i o n s in t h e s e R u l e s a r e m a d e ,
th e r u l e s o f A s s o c i a t i o n F o o t b a l l a p p l y . T h e f o l l o w i n g
R u les are fo r g u id a n c e only a n d a re n o t m a n d a to r y .
    1. The L a w s of the G am e of A ssociati on Football shall app ly
with the ex cep tio n s of L a w s 3, 7 and 11.
   2. Eight pla yers may be nom inate d fr om w h o m six pla yers
shall be ch o s e n to form a team . T he gam e shall be pla yed by tw o
team s ea c h consisti ng of not m ore than six pla yers, o n e of w hom
shall be the goalkeeper. O ne of the o th e r pla yers may change
places with the g o alk eep er during the m a tch pro vided that notice
is given to th e R efe re e b efore such change is ma de.
    3. D u r i n g a g a m e o n ly o n e su b s t it u ti o n m a y be m a d e.
   4. T h e re will be no offside.
   5. In the event of a m a tc h being a draw at full time, it will be
de cided on the basis of the n u m b e r of co rn e r s gained by each
side. If the m a tc h is still u n d e c id e d , play will contin ue fo r a
fu rth er period of six m in u tes , three m inute s ea c h way.
    6 . T h e duratio n of a 6 -a-side ga m e shall not ex ceed two equal
peri ods of ten minute s, e x c e p t in c irc u m s ta n c e s co v ered by 5
ab o v e. Allow ance may be made in either period fo r time lost
throug h accident or o th e r c a u s e , the a m o u n t of w hic h shall be a
m a tte r fo r the dis cretio n of the R e feree. T he interval shall not
ex ceed five minutes .
   7. T h e R eferee shall be the sole arb iter on points of dispute
and he shall be e m p o w e re d to interpret the rules governing
6 -a-side football, bearing in mind the best intere st of all parties
c o n c ern ed.

                         FIV E A S ID E F O O T B A L L
Rules
    E x c e p t w h ere o th e r p ro v i s io n s in these rules are m a d e , the
rules o f A s s o c i a ti o n F o o tb a l l a pply. ( E a c h rule is n u m b e r e d
to c o r r e s p o n d with the a p p r o p r i a t e L a w o f the G am e). T h e se
rules are for g u id a n c e o n ly a n d n o t m a n d a t o r y . Five-a-Side
F o o tb a ll m a y be p la yed o r refereed by eith er m e n or women.
M ix e d m a t c h e s are not p e rm itte d .
248      law s     tor    s m a l l   sidi   ;   matc h l s   or   c o m p f h iio n s




1.     P lay in g A re a
     f i v e a Si de     F o o t b a l l m a y be p l a y e d in a n e n c l o s e d a r e a
i n d o o r s o r o u t o f d o o r s . T h e f o l l o w i n g d i m e n s i o n s are
r e c o m m e n d e d , m a x i m u m length 1 2 0 ’ ( 36 metr es) m i n i m u m
 100' ( 3 0 metr es) m a x i m u m wi dth 9 0 ' ( 28 metr es ) m i n i m u m
6 0 ' ( 1 8 . 5 me t r e s ) .

     (a) Centre M a r k
     A s u i t a b l e m a r k s h o u l d be m a d e in t he e x a c t c e n t r e o f t he
p l a y i n g a r e a o n w h i c h t h e ball is d r o p p e d t o c o m m e n c e a
g a m e . T h e c e n t r e s p o t s h o u l d be s u r r o u n d e d b y a c i r c l e 3' ( 1
m e t r e ) in r a d i u s .

     (b) G oal A rea
     A s e m i c i r c l e o f 2 5 ' ( 7 . 5 m e t r e s ) r a d i u s shal l be d r a w n
f r o m t he c e n t r e o f e a c h g o a l line. T h e e x t r e m i t i e s o f t h e s e
s e m i c i r c l e s . shoul d r e a c h t he wal l o r b a r r i c a d e r e g a r d l e s s o f
w h e t h e r o r n o t t he g o a l p o s t s e n c r o a c h o n t o t he field o f pl ay .

     (c) P en a lty M a r k
     A p e n a l t y m a r k s h o u l d be p l a c e d at a p o i n t 2 0 ' ( 6 m e t r e s )
f r o m t he c e n t r e o f e a c h g o a l .

     (d) Goal
    The a o a l s shal l be 16' (5 m e t r e s ) I o n s b v 4' ( 1 . 2 m e t r e s )
hi gh.

2.     T h e Ball
     T h e ball u s e d shal l be a F i \ e - a - S i d e ball s i / e f our.

3.       N u m b e r o f P la yers
     (a) T h e m a t c h shall be p la y ed by t w o t e a m s e a c h
c on si s ti n g o f no t m o r e t h a n five p la ye rs, o n e o f w h o m shall be
the g oa l ke ep er .
     (b ) O n e su bs t it u te per t e am shall be p e r m i t t e d at a n y time
d ur i n g a g a m e . ( S ub j ec t to c o nd i t i on s set o u t in the L a w s o f
the G a m e )
     (c) A n y o f t h e o th e r p l a y er s m a y c h a n g e pla ces with the
g o a l k e ep er , p r o v i d e d t h a t th e referee is i n f o r m e d b efo re the
c h a n g e is m a d e a n d p r o v i d e d also t h a t th e c h a n g e is m a d e
d u r i n g a s t o p p a g e in the game.
    (d) A m a t c h s h o u l d n o t be c o ns i d e r e d valid if t here are
fewer t h a n three p l a y er s in either o f the t eams.
         LAWS FOR SMALL SIDE MATCHES OR COMPETITIONS                                     249


4.     Players’ E quipm ent
     (a) F o u r pla y e rs o f th e t e a m shall be d r e s s e d in u n if o rm
s h o r t s a n d shirts, g o a l k e e p e r s m a y w e a r t r a c k suits b u t the
c o l o u r o f th e g o a l k e e p e r s ’ d r e s s m u s t be dis tin g u ish ed f r o m
t h a t o f o th e r pla yers, a n d th e Refe re e.
     ( b) F o o t w e a r
    Light f o o t w e a r shall be w o r n w it h o u t rigid o r h a r d soles,
b a r s or studs.

5.     Referees
    A referee shall be a p p o i n t e d to officiate in e a c h g a m e . Fie
shall h av e the s a m e p o w e r s a n d duti es as laid d o w n in the
L a w s o f the G a m e .

6.     Tim ekeeper/Scorer
     A n i n d e p e n d e n t t i m e k e e p e r / s c o r e r be a p p o i n t e d to assist
the referee. T h i s official shal l—
     (a) r e c o r d g o a ls s c o r e d
     (b) a c t a s ti m e k e e p e r a n d signify half-tim e a n d full-time b y
an a g r e e d signal
     (c) su s p e n d time o n th e re feree’s in s tru c tio n s for all
s t o p p a g e s a n d a d d t h a t ti m e to th e e n d o f e a c h half.

7.     D u ra tio n o f the G a m e
     T h e d u r a t i o n o f the g a m e shall be t w o e qu al p er i od s o f six
mi nu tes , s ub ject to th e f ol l ow in g: —
     (a) A llo w a n c e shall b e m a d e in eith er peri od for ti m e lost
t h r o u g h s t o p p a g e s as d e c i d e d b y th e referee a n d r e c o r d e d by
th e ti m e k e e p e r
     ( b ) T i m e shall be e x t e n d e d to p e r m it a p e n a l ty kick bei ng
ta k e n at o r after th e e x p i r a ti o n o f th e n o r m a l p eriod in either
half. A t half-tim e th e in terv al shall n o t exceed tw o m i n u te s
ex c ep t b y c o n s e n t o f t h e referee
     D ra w n G ames
    In the e ven t o f s c or e s being level at the e nd o f 12 mi nu tes
play, e xt r a ti me o f t w o p e r i od s o f t w o m i n ut es m a y be pla yed.
If th e s c or e s are still level after e xt r a t i me if pla yed , the rules
o f the c o m p e t i t i o n shall st at e the m e t h o d o f a s c er t a in i ng the
winners.
2M)     LAWS    H ) K S M A L L SIDI      M A H H I S OK ( O M I ' I I I I I O N S



8.     Start o f Play
     (a) A t th e begi nn in g o f a g a m e the cho ice o f e nds shall be
d e ci d e d by the tos s o f a coin.
    ( b ) Play shall be st a rt e d by the referee d r o p p i n g the ball on
the c en tr e spo t b e twe en o n e p l a y er f r o m e a c h side, e a c h o f
w h o m shall s t a n d not less t h a n 3' (1 me tr e) f r om the c e n t re
mark.
     (c) T h e g a m e shall be re - st ar t ed in like m a n n e r after a goal
h a s be en scor ed.
     (d) Af te r an y o th e r s t o p p a g e the g a m e shall be r e- st ar t ed
by the referee d r o p p i n g the ball at a poi nt n e a re s t to w h e r e it
w a s w he n play w a s s u s p e n d e d , unless it w a s in the
g o a l k e e p e r ' s po ss e ss io n , w h e n the p l a y er shall, at the r e f er ee ’s
signal, roll the ball o u t to re- star t the ga me .
    T h e referee shall not d r o p the ball within 6' (2 me t re s ) of
the lines m a r k i n g the goal a r e a s o r within 6' o f s u r r o u n d i n g
w alls or bar r ic ade s.

9.     Bal l In a n d O u t o f P l a y
    T h e ball shall be in play at all ti mes from the start o f the
g a m e unless: —
     (a) the ball rises a b o v e h e a d height
     (b ) th e ball h a s c r o s s e d the goal-line or the b a r r i c a d e s
s u r r o u n d i n g the p la y in g a r e a
     (c) the t i me k e e p e r h a s given th e signal for hal f or full ti me
     (d) the g a m e h a s been s t o p p e d by th e referee
     B a ll above H e a d H eight
    T h e ball m u s t be kept below h e a d height. (The referee shall
ha v e dis cret i on as to w h a t c on st i t u t e s ' h e a d height' ) The
h e a d i n g o f the ball is al lowed pr ov i de d the a f o r e m e n t i o n e d
c o n d i t i o n is ob ser ve d.
     P enalty f o r infringement.
     Indirect free-kick at the pl ace w h e r e the ball w a s last
p l a y e d (unless the ball w a s last p l a y e d by the ’d ef end ing
g o a l k e e p e r in th e goal a rea , in wh ich c a s e t h e indi rect free-
ki ek shall be t a k e n f r o m a p oi nt n o t less t h a n 6' (2 me tres )
o u t s i d e the goal a r e a n e a r e s t to w h e r e t h e off ence o c c u r r e d .
     If the ball r e b o u n d s to ab o ve h ea d hei ght fr om a ny o f the
fol lowing si tuat ions.
     (i) F r o m a pla ye r w h o has m a d e n o a t t e m p t to play the ball
         LAWS FOR SMALL SIDE MATCHES OR COMPETITIONS                                   25 1



    (ii) F r o m a wall, b a r r i c a d e , g o a lp o st, c r o s s b a r or o th e r
o b s t r u c t io n
th e n the referee will re - sta r t th e pla y by d ro p p i n g th e ball at
th e p o in t w h e re th e r e b o u n d o c c u r r e d . (If this p o in t is within
th e go al a r e a th e ball shall be d ro p p e d at a poin t not less th a n
6 ' (2 m e tres ) o u ts id e th e goal a r e a ne a re s t to w h e re the
rebound occurred)
   Ball out o f Play
    W h e n th e ball goes o u t o f play b u t below h e a d heigh t, a
m e m b e r o f th e o p p o s i n g t e a m shall roll th e ball in to play.
W h e n m e m b e r o f th e d efen d in g t e a m p u ts th e ball o u t o f play
ov e r the b a r r i c a d e on th a t pla y e r's ow n goal-line b u t be low
hea d height, th e o p p o s i n g t e a m shall be a w a r d e d a roll-in
c o rn er. W h e n a m e m b e r o f th e a t ta c k i n g t e a m p u ts the ball
o u t o f p la y o v e r th e b a r r i c a d e on th e o p p o n e n t s ’ goal-line, b u t
below h e a d height, th e g o a l k e e p e r shall roll th e ball out. (If
the ball d r o p s on th e b a c k o f th e net b e h in d th e goal, it shall
be r e g a r d e d as o u t o f pla y a n d th e g a m e shall be re s ta rt e d
with a roll-out b y th e goa lk e e p e r)


10.      Scoring
    A goal is sc o r e d w h e n th e whole o f th e ball cro s s e s the
goal-line b etw een th e g o a l posts a n d u n d e r th e c r o s s b a r
p ro v id e d it h a s not been t h r o w n , c a rr ie d o r propelled b y h a n d
o r a r m by a p la y e r o f th e a t t a c k i n g side, e x c e p t in th e ca se o f
a g o a lk e e p e r, w h o is within his o w n goal area.
    A g o al is n o t allo w ed if th e ball w a s last p la y e d by a p la yer
o f th e a t t a c k i n g side whilst within eith er goal area. (If th e ball
is la st p la y e d by a d efen d in g p la yer whilst within either goal
a re a, a goal shall be allow ed, un le ss th a t p la y e r e n t e re d the
goal a r e a accidenta lly .)


11.      Offside
    T h e r e is no offside. P la y e r s m a y place th e m selv es in an y
p a r t o f th e playin g a r e a o u ts id e the goal areas.


12.      Fouls and Misconduct
   (a)   Charging is forbidden and shall be penalised by the
awarding o f a direct free-kick.

i ndi rect free-kick.

 13.         F ree-K ick
      W h e n a p l a y e r is t a k i n g a d i r e c t o r i n d i r e c t f r e e - k i c k , a l l o f

16.     Play Within the Goal Area
   (a) O nly the defending goalkeeper is allow ed within the
goal area, excep t w hen a penalty kick h a s b een aw arded and
then only the player taking th e kick ca n enter the goal area.
  I f a goalkeeper leaves the goal area he is then treated as
any other player.
Penalty f o r Infringement
    (i) By th e a t t a c k — a direct free-kick a t th e p o in t o f entry
into th e goal a r e a
    (ii) By th e de fe n c e — a p e n a l ty kick
    N o t e : R eferees s h o u ld d is ti nguis h b etw een ac c id e n ta l an d
in ten tional e ntry into o r exit f r o m th e g o a l area. O nly
delib erate a c tio n s w h e re th e p la y e r eith er p la y s th e ball o r
tries to p la y th e ball s h o u l d be pen alised . A c c id e n t a l en t ry o r
exit w h ich has n o effect on th e p la y s h o u l d be ignored.

17.    Throw-Ins, Goal Kicks, Corner Kicks
   T h e r e a re no goal kic ks, c o r n e r s o r th ro w -in s.

*This Voting Paper, in the case of an Ordinary Club, must be
 signed by the Representative of the Club who is the Shareholder
 in the Association; or in the case of a Limited Company, by the
 Chairman or Secretary of the Company.



To the General Secretary,

 1 7.   S u s p e n s io n o f G a m e a n d E x t e n s i o n o f S ea so n
         T h e C o u n c il shall have p o w e r t o su spe nd t h e gam e e it h e r s e c t i o n a l ly o r e n t ir e ly .
         T h e y m a y also e x t e n d t h e p e r io d s f o r p la y i n g , as f r o m t i m e t o t im e , in the ir
 d is c re tio n , shall be d e e m e d necessary, o r d es ir ab le , a nd a gree m e nts b e t w e e n Club s,
 Players, a n d O f f i c ia l s shall be su b je c t t o su ch d ec isio ns.
 18.     Pl ay ers w it h W ri t te n C o n t r a c t s
 ( a)    M i n i m u m Age
        N o P la yer w h o is u n d e r t h e age o f e ig h te e n (1 8 ) years a n d w h o is re ce iv in g f u l l - t i m e
e d u c a t io n     in a c c o r d a n c e w i t h t h e E d u c a t i o n A c t s shall e n t e r in t o a c o n t r a c t o f e m p l o y
men.t w i t h a C l u b ;n m e m b e r s h i p w i t h T h e A s s o c i a t io n o r an a f f r lia t e d A s s o c i a t io n , b u t
he m a y be re g is tere d as an A s s o c ia t e d S c h o o lb o y .
        N o P la yer w h o is u n d e r th e age o r seven teen (1 7 ) ye ar s shall e n t e r rn t o a c o n t r a c t
o f e m p l o y m e n t w i t h a C lu b in M e m b e r s h i p w i t h T h e A s s o c i a t io n o r an a f f i l i a t e d
A s s o c ia t io n , e x c e p t as a T r a in e e as p r o v i d e d b y R u le 20.

(bj      Fi na n ci a l A r r a n g e m e n t s — R e g i s tr a ti o n
        S u b je c t t o p a r ag ra ph (a) o f t h is R u le , and t o the Ru le s a n d R e g u la t io n s o f the
League o f w h ic h the C l u b is a M e m b e r , a n y C lu b in M e m b e r s h i p w i t h T h e A s s o c i a t io n o r
an a f f i l i a t e d A s s o c i a t io n m a y n e g o t ia t e w h a t e v e r f in a n c ia l a rr a n g e m e n t s w i t h its Players
as m a y be m u t u a l l y a cc ep ta b le .            A l l Pla yers u n d e r w r i t t e n c o n t r a c t m u s t be re gistere d
w i t h T h e A s s o c ia t io n .

(c) . C o n t r a c t o f E m p l o y m e n t
         A l l c o n t r a c t s o f e m p l o y m e n t o r le t te rs o f e m p l o y m e n t e xc h a n g e d b e t w e e n a C lu b
and a ny O f f i c ia l , P la ye r, Manag er, C o ach , T r a i n e r o r a ny o t h e r e m p lo y e e o f t h e C lu b,
shall s p e c if y t h a t all e m o l u m e n t s due t o t h e in d i v id u a l sh all be p a id t o t h e in d i v id u a l
c o n c e rn e d a nd n o t t o a ny c o m p a n y o r age ncy a c ti n g o n b e h a lf o f t h e e m p lo y e e , a nd all
such c o n t r a c t s shall s p e c if y t h a t t h e in d i v i d u a l is d i r e c t l y u n d e r t h e d i s c i p l i n a r y c o n t r o l
o f the C lu b a nd o f T h e A s s o c ia t io n . N o p a y m e n t in respect o f t h e re g is t r a t io n o r t r a n s f e r
o f r e g is tra tio n shall be m a d e t o an agent.

(d)     F o r m " G ( 1 ) " —R e g i s tr a ti o n f o r O n e (1) C a l e n d a r M o n t h
         A P la yer w h o desir es t o be re g is tere d w i t h T h e A s s o c i a t io n f o r a p e r i o d o f o n e (1)
c a le n d ar m o n t h m u s t sign t h e f o r m m a r k e d " G ( 1 ) " in t h e S c h e d u le a n n e x e d t o these
Rules.

 (f)     Fo rm s t o b e r e t u r n e d to T h e A s s o c ia t io n
         T h e F o rm s m e n t i o n e d in p a ra g ra p h s (d) a nd (e) abo ve m u s t be re t u r n e d t o the
S e creta ry o f T h e A s s o c i a t io n w i t h i n f iv e (5 ) days o f b ein g signed b y t h e P la ye r, and
a c c o m p a n ie d b y a c o p y o f t h e c o n t r a c t .
         A P la y e r seekin g r e g is t ra t io n u n d e r w r i t t e n c o n t r a c t shall n o t be a llo w e d t o p la y
u n d e r t h e t e r m s o f t h e c o n t r a c t u n t i l t h e C lu b re g is teri ng h im shall have rec eived his
r e g is tra tio n c e r t i f i c a t e f r o m T h e A s s o c i a t io n .

(j)     A g r e e m e n t s b e t w e e n Club s a n d Pl ay ers
          C lu b s m u s t e n t e r i n t o a w r i t t e n c o n t r a c t w i t h t h e i r Pla ye rs in th e f o r m , o r su b ­
s t a n t ia ll y th e f o r m , a p p r o v e d b y T h e A s s o c i a t io n and k n o w n as ' F o r m o f A g r e e m e n t '
w i t h o r w i t h o u t in c l u d i n g t h e o p t i o n h e r e in a ft e r m e n t i o n e d . S uch c o n t r a c t s o f e m p l o y ­
m e n t w h i c h m u s t be signed at t h e same t i m e as t h e r e g is t ra t io n f o r m m a y be f o r any
p erio d o f t im e w h i c h shall be c le a r ly s ta te d in t h e c o n t r a c t o f e m p l o y m e n t b u t shall
co ve r t h e same p e r io d as t h e re g is t r a t io n a nd c o n t a i n all t h e t e r m s a nd c o n d i t i o n s o f
e m p l o y m e n t b e f o r e b ein g signed. A c o p y o f t h e c o n t r a c t o f e m p l o y m e n t m u s t be han de d
t o the Prayer at t h e t i m e o f signing.

17.      S usp e nsio n o f G a m e a nd E x t e n s io n o f Season
        T h e C o u n c il shalf have p o w e r t o suspe nd t h e gam e e it h e r s e c t i o n a l ly o r e n t ir e ly .
         T h e y m a y also e x t e n d t h e p e r io d s f o r p la y i n g , as f r o m t i m e t o t i m e , in th e ir
d is c re t io n , shall be d ee m e d necessary, o r' d esir ab le , a nd a g re e m e n ts b e t w e e n Club s,
Players, a nd O f f i c i a l s sh all be s u b je c t t o such d ec isio ns.

  18.     Players w ith W r itt e n C ontracts
  (a)     M in im u m Age
           N o p la y e r w h o is u n d e r th e a g e o f e ig h t e e n (18) y e a r s a nd w h o is r e c e iv in g f u l l t im e
  e d u c a t io n in a c c o r d a n c e w i t h t h e E d u c a ti o n A c t s sh a ll e n t e r in t o a c o n t r a c t o f e m p l o y m e n t
  w i t h a C lu b in M e m b e r s h i p w i t h t h e A s s o c i a t io n o r an a ff il ia t e d A s s o c i a t io n , b u t h e m a y be
  re g is t e re d as an A s s o c i a t e d S c h o o lb o y .
           No p la y e r w h o is u n d e r t h e a ge of s e v e n te e n (17} y e a r s sh a ll e n t e r in to a c o n t ra c t
  o f e m p l o y m e n t w i t h a C lu b in M e m b e r s h i p w i t h T h e A s s o c i a t io n o r an a ff il ia te d
  A s s o c i a t io n , e x c e p t as a T r a in e e as p r o v id e d b y Ru le 20.
  (b)     Financial A r r a n g e m e n ts — Registration
             S u b je c t t o p a r a g r a p h (a) o f t h i s Rule, a n d t o t h e R u le s a n d R e g u la t io n s o f the
  Lea gu e o f w h ic h t h e C lu b is a M e m b e r , a n y C lu b in M e m b e r s h i p w it h T h e A s s o c i a t io n o r an
  a ff il ia t e d A s s o c i a t io n m a y n e g o t ia t e w h a t e v e r f in a n c ia l a r r a n g e m e n t s w i t h its Pla ye rs as
  m a y be m u t u a l l y a c c e p ta b le . A ll P la yers u n d e r w r i t t e n c o n t r a c t m u s t be r e g is t e re d w i t h T h e
  A s s o c ia t io n .
(c)     C ontract o f E m p lo y m e n t
         A l l c o n t r a c t s o f e m p l o y m e n t o r le tte rs o f e m p l o y m e n t e xch a n g e d b e t w e e n a C lu b
and a ny O f f i c ia l , Player, Manag er , Co ach , T r a in e r o r a n y o t h e r e m p lo y e e o f t h e Clu b,
shall s p e c if y t h a t all e m o lu m e n t s d u e t o t h e i n d i v id u a l shall be p a id t o t h e in d i v id u a l
c o n c e rn e d a nd n o t to a n y c o m p a n y o r age nc y a c ti n g o n b e h a l f o f t h e e m p lo y e e , and all
such c o n t r a c t s shall s p e c if y t h a t t h e in d i v id u a l is d i r e c t l y u n d e r t h e d is c ip lin a r y c o n t r o l
o f t h e C lu b a n d o f T h e A s s o c ia t io n . N o p a y m e n t in re sp ec t o f t h e re g is t r a t io n o r tra n s fe r
o f r e g is tra tio n shall be m a d e t o an age nt.

(e)     F o r m ' G ( 2 K — R e g i s tr a t io n E x c e e d in g O n e (1 ) C a le n d a r M o n t h
            A P la yer w h o desires t o be re gistere d w i t h T h e A s s o c i a t io n f o r a p e r io d in excess o f
one (1) m o n t h m u s t sig n t h e f o r m m a r k e d 'G (2 J ' in t h e S c h e d u le a n n e x e d t o th e se Rules)
such r e g is t ra t io n t o t e r m i n a t e o n t h e f i r s t (1 st) S a t u r d a y in M a y , o r t h e d a t e o f t h e last
League o r C u p m a t c h o f t h e C lu b 's f i r s t (1 st ! tea m w h ic h e v e r is t h e la te r o r on t h e
t h i r t i e t h ( 3 0 t h ) d a y o f J u n e in a n y year.

(f)     F o r m to be R e t u r n e d t o T h e A s s o c i a t io n
         T h e f o r m s m e n t i o n e d in p ara gra ph s (d) a nd (e) a b o v e m u s t b e ' r e t u r n e d t o t h e
S e c r e ta ry o f T h e A s s o c i a t io n w i t h i n fiv e (5) days o f b ein g signed b y t h e P la ye r, and
a c c o m p a n ie d b y a c o p y o f t h e c o n t r a c t .
         A P la y e r seeking re g is t r a t io n u n d e r w r i t t e n c o n t r a c t shall n o t be a llo w e d t o p la y
u n d e r t h e t e r m s o f t h e c o n t r a c t u n t i l t h e C lu b re g is teri ng h im shall have re ce ived his
re g is t ra t io n c e r t i f i c a t e f r o m T h e A s s o c ia t io n .

(j)     A g r e e m e n t s b e t w e e n C lu b s a n d Players
          Clu bs m u s t e n t e r in t o a w r i t t e n c o n t r a c t w i t h t h e i r Players in t h e f o r m , o r su b­
s t a n t ia ll y t h e f o r m , a p p ro v e d b y T h e A s s o c i a t io n a nd k n o w n as ' F o r m o f A g r e e m e n t '
w i t h o r w i t h o u t i n c lu d in g t h e o p t i o n h e r e in a ft e r m e n t i o n e d . S u c h c o n t r a c t s o f e m p l o y ­
m e n t w h i c h m u s t be signed at t h e same t i m e as t h e r e g is t r a t io n f o r m m a y be f o r a n y
p e r io d o f t im e w h i c h shall be c le a r ly state d in t h e c o n t r a c t o f e m p l o y m e n t b u t shall
co ver t h e same p e r io d as t h e r e g is t r a t io n and c o n t a i n ail t h e te r m s a n d c o n d i t i o n s o f
e m p l o y m e n t b e f o r e b ein g signed. A c o p y o f t h e c o n t r a c t o f e m p l o y m e n t m u s t be h an de d
t o t h e P la yer a t t h e t i m e o f signing.

A u t h o r i t y f or a n d on b e h a l f o f .......................................................................................... ............................
F o o t b a l l C l u b L i mi t e d ( h e r e i n a f t e r r e f e r r e d to a s " t h e C l u b " ) o f t he o n e p a r t a n d
( n a m e ) .........................................................................................................................................................................
o f ( a d d r e s s ) ...............................................................................................................................................................

a R e g i s t e r e d A s s o c i a t i o n F o o t b a l l P l a y e r ( h e r e i n a f t e r r e fe r r e d lo as "t h e P l a y e r ”)


 W H E R E B Y it is a g r e e d as f oll ows : —
       !.      T h i s A g r e e m e n t shall r e m a i n in f o r c e unt il t h e .'Oth d a y o f J u n e 1 9 ..........................
 u n l e s s it shall h a v e p r e v i o u s l y b e e n t e r m i n a t e d b y s u b s t i t u t i o n o f a rev i se d a g r e e m e n t
 o r a s h e r e i n a f t e r p r ov i d e d .
       2.      T h e P l a y e r a g r e e s to p l ay t o t he b e s t o f his abil ity in all f o ot b al l m a t c h e s in
 w h i c h he is s e le ct ed t o p l a y for t he C l u b a n d t o a t t e n d a t a n y r e a s o n a b l e p l a c e f o r the
 p u r p o s e o f t r a i n i n g in a c c o r d a n c e wi t h i n s t r u c t i o n s gi ven b y a n y d u l y a u t h o r i s e d
 offi cial o f t he C l u b.
       3.      T h e P l a y e r a g r e e s to a t t e n d all m a t c h e s in w h i c h t he C l u b is e n g a g e d w h e n
 d i r e c t e d by a n y dul y a u t h o r i s e d official o f t he C l u b .

F oo tb al l P la y er (hereinafter referred to as ‘the Player*) o f the o th e r par t

W H E R E B Y IT IS A G R E E D A S F O L L O W S : —
    1. Thi s A g r eem en t shall r em ain in fo rce fr o m th e da t e her e o f until the first
S a tu r d a y in M a y 1 9          o r the d ate o f the la st L e ague o r C u p m a tc h o f th e C l u b 's
first te am , w hich eve r is the later, ( he rei na fte r called 't h e initial period o f
e m p lo y m e n t’) unless the initial period o f em p lo y m e n t shall be te rm in a te d by
substitution o f a revised a g re em en t or as hereinaf te r provide d.
    2. T h e Play ers ag rees to p la y to t h e best o f his ability in all football m a tc h e s in
which he is selected to pla y for the C lu b an d to at te nd a t any r e a sonable place an d
time for the p u rp o s e o f o r in c o n ne cti on with training as a football pla yer in
ac c o r d a n c e with ins tru ctio ns given by a n y duly au thoris ed official o f the Club. A ny
special ar r an g e m en ts bet ween the C lu b an d the P la ye r shall be agre ed in writing
between the part ies hereto.
    3. T h e P la y e r ag rees to a tte n d all m a tc he s in w hich the C lu b is en gaged w hen
directed by an y du ly auth orised official o f the C lub.
    4. Th e P la y e r shall play A ss ociati on F o o tb a l l solely for the C l u b o r as
aut hor ised by a n y du ly au th o ris ed official o f the C l u b o r as required un d e r the Rules
and R eg ul atio ns o f T h e Fo otbal l A ss o ciati o n (herei na fte r called ‘T h e A ss ociati on')
and the L eag ue( s) o f which the C l u b is a m e m ber. T h e P la yer u n d er tak es to obs er ve
and be subject to the L a w s o f the G a m e o f A ss ociati on F ootb all in all m a tc h e s in
which he participate s.
    5. T h e P la y e r ag rees a t all ti m es to obser ve a n d be subject to the Rule s o f the
Club (if a n y ) (h erei na fte r called ‘C l u b R u le s ’) a co p y o f which is atta c h e d here to. T h e
 Club an d the P la y e r shall obs erv e an d be s ubje c t to the Rules o f T h e A ss ociati on an d
 the Le ague(s) of which the C lub is a m e m b e r . In the ca se o f conflict bet we en Rule s,
 then the Ru les o f T h e A ss o ciati o n shall ta k e p rec ed en ce o v e r this A g r eem en t an d
over the Ru le s o f the C lu b .
    6. T h e C lu b shall m a k e ava ila ble for reference to the P la ye r copies o f all relevant
 Rules o f Th e A ss o ciati o n , and o f the L e ague(s) o f w hich th e C lu b is a m e m b e r an d
 the requirement s o f any I n s u r a n c e Policy ap plica ble to the P la yer as well as any
 subsequent am en d m e n ts .t o g eth er with an y a m e n d m e n t to this A gree m en t.
     7. T h e P la y e r shall no t w ith o u t the written co n s en t o f the C lu b par tic ipat e
 professionally in an y o th e r sp o rti ng o r athletic activity. The P la y e r shall do
 everything n ec essa ry to get and ke e p him self in the best possible condition so as to
 render the m o s t efficient service to the Clu b. T h e P la y e r agrees not to in dul ge in a n y
 sport, activity o r pr ac ti c e th a t m ight en d a n g er his fitness. The P la ye r shall not

                                                                                  TRAINEE CONTRACT

          A N A G R E E M E N T ma de t h e ............................................... day o f ................................................ 19


betw een ( n a m e ) .......................................................................................................................................................


of ( ad d re s s) ................................................................................................................................................................




the Se cre tar y /M an ag e r/ C hai rm an of and acting pursuant to Resolution and Auth orit y for and on hehulf of




Football C lu b Lim ite d ( h ere in afte r referred to as " the C lu b ” ) o f th e one part and


( n a m e ) ...............................................................................................................................................


o f (a d d re s s ) .........................................................................................................................................




A Registered Ass ociation F ootball Player (h ere in afte r re ferred to as " the P la yer ").



W H E R E B Y it is agreed as follows:—


   1.                 T his A g re e m e n t shall rem ain in f orce u n t i l ........................................... o r such dace as deter m in ed by extension
           provi ded for by the Y o u t h T ra in in g Scheme rules in the event o f sickness or injury.
           ( N O T E . Fo r 16 ye ar old school leavers, the period shall be two calendar years; for 17 year old school leavers it
           shall be one ca lendar ye ar and for non-school leavers the period shall represent the balance o f tw o years for 1ft
           year olds and the balance of one ye ar for 17 ye ar olds.)


   2.            T h e Player wil l participate in the Y o u t h T ra in in g Scheme programme irrespective of whe th e r the Club's
           qualification is a pp ro ved h y the M a n p o w e r Services Commission.


   3.                 T h e Player agrees to play to the best o f his ability in aii footbal l matches in which he is selected to play fo r the
           Clu b and to attend at any reasonable place for the purpose of training in accordance with instructions given by any
           duly authorised official o f the Club.


   4.                 T h e Player agrees to attend all matches in which the C lu b is engaged when directed by any duly authorised
           official o f t h e Club.


   5.            T h e Player shall play football solely for the C lub o r as authorised by the Club or as required under the Rules
            and Regulations of T h e Foo t bail Association and the Clu b's League. Th e Player und ertakes to adhere to the Laws
            of the G a m e o f Association Football in all matches in whtch he participates.


   ft.           T h e P layer agrees to observe the Rules o f the C lu b at all times. T h e Clu b and the Player shall observe and be
            subject to the Rules and Regulations o f T h e Football Association and the Club's League. In the case o f conflict
            such Rules and Regulations shall take precedence over this A g re e m en t and over the Rules o f the Club.


    7.                 T b e Clu b undertakes to provide the Player at the earliest opportun ity with copies of all relevant Football
            Association Rules. League Regulations, the C lu b Rules for players and any relevant insurance policy applicahle
            to the Player and to provide him with any subsequent amendments to all o f the above.


    8.                 T h e Player shall not without the w ri tt en consent o f the C lub participate professionally in any other sporting
            or athletic activity. T h e Player shall at all times have due regard for the necessity nf his maintain inii a high
            standard of physical fitness and agrees not to indulge in any sport, activity o r practice that might endanger such
            fitness. T h e Player shall not infringe any provision in this regard in any policy of insurance taken nut for his benefit
            or for the benefit o f the Club.

        davs. T h e C lu b shall inform the Plaver in writing of the action tuWev' with a ci>p\ being sent to T h e 1 ontbalf
        Association and the Club 's League and the full reasons for it anil this information shaft he recorded in a register
        held at the C lu b . Th e Player shall have a right of appeal asset ou t in Clause I ' l a ) {exercisable wit h in seven davsnt
        the receipt by the Player o f such w ritte n notification from the C lub) and the Cluh or the Plaver as the case mas be
        shall have a furth er right o f appeal asset out in Clause !7 < b l o f this A greemen t. Anv penalty imposed bs the Clu b
        upon the Play er shall not become operati ve itntif the appeals procedures have bee a exhausted.


2 (1.        in the event of anv grievance in connection with his emplovm ent under this A g re e m en t the folluwine
        procedures shall be available to flie Player in the order set out: —

        la )   the grievance shall be brought inf ormal ly to the notice oi the M an ag er of the C hib m die first instance.
        (b )   fo rmal notice of the grievance may be given in writing to the M an ag e r of the C lub.
        (c)     if the grievance is not settled to the Player's satisfaction within fo urteen days there after fornv.il notice uf the
                grievance may be given in w ritin g to the Secretary of the C lub so that it may be considered by the Board ol
               D ire ctors or C o m m it te e of the C lu b or bv any duly authorised co m m iflee or sub-committee thereof. The
               ma tt er shall thereupon be deal! w ith bv the Board or C o m m it te e at its next convenient me eting and in any
               event within four weeks o f receipt of the notice.
        (d)    if the grievance is not settled by the Cluh to the Player’s satisfaction the Player shall have a right o f appeal as
               set out in C lause 1 7 ( a ) (exercisable within seven days o f t h e Club notifying the Player of the decision ol the
               B o ard or C o m m it te e ) and the ('lu b or the Player as the case may be shall hav e a furth er right of appeal asset
               ou t in Clause 17 ( b ! of this Ag re em en t


2 \ T h e Plaver may i f he so desires be represented iit any persona) hearing                of an appeal under this Ag re em en t by
        an official or m e m b er o f the Professional Footballers' Association.


22.         U p o n the execution o f this A g re e m en t the C fuhshaH eff ect the registration o f the Player w ith T h e Football
        Association and the Club 's League in accordance with their Rules and Regulations.


23.            T h e r emune ra tio n of the Player shall be not less than the m inim um provided by the Yo u th T ra in in g Scheme
        and shall be set out in a schedule attached to this A g re e m en t and signed by the parties. T h e Schedule shall include
        all re mune ra tio n to which the Plaver is or may be entitled. In the event o f any dispute the re mune ra tio n set out in
        the Schedule shall be conclusively d ee med to be the full entitlemen t to the Player.


 24.         The Player shall be entitled to a m inim um o f lour weeks' paid holiday per year , such holiday to be t aken at a
        time which the C lu b shall determ ine. T h e Player shall not participate in professional football du rin g his holiday.


 25.            R eference herein to Rules or Regulations o f the C lub s League. Th e f o o t b a ll Association, the C luh or ,iny
        other bodv shall be treated as a reference to those Rules or Regulations as from time to t ime am ended.

        hes itan t, mo d est , sh o w y , etc.)




R E F E R E E IN G ABILITY:
  4. I mpa rtia lity ( C r o w d influence, facing up to difficulties, s w a y ed by result, etc.)

        clearness o f decisions , whistle an d signals, etc.)




   6,     C o r re c tn e s s in decision ( T ech nical points a n d fact of Law w here referee wrong)

                                                  II.   D efinition o f M a tc h e s

    Article 3
    IN T U R N A T ION A L M A T C H                          A
    I       A n I n t e r n a t i o n a l F o o t b a l l M a t c h A o l t i c i a l l y r e c o g n i z e d b \ t h e F e d e i a-

FO R B ID D E N RELATIO NSH IP
1. A ffiliated A s s o c ia t io n s a n d thei r c l u b s shall not be pe rmi tt ed to play
    m at che s a ga ins t o r have s p o r t i n g r el a t i o n s h i p wi th A s s o c i a t i o n s, or
    their c lubs , not in m e m b er s h i p wi t h F . I . F . A . w i t h o u t the c o n s en t o f the
    Execu tive C o m m it te e o f the Fe de r at io n.

    m atche s ag ains t te a ms co n s i s t i n g o f p lay er s w ho d o n ot b e l o ng e xcl u ­
    sively to a club o r L e a g u e aff il ia te d to a Na t i o n a l A s s o c i a t i o n .

   the spe cial c o ns e n t o f the Fe de r at io n.

   another N a ti o n a l A s s o c ia t i o n wi t h o u t the c o n s e n t o f s u c h A s s o c ia t io n .

                      T R A N S F E R O F PLAYERS OVERSEAS
   The Footba ll A s s o c ia t io n , ov e r the pa st y ea rs , has be e n c o ns u lt ed by
many players, w ho having emi gr at ed to o v er se a s c ount ri es , primarily to
play football, ha v e returned to this c ount ry and ha ve wi s he d t o resume
playing here. T h e y ha v e be e n unable to d o s o b e c a u s e the Cl u b for which
they have        been     play ing    o v er s e a s   has   ref used t o    r el eas e t h em     and
consequently they hav e been unable to receive an International Cl earance
Certificate fr om the N a tio na l As s o c i a t i o n c o n c er n ed , wh i ch Certificate is
essential before T he Fo otball As s o c i a t i o n m a y give the playe r permission
to resume playing in E ngland.
   The     International        C le ar an ce     Certificate     is   a    F.I.F.A.     r ecognised
document w hic h g o v e rns the transfer o f players fr om on e c o un t ry to
another. W itho ut such a Certificate no English player m a y p l a y overseas
and no foreign playe r m a y play in E ngland.
  Players are frequently un a wa r e o f thes e Reg u l a t i o ns and s ometimes
enter into ag re eme nts or ma k e a r ran gemen ts for l eav ing o ne c o u nt ry to
 play football in anothe r w hic h s ubs eq ue nt ly c a nn o t be c onf ir me d, thereby
 causing distress a nd inc o nv e ni e nc e. It is essential, therefore, that the widest
 publicity be given to this M e m o r a n d u m . T h e pr oble m is diverse as
 difficulties c a n arise w hic h v ar y c on s id er ab l y but wh at ev e r t h e playing
 status o f the individual, an International Cl e ar an ce Certificate is required.
       A player ma y g o o ve r s e a s o n p a y m e n t o f a transfer fee, or on a free
 transfer. O n arrival o v er s e a s as a playe r n ot under written c o n t r a c t he m a y
 become a player unde r written co nt ra ct . B e c a u s e va lue s are different
 overseas from w ha t the y are in this c ou nt ry , he m a y ha ve a transfer fee
  placed on his head by his o v e rs e as Club; indeed he m a y be transferred for
  comparatively large s ums o f m o n e y within the o v e rs e as territory. Wh en he
  returns to this c ountr y it is not usual for a n y Cl ub to b e prepared to p ay the
 transfer fee w hic h the o v e rs ea s Clu b has put o n him as a c o nd i t i o n o f his
  transfer. The expe rience o f T h e Fo ot ba ll As s o c i a t i o n is th at the player can
  be literally out o f w o r k as a footballer for a long period o f t im e a nd m ayb e
  the player left this c o untry wi th out a n y b o d y pa yi ng a p en n y for his
  services.

P L A Y E R S J O I N I N G C L U B S IN A U S T R A L I A
   Over the past ye a rs both T he Foo tba ll A s s o c i a t i o n a nd the Australian
So ccer Federa tion hav e e xpe ri en ce d p ro bl e ms in respect o f players joining
C lubs in Aus tralia when a r ran gemen ts m a d e between the Cl ub and the
piayer have not been honoured.
     I n o r d e r t o p r e v e n t thi s s i t u a t i o n a r i s i n g , it is s t r o n g l y s u g g e s t e d t h a t th e
f o l l o w i n g p r o c e d u r e s h o u l d b e o b s e r v e d b y a n y p l a y e r w i s h i n g t o p la y in
A u s t r a l i a b e f o r e h is d e p a r t u r e : —
       (a) that c o pie s o f any c o r r e s p o n d e n c e be twe en the Aus tralian Club
    and the player be sent for inf orma ti on to the Secretary o f the Australian
    S occer Fe deration at the fo ll owi ng a d d r e s s : - 3 6 - 3 8 Cl ar en ce Street.
    S yd n ey. N . S . W . 2 0 0 0 . Australia
       (b) that the player is in po s s e s s i o n o f a c o p y o f his c ont ra ct setting out
    the terms and c onditio ns in respect o f p a ym e nt . Careful attention should
    be paid to the fact that in th e event o f a player m o v i n g from his first
    Club in Australia to another Club, that a transfer fee m a y be paid for his
    services
       (c) that the player is in po s se s si on o f th e correct wo r k i n g visa
        (d) that :iiu c ontra ct has a c l a us e included to the'           that nt the
     lerminaiion o f the co nirac t the player will be free lo return to this
     count ry without the paymen t o f a transfer lee
        (e) that any current registration o f the player under written contract
     with this A s s o c ia tio n lias either terminated or been c anc el led by mutual
     consent
         (I") that an official application is ma d e lo The Fo ot ball As s ociat ion
     requesting an International Cl ea r a n c e Certificate to be issued to the
      Australian So c c e r Federation.



       P R O C E D U R E T O BE A D O P T E D W H E N T R A N S F E R R I N G A
   PLAYER U N D E R W R IT T E N C O N T R A C T TO A F O R E IG N CL UB

    1. The Club and player must c ompl e te a c ancel led by mutual consent
 form in order to c anc el the player's Registration with The Football
 Association.
    2. Th e player must c o mplete a ques ti on nai re s upplied by The Foot ball
 Association requesting an International Cl e ar an ce Certificate lo be issued
 oil his behalf to the foreign Na ti on al As s o c ia ti on .
    3. A copy o f the transfer ag ree me nt between the t wo Clubs must be
 submitted to The Fo otball A s s oc i a t i on together with the a bo v e ment ioned
 forms.
    4. It is r e c o mm e nd e d that the transfer agreement cont ai ns clauses
 making it subject to the player's registration being a cc ept c d by the foreign
 National As s oc ia tion together with detail's o f the p ay me nt o f the transfer
 fee and any other c o nditio ns required by either party.

kick-off. In the event o f a breach o f this Ar ticle, the Associa tion o f origin shall r e po r t
the m a t te r to E U F A . and nec essar y penalties shall be impose d by the Disciplinary
Bo dy a p p o i nted by the P resident o f U E F A a nd consisting of thr ee me m b e r s o f the
List o f Expe rts. Its authority shall be limited to the imposition o f fines. Sh o uld a
player be unfit, his C lub shall be obliged to sub mit evidence.

Article 3
After his c o n t ra ct has expired, the pla ye r shall be free to c hoo se the club with w hich
he wishes t o conc lude a new con trac t.

Article 4
T he new cl ub m u st immediately inf or m the f or me r club a bo ut the c onc lusion o f the
cont r ac t . T h e latter in its turn, in c onj unc tion with its Na tional Associa tio n, shall
aut hor ise F I F A , w ithout any delay, to issue the inte r na tional cer tificate of tra nsf er.

Article 5
If a player, after having served up to the e xpir ation o f his c ont r a c t, c onc lud e s a new
co n t r a c t with ano th er club, the f or me r club shall ha ve the right to de m a n d an
indemnit y o f formation or promo ti on . In c a se o f disa gr e e me nt betwe en the parties,
the Boa rd o f E xperts of U E F A (see Ar t. 9) decide.

 Article 6
The a m o u n t o f the said indemnity shall be agre e d upon by the two clubs c o n c e r n e d
and shall be paid in the curr enc y o f the f or me r club, within 30 da y s f r o m the
aut hor isat i on given by the N ationa l Assoc ia tion c onc e r ne d to F I F A for the issuing
of the i n t er national certificate o f tr a nsfe r (see Art. 4).

 Article 7
Ec o no mi c r elations between two clubs, as f a r as the inde mnity of f or ma tio n a n d
pr omo ti on is concerned, shall no t be allowed to interfere in a ny way with the s p or ting
an d / o r pro fessional activities o f the f ootba lle r c onc e r ne d , who shall be f ree to play
for the cl ub with which he has conc lude d the ne w c ontr ac t.

 Article 8
 The a g r e em ent concluded by the two clubs m u st be br ought to the a tte ntion o f their
 respective N ational Associations.

 Article 9
 If, after the 30 d ays from the a uthor isa ti on f or the issuing of the inter national
 certificate o f transfer, the two clubs c onc e r n e d ha ve not r ea c he d a n a gr e e me n t, either
 of t h e m m a y request tha t the m a tte r be settled by the Boar d o f Expe rts o f U E F A ,
 which c om prises three persons. T h e c h a ir m a n the r eof, shall be nom in a te d by the
 Executive C om m itt ee of U E F A ; while the oth e r two me mbe r s shall be c hose n by the
 two clubs conce rned , from a list o f e xpe r ts compile d by U E F A . The se me m b e r s ,
 however, m a y not originate from the Na tio na l Associa tions o f the c lubs c oncer ne d.


 Article 10
 In c a se o f conflicts of an ec on om ic na tu r e , the clubs c onc e r ne d ma y not be b r o u g h t
 before a ny authority other tha n the Boa r d o f Expe r ts me ntione d in the prec eding
 Article.

Article 2
2 . 1 In c a se o f a conflict, the B oa r d o f Expe rts shall me et within eight d a ys o f receipt
      o f the appeal o f the club(s) c onc e r ne d, in c onf or mity with Ar ticle 9 o f these
      Re gul ations.

2.2 T h e parties concerned have the r ight to opp os e the pr esence o f a c h o o s e n
    Ex pe rt, should the said Exper t ha ve a ny pe r s ona l interest in the d is p ute o r
    conflict.

2.3 I f o n e o f the parties rejects a n Exper t, in w hich c a se the r e a son for such a refusal
    m ust be clearly outlined, and if the said Exper t doe s not a c c e pt the rejection, the
    C h a i r m a n o f the B oard will ju d ge whe the r the r ejection is justified or not, a n d his
    decision shall be o f a binding na t ur e for the two par ties c onc e rned.


Article 3
In o r d e r to establish the a m ou n t o f the inde mnity o f f or ma tion o r pr om o ti o n , the
Board o f Experts shall apply as a r ule, the f ollowing principles:
- the a m o u n t o f the indemnity shall c or r e s po n d to the gross inc ome o f the p la y er
  ( i nc ome earned throug h his activity as a f ootba ller dur ing the pr ec e ding s ea s on ),
  multiplied by a coefficient fac tor whic h varies a c c or ding to his age.
The gr oss in come shall be c o m p o s e d as follows:
- the p la yer' s fixed wages
- the b o nus es paid by the club
- the b o nuses paid by the N ationa l Associa tion
- the r oy alties o f the club for publicity m a d e by the pla ye r alone, with the outfit o r
  the j e r sey o f his club or o f his Na tiona l Repr e se nta tive Te a m

conditions the indemnity may in no eve nt exc eed the a m o u n t o f 2 million Swiss
francs.


 Article 4

 formation may, in no case, exc ee d the figure d e m a n d e d by the f or me r clu b o r the

c a u s e d by r i o t e r s a n d r i o t s a t a f o o t b a l l g r o u n d a r e p o s s i b l e . I n t h i s
c o n n e c t i o n it s h o u l d b e r e m e m b e r e d t h a t t o c o n s t i t u t e a " r i o t y o u n e e d
h a v e o n l y t h r e e p e o p l e a c t i n g t o g e t h e r t o c a u s e a t u m u l t o r t o s e t li r e t o a
b u i l d i n g , i n t h i s e v e n t , u n l e s s a f ir e i n s u r a n c e p o l i c y i n c l u d e s a " r i o t s
e x te n s io n " the C lu b w o u ld not be co v e red .
    (iv ) O th e r risks w h ic h sh o u ld u su ally be in c lu d ed are a irc ra ft,
explosion, ma lic io us da ma g e , (n ormal ly o nl y i nc lude d whe n policy
covers “ riots e xtens ion” ), s tor m, t e mp e st , fl oo d a nd burs ting and
overflow ing of w ate r pipes an d ta n k s, im pact a n d ea rth q u a k e .
    ( v ) It s h o u l d a l s o b e r e m e m b e r e d t h a t in o r d e r to r e - b u i l d a s t a n d o r a
b u i l d i n g , it is a l m o s t i n e v i t a b l e t h a t f e e s f o r a r c h i t e c t s , s u r v e y o r s a n d
s i m i l a r c o n s u l t a n t s a n d o t h e r l e ga l f e e s w ill b e i n c u r r e d . A s u i t a b l e c l a u s e
to c o v e r th e s e e x p e n s e s c a n be a d d e d , b u t th e s u m in s u re d to be
i n c r e a s e d t o a l lo w f o r f e e s .
     F r o m t h e p h y s i c a l d a m a g e w h i e h f o l l o w s f ir e a n d t h e l i k e t h e r e c a n b e
c o n s i d e r a b l e d i s r u p t i o n in t h e a c t i v i t i e s o f t h e C l u b . I f a s t a n d is b u r n e d .

a c c ru e fro m th e sale o f p r o g r a m m e s a n d r e f r e s h m e n t s m ight be re d u c e d .

( h)    Theft
   (i) In a dditio n to fire and the v a r i o u s perils m e n t i o n e d a b o v e ,

                        M A TC H E S AGAINST FOREIGN CLUBS

      1. T i c k e t s s h o u l d b e a v a i l a b l e t o h o m e - b a s e d s u p p o r t e r s o f t h e B r i t i s h

realistic n u m b e r of tickets.

a n d m a t c h tic k e ts w h ic h m ig h t to be sold to g e th e r w h e r e v e r possible.

o r i c p u t a b l e t r a v e l a g e n t s . T h e v s h o u l d b e init ial ly m a d e a v a i l a b l e to

       v C l u b s m i g h t a l s o c o n s i d e r t h e p o s s i b i l i t y o f b a n n i n g t h e s a l e of
 tic k e ts to u n a c c o m p a n i e d m in o r s , e x c e p t s e a s o n ticket h o l d e r s a nd those

 p u rch a s e rs of tickets should be kept by the club.
      4. T r a v e l a g e n t s , a n d o t h e r o r g a n i s a t i o n s c h a r t e r i n g a i r c r a f t . c o a c h e s

      5. T r a v e l o r g a n i s e r s m u s t s e r i o u s l y c o n s i d e r w h e t h e r t o b a n t h e sale
 a n d c o n s u m p t i o n o f a l c o h o l d u r i n g j o u r n e y s. s o m e o f w h i c h , by s u r f a c e

Licences
   Under the te rms o f s ecti on 25 o f the Children and Yo un g Persons Act.
1933 a y o un g person under 18 ye a rs o f age needs a licence if he or she is to
play or perform abr oad for profit. T h us it is an of fen ce for a footballer o f
less than 18 years o f age to be sent abroad to play for his te am or country
unless he has been granted a licence.
   The o nus for applying for the licence rests with the Cl ub M anager or in
cases o f an International mat c h with The Foot ball Ass oc iat ion .
   To obtain a licence the Clu b M a n a g e r or The Fo ot bal l Association
should send to the B o w Street Ma gi st ra tes Court. L o nd on . W C 2 : —
    I (a) a c o mple ted ’Appl i ca ti on for Licence' (form Q1 obt ainable from
the Bow Street Magistrates Court)
        (b) a c omple ted :No ti c e to Police' (form Q 1 0 obt ainable from the
Bow Street Magistrates Court)
        (c) a c o py o f the S c he du l e (obtainable from the Bov. Street
Magistrates Court)
        (d) a letter stating that:—
        (i) the player is phy si ca ll y fit to go abroad for the purpose of
              playing football.
        (ii) the date o f birth o f the playe r is as s h o wn on the ' Application for
              Licence'
        (iii)the ’Application for Licence' is ma de with the c ons en t o f the
              parent or guardian o f the player.
        (e) details o f the Club's visit abr oad, i.e. dat es o f the tour and
matches, also the financial a r ra ng emen ts in so far as the players are
concerned.
    2.      The Club s hould also send the foll owi ng to the Police in w hose area
 the player resides:—
    (a) a c o py o f the c o mple t ed ’Appl i ca t io n for Licence' (f orm Q I).
    (b) a co mplete d ’N o tic e to Police' (form Q 1 0 Supplied with form Q l ).

                                    LEGAL PROCEEDINGS

    Th e R ule s a nd R e g ul a ti o n s o f T h e F o o t b a l l A s s o c i a t i o n are g enerally
a c c e p t e d by c lu b s , pl a y e r s a nd all c o n c e r n e d w i t h th e g a m e o f
A ss o c ia t i o n Fo o tba ll. T h e s e Rul e s and R e g u l a t i o n s h a v e b e e n built up
o v e r a p erio d o f time to g o v e r n th e g a m e a n d to p r o t e c t the i nt e r e st s o f all
p articip an ts , pla y e r s , official s, a d m i n i s t r a t o r s , c l u b s , l e a g u e s , a nd e v e n
the F . A . its e lf. It is e s s e n t i a l to r e m e m b e r that t h e y are th e law s o f
foot ball a nd not the la w s o f the land.

    Whilst e v e r y c a re is ta k e n to e n s u r e that the r ul es a nd r eg u l a t i on s are
framed in c o n f o r m i t y w ith th e l aw o f the l and , t h e y are n ot the l a w of the
land and t h e y ma y be c h a ll e n g e d , a s in the n o w f a m o u s E a s t h a m ca se .
N e v e r t h e l e s s , a strict a d h e r e n c e t o the r ul es a n d r e g u l a t i o n s o f the F . A .
is vital if a c lub is to pr o te c t i t s e l f f r o m th e e v e r i n c r e a s i n g t e n d e n c y for
s o m e b o d y , individua l or o r g a n i s a t i o n , to c h a l l e n g e its a u t ho r i ty . A club
s ecret ary, par ticularly if his c l u b is a l imi te d liability c o m p a n y , is very
vulnerable.

Rating o f Foot ball C lu b G r o u n d s

 T h ere is to be a r ating Re v a l u a t i o n o f all n o n - d o m e s t i c pr o perty in
England a nd W a le s in 1990.
   T h e last R e v a l ua tio n to o k p l a c e in 1973. S i n c e t hen r a te abl e v a l u es have
been asse s s e d at the le ve l o f v a l u e s c ur re nt in 1973. In 1990 the
R evalu atio n will be at the leve l o f v al ue s c ur re nt oil t h e 1st Apr il 19X8. It
can t h eref o r e b e a nticipa ted that rating a s s e s s m e n t s arc likclv to increase'.
The imp ac t o f rate liability h o w e v e r , c a n n o t be p r e d i c t e d with c ertaint y
b ecause the rate in the po u n d will i nvar iably b e l o we r than th e current
level o f rate in the po u nd . Fr o m 1990 it is p r o p o s e d that the rate p ou n d a ge
vvili be set at a sing le na tio na l le v el r athe r than at wi d e l y var ying local
levels.
   Th e Foo tba ll A s s o c i a ti o n w is he s to e n c o u r a g e F o o t b a l l Club s w h o pay
 rates on their g r o unds to ta k e s u i ta b le s te ps to s a f e g u a r d their i nt erest in
 the Revalua tio n.
   Football C lubs are a dv is e d t o retain the s e r v ic e s o f a Rat in g A dv is or to
 look after the C lub's inter est s in the f o r t h c o m i n g Re v a l u a t i o n . T h e C lub s
 can either a pp o in t their o w n S u r v e y o r o r t h e y ma y c h o o s e to instruct the
 Association's C o ns ult a n ts to a dv i s e t h e m in this i m p o r t a n t matter.
   Clubs a ppo inting their o w n S u r v e y o r are r e q u e s t e d to e n s u r e that their
 Survcvor notifies the A s s o c i a t i o n ' s Co n s u l t a n t o f his i nt er est o n b e h a lf of
 the Club.

                        DISCIPLINARY PROCEDURES
                            M e m o r a n d u m of Proced u re
T o be f o ll ow e d at a P erson al Hea ri n g o f a charge p referred by T h e
Football A sso ci at i on or by a C ou n t y Footb all A sso ci at i on :
    !. T h e C o m m i ss io n havin g a s se m b l ed , it shall ap p oin t its Chair man
and an o t h er p e rso n to act as S ecret ary to the C o m m is s io n w h o s e duty shall
be to call the e v id e n c e lo he su b m it t ed in su pp ort o f the ch arge and
gen erallv t o assist the C o m m i ss io n .
    2. T h e re shall t h en be ad m it t ed the R e f e re e or p erson (e g L in e sm an )
u p on w h o s e rep ort t h e charge has b e e n p ref erred, and the person the
subj ect o f the ch arge. T h e latt er may, with th e p e rmission o f the
C o m m i s s io n , b e ac co m p a n ie d by a R ep res en t at ive o f t h e Club to which he
m a y b e lon g, or by a R e p r ese n t at i ve from his A ss o c ia t i o n but sho uld such
rep resen t at ive be co n d u ct in g the case on b eh a lf o f the p ers on c ha rg ed , he
shall n ot be p erm i t t ed to give evid e n c e.
    3. {a) T h e C o m m i s s io n shall satisfy itself that th e p e rso n char ged has
had details o f the charge.
         (b) T h e C h a ir m an o f the C o m m i ss io n shall ask w h e t h e r the R e fe r e e
or ot h er p erson u p on w h os e report the charge is m a d e , w ishes to amplify
or q u ant it y bis report . If he rep lies in the aff irmative such furher e v id e n c e
sh ou ld t h en be given.
         (c) T h e p erson ch arged or his R e p r e s e n t a t i \e shall then be a ll o w e d
to ask q u est ion s o f th e w itn ess p ro vid ed such q u est ion s are relevant to the
mat t ers in issue.
         (d) A t any time the C hairm an and . t h rou gh h im . M e m b e r s o f the
C o m m i s s io n , m a y ask q u est ion s o f the witness.
         (e) T h e S ecret ary o f the C o m m is si on shall t hen call oth er w itnesses
in su p p ort of t h e charge. Th e person ch arged , or his R e p r es e n ta ti ve , shall
h ave th e s a m e right t o ask q u es t ion s o f such ot h er w it n ess es as he has had
to ask q u es t io n s o f th e first w it n ess. Su ch ot h er w it n ess es may also be
q u es t i on ed by M em b e rs o f th e C om m i ss io n .
         {f) W h e n all the e vi d e n c e in su p p ort o f th e charge has be en
c o n c lu d e d , t h e written s t a t e m e n t m ad e by the p erson char ged , shall be
read by the S e cret ary to th e C om m is s io n .
         (#) T h e p erson charged m ay t hen give e v id e n c e on his ow n beha lf
and in su ch e v e n t he m ay h ave q u est ion s ask ed o f him by M e m b e r s o f the
C o m m i s s io n , w hich q u est ion s h e mu st answer.
          (h)            T h e p erson ch arged or his R e p r ese n t a ti ve may then call
w it n es ses to each o f w h om q u est ion s m a y be put b_v that person or his
R e p r es e n t at iv e and by M e m b e r s of the C o m m is s io n and such qu est ion s
must be an sw er ed .
         (z) fn th e ev en t o f the e v id e n c e su b m it t ed in an sw er to the charge
disclosin g a p oin t with w h ich Match Officials m ay not have had an
op p ort u n it y t o d eal. M em b e rs o f the C o m m i s s io n ma y ask further
q u est ion s o f th e Mat ch Officials to d isp ose o f any d o u b t which then may
h ave ar is e n .
         (/} N o written st at e m e n t shaii be ac cep t ed in e v id e n c e unless the
aut hor t h er e o f shall be p r esen t for the p u rp ose o f b e in g qu es ti o n ed with
regard t h er e t o , neit h er shall "hearsay" be ad m it t ed . All e xt r a n e o u s
mat ter in the e v id e n c e shall b e ruled "out o f order".

        ik) N o e v i d e n c e o f a n y p r e v i o u s m i s c o n d u c t o f the p e rso n ch arged
 shall be a dm itt e d un l e s s h e s hal l h a v e put h i s c h a r a c t e r in is su e, i.e.
as ser te d in e v i d e n c e that he b e a r s a g o o d c h a r a c t e r a s a p l ay er or official
and c o n s e q u e n t l y w o u l d not b e lik el y t o c o m m i t t he a c t or act s alleg ed in
 the R e po r t.
    4. T h e e v id e n c e ha v i n g b e e n c o m p l e t e d , t h e p e r s o n c harged or his
R e p r e s e n ta ti v e , shall b e e n t i t l e d to m a k e a s u b m i s s i o n b as ed u p on th e
e v i d e n c e but this d o e s not e n t i t l e ’him t o i n t r o d u c e f a c t s n ot d is c lo se d by
the e v i d e n c e .
    5. At the c o n c l u s i o n o f th e s u b m i s s i o n , all w i t n e s s e s with the p e r so n
ch ar g e d a nd his R e p r e s e n t a t i v e , shall wi t h d r a w w h i l s t t h e C o m m i s s i o n
c o n s id e r the e v id e n c e wh i c h h a s b e e n g i v e n a nd t h e s u b m i ss io n and
d ec ide w h e th e r the c h a r g e is p r o v e d or no t. U p o n r e a c h i n g its d e c is i o n ,
the C o m m i s s i o n shall r ec al l t h e p e r s o n c h a r g e d a n d hi s R e p r es e n t at iv e
and a l s o the p e r s o n up o n w h o s e r ep or t th e c h a r g e w a s p r e f erred , and the
C h air ma n shall a n n o u n c e w h e t h e r t h e c h a r g e ha s b e e n f o u n d " p r o v e d ”
or “ not p r o v e d . " T h e p e r s o n u p o n w h o s e r e p or t t h e ch ar ge w as
pref er re d sha ll the n retire.
    6. (a ) If the c ha r g e is f o u n d “ n ot p r o v e n " the s e s s i o n will be d eclared
c lo se d.
        (b)            If the c h ar g e is f o u n d " p r o v e d " th e S e c r e t a r y shall giv e d etails o f
the r e c o r d o f the pe r s o n c h a r g e d , and t h e p e r s o n c h a rg ed , or his
R e p r e s e n ta ti v e , ma y t h en m a k e a p l e a for l e n i e n c y .
    7. (a) A t the c o nc lu s i o n o f the plea for l c ni enc y the p e r s o n charged an d
his Re pr e s e nta tiv e s ha ll a g ai n w i t h d r a w a n d t h e C o m m i s s i o n shall p r o ­
ceed to de c ide w he the r any, a nd if s o wh a t , or de r or o r de rs shall be m ad e
under the p r o v is io ns o f Ru l e 2 6 (d).
         (b )           T h e pe r s o n c h a r g ed a nd hi s Re p r e s e n t a t i v e shall then be re ad m it ­
 ted a nd info r m e d o f the d e c i s i o n wh i c h m u s t s u b s e q u e n t l y be co n f irm ed in
writing. A lte rnativ ely , a C o m m i s s i o n n e e d n ot a n n o u n c e its d ec isio n at the
 meeting but info rm the p e r s o n c h a r ge d that s u c h d e c i s i o n will be c o m ­
 mu nicated to him in w r i t i n g t h r o u g h his C l u b Secretary.

 appropriate C o u nt y or o t h e r affiliated A s s o c i a t i o n , and t h e w or d s "t h e
