 tion as w e ll as its actual Se cre ta ry.
    2. E v e ry A s s o c ia ti o n mu st s et o u t in its R u l e s or R e g u l a ti on s details of
  the pr o c e d ur e to be fo l l o we d after a p lay er shall h a v e b e e n ca u t i on ed or
  dismissed fro m the field o f play whi ls t pl ay i ng in a ma t ch for a C lu b or a
  particular te a m o f a C l u b , no t d e al t with by T h e F o o t b a l l Assoc iat ion and
  such pr o c e dur e must co n f o r m wi th th e r e q u i r e m e n t s s e t o ut in Part 1 o f

  of any o f the alte rnative and o p t i o n a l p o w e r s s et o u t in Part H.

            A n o r de r mu s t be m a d e f or the p l ay e r o r his Cl u b t o p ay an

         p ropo r ti o n o f the g e n e ra l o v e r h e a d e x p e n s e s o f the A s s o c i a ti o n .
   ( c ) A co p y o f th e L i n e s m a n ’s R e p o r t n e e d n o t be s e n t to the S e c ret ary o f
         the p la y e r ’s C lub unle s s s uc h L i n e s m a n wa s t h e m a j o r w i t n ess o f t h e
         in cid e nt c o nc e r ne d.
A ll writt en c o m m u n ic a t io n s f r o m th e p l a y e r to T h e A s s o c i a t i o n S ecret ary
shall b e se n t by the Se c r e ta r y o f t h e P l a y e r ’s Club .

    4. U p o n r e c e iv ing notifica t io n f r o m t h e A s s o c i a t i o n S e c r e t a r y that o n e
o f th e p lay e rs o f his C lub ha s b e e n C a u t i o n e d o r d i s m i s s d f r o m t h e field o f
p lay the Se c r e t a r y o f the C lu b shall f o r th wi t h a c k n o w l e d g e r e c e i p t o f the
not ification a nd ha nd it wit h t h e R e f e r e e ’s R e p o r t to t h e p layer
c on c er n e d. It shall be the du t y o f t h e Cl u b S e c r e t a r y a n d t h e p l a y er w ith in
14 d ays o f the po s ting o f the n ot i f i c a t i o n , to e n s u r e th at t h e A s s o c ia t i o n
S ecretary r e c e iv e s s uc h in fo r m a t i o n as m a y b e d e m a n d e d i n cl u d i ng: —
   (a) t h e full n a m e o f the pl ay e r
   ( b ) his da t e o f birth (o p t i o n a l ) u n le ss the p l a y e r is u n de r St at ut ory
         S c h o o l- L e a v in g a g e , a nd
   ( c ) the n a m e o f the C lubs for w h o m h e is c u rr en t ly p l a y i n g or p re viou sly
         reg is te r e d with.

Failure o n the part o f the p l a y e r o r his Cl u b S e c r e t a r y t o d i s c harge t h e
req u i re m e nt s o f this par a g r ap h shall be m i s c o n d u c t p u n i s h a b l e a s m ay be
d e cid ed by the C o unc il.

   5. T h e Fo r m o f notific a tion i n f o r m i n g t h e p l ay e r o f his right to req u e st a
Person al H e a r in g in r e s p e c t o f a s e n d i n g o f f o f f e n c e shall m a k e it clear that
in the e v e n t o f the pla y er b e i n g f o u n d g ui l ty o f th e c h a r g e h e will b e liable
to b e or d e r e d to pa y the w h o l e or par t o f t h e c o st s o f the P e r s o n a l He ar in g
which co sts ma y inc lu de a part o f the o v e r h e a d e x p e n s e s o f the
A ssociat io n. In like m a n n e r, th e p l a y e r shall b e i n f o r m e d , in c a s e s w h e re
the R u le s o r R e g u la ti o n s o f t h e A s s o c i a t i o n p r o v i d e f or t h e p a y m e n t o f a
deposit w h e n a Per s o na l H e a r i n g is r e q u e s t e d , th at s u c h d e p o s i t is liab le to
b e forfeite d if the play e r is f o u n d g ui l ty a n d that such f o r f e i t u r e m ay be in
addition t o a ny fine w hic h m a y b e i m p o s e d . A P e r s o n a l H e a r i n g f e e m a y
not be im p o u n d e d ne ithe r m a y C o m m i s s i o n c o st s b e l e v i e d in an u n p r ov en
case, an d ne it he r ma y C o m m i s s i o n c o st s be c h a r g e d at N o n P er son al
Hearin g ca s e s .

   14. T h e de c is io n o f t h e A s s o c i a t i o n shall b e s e nt by first c lass p ost to the

playing E a c h Se c re tary shall b e r e s p o n s i b l e for i n f o r m i n g the p layer of
the de tails o f the de c isi o n.

Sending O f f Offences
   (i). A pla y e r g uilty o f a n y o f f e n c e l e a di n g to his s e n d i n g o f f in a mat ch
for the first time in a Sea s o n s h o u l d be s u s p e n d e d for 2 1 d a ys a nd fined £ 10.
   (ii) A play e r guilty o f a n y o f f e n c e l e a d i n g to his s e n d i n g o f f in a
su b s e q ue nt ma tc h, or m a t c h e s , in the s a m e S e a s o n , shall be s u s p en d ed for
21 da ys a nd fined £ 1 0 . In a dd i t i o n , a C o u n t y A s s o c i a t i o n shall reserve the
right to pr e fe r a c ha rge o f " c o n t i n u i n g m i s c o n d u c t ” u n d er F . A . R u le
26 (a)(x).
  (iii) In all c as es in (i) a nd (ii) a b o v e wh e r e a M a t c h Official's report
indic ate s a s e r io us br e ac h o f the L a w s o f t h e G a m e , an A s s o c ia t io n shall
reserve the right to pr ef e r an a dd i t i on al c h a r g e u n d e r F . A . R u le 26( « ) ( x) .
  ( iv) S h o u ld a pla y e r b e f o u n d guil ty o f a c h a r g e r ef er re d t o in (ii) or (iii)
ab o v e , be fo r e de c idin g wha t p u n i s h m e n t to i m p o s e , t h e C om m is si o n
ap p o inte d to de al w'ith th e c a s e , mu s t tak e int o c o n s i d e r a t i o n : —
   (a) the 21 da ys per iod o f s u s p e n s i o n i m p o s e d as a result o f his sen d in g
         o ff
   (b) the natur e o f the r e p o r t e d o f f e n c e
   ( c) a ny w r itten o r v erb al p l e a s u b m i t t e d b y t h e p iaye r
    (d) any kn o w n mi s c o n d u c t r ec or d o v e r th e p r e v i o u s five Seas on s .

 Cautions in the S a m e Season
 A playe r w h o has five c a u t i o n s r e c o r d e d ag ai ns t him in t h e S a m e S eason
 shall be c ha r g e d with " c o n t i n u i n g m i s c o n d u c t " a nd at t h e s am e t im e be
 given the o pp o r t uni ty t o : —
    (i) s ubmit an a ppli c at io n to a p p e a r b e f o r e a C o m m i s s io n for the
        pu r po s e o f ma ki n g a verbal pl e a f or l e n i e n c y , or
    (ii) s ubmit a wr itte n p le a f or l e n i e n c y w h i c h will b e c o n si d e red by th e
         M e m b e r s o f th e C o m m i s s i o n a p p o i n t e d to de a l wit h t h e case.

1. R E P O R T I N G OK O F F E N C E S BY M A T C H O F F I C I A L S

(a)      C au ti on Of fen ces
       (i)   R e fe r e e s will c o n tin u e to a d m i n i s t e r field c a u t i o n s in a c cord an ce
             wi th the Law s o f the G a m e .

      (ii)    R e fe r e e s must s ubmi t to the A s s o c i a t i o n w ithin 2 da ys o f the mat ch
             (S un da y s not inc luded ) a R e p o r t (in d u p l ic a te ) s ta ti ng the of f en c e
             and g i\ ing a de s cr ipti o n o f the i n c i d e n t .

(b)      S e n d in g O f f Of fen ces
             R e f e r e e s and L in e s m e n must s u bm i t to t h e A s s o c i a t i o n within 2
             d ay s o f the ma tch (S u n d a y s not i n c l u de d ) a Re p o r t (in d uplicate)
             st ating the o ff e n e e (s ) a nd g i vi ng a d e sc ri pt i on o f th e i ne i d en t ( s) .

2. CAUTION OFFENCES
A p layer w h o ha s be e n c a ut i o n e d in any m a t ch will be no ti fi ed t hrough his
C lu b by T h e A s s o c i a ti o n o f th e O f f e n c e r ep or t ed by the R e f e r e e and at the
sam e tim e will be a dv is e d o f the n u m b e r o f c a u t i o n p e n a l n points
record ed ag ains t him for the o f f e n c e . An a dm i n i s t r a t i o n fee o f £5-1)0 will
he ch arged for the pr o c e s s in g o f e a c h report.

j)         C ollection o f A d m in istr a tio n F ees
       It will be the r esponsibility o f the Club S c c r e t a n to c ollect the £5-011
       adminis tration f ee s from the players c o n c e r n e d and forward t h em to
       T h e Foot ball A ss o c i a t i o n w h e n r e q ue s t e d s o to do .

. D I S C I P L I N A R Y A C T I O N ON             C L U B S F O R M I S C O N D U C T BY
  T H EIR PLAYKRS

     (a)     A n y C lub w h o s e p layers a cc u mu la t e a total o f 150 p enalt y points or
            m o r e in first t ea m ma t c h e s during a S e a s o n ma y be required to
            a pp ea r be fo re a C o m m i s s i o n o f the Disciplinary C o m m i t t e e and
            shall be liable to be w a r ne d and/or fined for ha ving pe rmitt ed its
            p laye rs to violate the L a w s o f the G a m e in c o n t ra v en ti on o f F . A .
            R ul e 2 6( a) ( i) . In addition the C o m m i s s i o n shall be e ntit le d to order
            the Cl ub to pa y the A ss o c i a t i o n the C o st s o f the Hear ing. A n y
            action t aken by the C lub to discipline' its players under S e c t i on 4 (h )
            will be t aken into c on s id e ra t io n by the C o m m i s s i o n in its findings.

            In so far as this R e g u la ti on shall apply 10 pe nalt y po in ts will be
            a dd e d to a Club's po in ts total in respect o f a player sent o f f in a first
            t e a m c o mp e ti t i v e match for persis tent m is co ndu ct after h a vi n g b e e n
            c a u t i o n ed and 12 pe nal t y points for any o th er o f f en c e.

 >)        P r o c e ed s o f fines i m p o s e d under this s ec ti on o f the Disciplinary
           Pr oc edur es shall be dis bu rs ed to a g r ee d Foot ball Charities at the e n d
           o f the Pl aying Se a s o n .

 ■)        A C lub required to a pp ear be f or e a Disciplinary C o m m i s s i o n shall be
           r ep re s en te d by at least o n e o f its Dir ec tor s and the M anag er.

 I)        T h e Foot ball A s s o c ia ti on reserves the right to prefer a Char ge
           against a Club at any ti me during the S ea s o n arising from Field
           O f f e n c e s c o m m i t t e d by Players o f the Club.

                                  MEMORANDUM
                      DISCIPLINARY PROCEDURES CONCERNING
                                 FIELD OFFENCES


                               As set oat in the Schedule hereto
                 for Players associated with Alliance Premier League Clubs



                                          SEASON 1989/1990



1. R E P O R T I N G O F O F F E N C E S BY M A T C H O F F I C I A L S

(a)     C a utio n Off en ces
      (i) R e f e r e e s will c o n ti n ue to admi ni ste r field c aut io n s in ac cor dance
          with the Law's o f the G a m e .

      (ii) R e f e r e e s must submi t t o the A ss o c i a t i o n within 2 davs o f the match
           ( S u n da y s not inc lu de d) a R e p or t (in dupl ic ate ) stating the o ff en ce
           a nd g iv ing a d es cript ion o f the incident.

(h)      S e n d in g O f f O ff en ces
           R e f e r e e s and L i ne s m e n must submi t to the A s s o c ia ti on within 2
           days o f the ma tch ( S u n d a y s not i nc l ude d) a R e p or t (in duplicate)
           stating the o ff e n c e ( s ) and giving a descript ion o f the ineident(s ).

2. C A U T I O N O F F E N C E S
A player w h o has b e e n c a u t i o ne d in any ma tch will be notified through his
Club by T h e A s so c i a t i o n o f the O f f e n c e rep ort ed by the R e f e r e e and at the
s ame ti me will be adv is ed o f the n u m b e r o f c aut io n penalt y points
recorded against him for the o ff e n c e . A n administration f ee o f £5-00 will
be c har ged for the pr oc es sing o f e ach report.

3. S E N D I N G O F F O F F E N C E S

(a)      Notification
        A player w h o has b e e n s ent o ff in a ma tc h u nde r the provisions of
        Law 12 will be notified through his Cl ub by the A ss o c i a t i o n o f the
        o f f e n c e r ep or t ed by the R e f e r e e , and at the s ame time adv is ed that he
        will be subje ct to the agr ee d standard p u ni s hme nt ( s ee Se c ti on 4). An
        a dminis tr ation fee o f £5-00 will be c har ged for the pr oc es si ng o f each
        report.

(b)      C la im s o f M is ta ke n Identity
         In the c ase o f a claim o f a lle ge d mi st ak en i dentity c o n c er n i n g a player
         sent o f f in a mat c h, the player c o n c e r n e d and his Club must within
         three clays o f the said ma tc h s u bmi t in writing to T h e A ss oc ia ti on
         particulars u p o n which the claim is f o u n d e d . If the C ha ir ma n o f the

      (I)      It a p ! a \ c r a c c u m u l a t e s 21 o r m o v e p e n a l t v p o i n t s t o r c a u t i o n

               o ffe n c e s b e t w e e n the o p e n in g d a v of the Playing S e a s o n an d the
               S e c o n d S u n d a v i n A p r i l i n t h e s a m e S e a s o n , h e wi l l b e s u s p e n d e d

        ma t c h e s and Friendly ma t c h e s until such ti me as his Club's

        a ppro pri at e to the p u n is h me n t in a p p r o v e d C o m p e t i t i o n s during
        the p er io d c o v e r e d by its o p e n i n g ma tch in T h e A l l i a n cc Premier
        L e a g u e an d e n d i n g with the final m at c h in w hi c h the C l u b is playing

        or T h e A l l i a n ce P re mi er L e a g u e o r ma t c h e s c o n c er n i ng a Club's
        C o u n t y S e ni or Cu p C o m p e t i t i o n .
 (viii) A n y p e r io d o f s u s p e n s i o n o t p a n t h e r e o f w hi c h r e m ai ns o u t s t a n d ­
        ing at the end o f a S e a s o n must be ser ve d at the c o m m e n c e m e n t o f
        the ne xt f o l l o wi n g Se a so n.
  (ix) In t he e v e n t o f a player's o f f e n c e s totalling m o re than 21 o r 3 1 o r 41
       p oi n ts , the po i nts in e x c e s s o f 21 or 31 or 41 points will b e carried
       forward and a d d e d to any further poi nts he may r e ce ive du ri ng the
       s a m e S e a s o n.
(c)     P la y e r s S e n t O f f fo r p e r sis tin g in m is c o n d u c t after h a v in g been
        ca u tio n ed
      (i) A player w h o is di s mi s se d f rom the Fi eld o f Pl av for having
          persis ted in m i s c o nd u ct after h av i ng b e e n c a u t i o n e d will be
          s u s p e n d e d a ut oma ti ca ll y f r om all d o m e s t i c L e a g u e a nd C u p
          m at c h e s a nd Friendly ma t c h e s c o m m e n c i n g o n the 14th day
          f o ll o wi n g the ma t ch in which he w a s sent o f f until s uc h ti me as his
          C lub's r ec o g n i s e d s enior t e a m has c o m p l e t e d o n e (1) mat c h in an
          a p p ro v e d C o m p e t i t i o n during the pe r iod c o v e r e d by its o p e n i n g
          m at ch in T h e A ll ia n ce P re mi e r L e a g u e and e n d i n g with the final
          ma t ch in w hi ch the Cl ub is playi ng in a d o m e s t i c C om p e t i t i o n
          o r g an is ed by T h e Fo ot ba ll A ss o c i a t i o n or T h e A l l i a n ce P re mi e r
          L e a g u e o r m a t c h e s c o n c e r n i n g a Club's C o u n t y S e n i o r C u p
          Competition.
      (ii) A n y s u s p en s i o n o r part t h e r e o f w h ic h r em ai ns o u t s t a n d i n g at the

           f ol l o wi n g S e a s o n ,

                                    MEMORANDUM
                        DISCIPLINARY PROCEDURES CONCERNING
                                   FIELD OFFENCES

                      As set out in the Schedule hereto for Players associated
                        with Clubs competing in the Isthmian, Northern,
                           Northern Premier and the Southern Leagues

                                               SEASON 1989/1990

1.    R E PO R T IN G O F O FFE N C E S BY M A TC H OFFICIALS
(a) C a ution O ffen ce s
        (i) R e f e r e e s will c o n t i n u e t o a d m i n i s t e r field c a u t i o n s in a c c o r d a n c e
            w ith th e t h e L a w s o f t h e G a m e .
        (ii) R e f e r e e s m u s t s u b m i t t o t h e A s s o c i a t i o n wi t h i n 2 d a y s o f th e
             m a t c h ( S u n d a y s n o t i n c l u d e d ) a R e p o r t (in d u p l i c a t e ) s t a t in g th e
             o f f e n c e a n d g iv in g a d e s c r i p t i o n o f t h e i n c i d e n t .

(b) S e n d in g O f f O ff en ces
     R e f e r e e s a n d L i n e s m e n m u s t s u b m i t t o t h e A s s o c i a t i o n w i t h i n 2 da y s
     o f th e m a t c h ( S u n d a y s n o t i n c l u d e d ) a R e p o r t (i n d u p l i c a t e ) s t a t i ng th e
     o ff e n c e ( s ) a n d g iv in g a d e s c r i p t i o n o f t h e i n e i d c n t ( s ) .

2.    CA UTIO N O FFEN CES
     Notification
     A p la y e r w h o h a s b e e n c a u t i o n e d in a n y m a t c h will b e n o t i f i e d t h r o u g h
     his C l u b b y T h e A s s o c i a t i o n o f t h e O f f e n c e r e p o r t e d b y t h e R e f e r e e
     a n d if th a t c a u t i o n is th e 5 t h t h e p l a y e r h a s r e c e i v e d in t h e c u r r e n t
     S e a s o n will b e a d v is e d h e will b e s u b j e c t t o t h e a g r e e d s t a n d a r d
     p u n i s h m e n t (s e e S e c ti o n 4 ) . A n a d m i n i s t r a t i o n f e e o f £ 5 . 0 0 will be
     c h a r g c d fo r t h e p r o c e s s in g o f e a c h r e p o r t .

3.    SE N D IN G O FF O FFE N C E S
(a) N otificat ion
     A p l a y e r w h o h a s b e e n s e n t o f f in a r e c o g n i s e d first t e a m m a t c h u n d e r
     th e p ro v is io n s o f L a w 12 will b e n o t i f i e d t h r o u g h h is C l u b by T h e
     A ss o c i a t i o n o f th e o f f e n c e r e p o r t e d b y t h e R e f e r e e , a n d at t h e s a m e
     ti m e a d v is e d t h a t he will b e s u b j e c t t o t h e a g r e e d s t a n d a r d p u n i s h m e n t
     ( see S e c ti o n 4). A n a d m i n i s t r a t i o n fe e o f £ 5 . 0 0 will b e c h a r g e d f o r the
     p r o c e s s in g o f e a c h r e p o r t.

(b) C la im s o f M ista k e n Identity
     I n t h e c a s e o f a c l a im o f a l l e g e d m i s t a k e n i d e n t i t y c o n c e r n i n g a p la y e r
     s e n t o ff in a m a t c h , th e p l a y e r c o n c e r n e d a n d h is C l u b m u s t w ithin
     t h r e e d a y s o f t h e s a id m a t c h s u b m i t in wr i t i n g t o T h e A s s o c ia ti o n
     p a r ti c u la r s u p o n w h ic h t h e c l a i m is f o u n d e d . I f t h e C h a i r m a n o f the
     D is ci p l in a r y C o m m i t t e e a n d t h e S e c r e t a r y o f T h e F o o t b a l l A s s o c i a ­
     ti o n , o r t h e i r n o m i n e e s , a r e s a t i s f i e d t h a t t h e c l a i m w a r r a n t s f u r t h e r
     in ve st ig a t io n a D is c i p l in ar y C o m m i s s i o n s hal l b e c o n v e n e d a n d will

    1. General
    T h e F o o t b a l l A s s o c i a t i o n wi l l c o n s i d e r a p p l i c a t i o n s f o r l o a n s f r o m c l u b s in

a c q u i r e t h e f r e e h o l d of a g r o u n d , o r t o d e v e l o p a n d i m p r o v e e x i s t i n g f ac il it ie s
T h e c o n s i d e r a t i o n o f a p p l i c a t i o n s w ill a l s o b e e x t e n d e d It' C o u n t y A s s o c i a t i o n s
w h o w is h t o a c q u i r e t h e i r o w n f r e e h o l d offices.

    (<t) Maximum Loan.
    T h e m a x i m u m l o a n g r a n t e d shall n o t e x c e e d . £10,000. o r t w o / t h i r d s t h e v a l u e
o f f r e e h o l d p r o p e r t y . Tn t h e c a s e o f C o u n t y A s s o c i a t i o n s r e q u i r i n g a s s i s t a n c e
t o w a r d s th e cost of e it h e r purchasini:. or e x t e n d i n g p r e m i s e s , the loan m a \ b e
u n to £20.000.
    (/->) Security
     T h e s e c u r i t y r e q u i r e d f o r a l o a n m u s t b e a t irst m o r t g a g e o n a f r e e h o l d
g r o u n d , o r a w r i t t e n g u a r a n t e e i zi ven b y a l o c a l a u t h o r i t y w h e r e a i z i ound is
l e a s e h o l d . N o o t h e r s e c u r i t y wi ll ' be a c c e p t a b l e .
    ( c l Interest Rates

    T h e Foot ball A s s o c i a t i o n will m a k e grants to C o u nt y Football A s s o c i a ­

ture from all s our ce s t h r o u g ho ut the s e a s on is s ubmi tte d.
    T h e o nl y items for w h ic h g ra nt s will be given are as foll ows :—

tributions are ma d e by participants), and pr ov is io n o f c o a c h i n g e q u i p ­
ment.

2. He lp t ow ar ds the pr ov is io n o f First A i d Kits and footballs.

possi bility o f using o th e r facilities, (e.g. b or r ow i ng from s ch o ol s, clubs or
local aut horities) before thes e i te ms will be c ons i de re d.

other than for C o un t y or Inter-League mat c he s.

items w h ic h ma y be specific t o its o w n requirements.

   A p p l i ca t io n must c o n ta i n a full br e ak do w n o f c ost s, t ogether with as
mu ch i nf ormation in s uppor t o f the application as p os si bl e. In this c o n n e c ­
tion, it w o ul d be helpful to the C o m m i t t e e if the n u mb e r o f y o ut h cl ubs in
the C o un t y c oul d be stated.




                               THE F O O TBA LL TRUST

   T h e Foot ball Trust w as f o u n d e d by the Po ol P r om ot e r s A s s o c ia ti on in
1979 a nd. with m o n e v m a d e available from " Sp ot ti ng -t he - Ba ll ". it was
e m p o w e r e d to pr ov ide funds for the benefit o f foot ball in g ene ral , with
particular e m p h a s i s o n tackling any a ssoc ia te d social p robl ems .
    Ov e r the years the Trust has a ssisted w ith the i m p r o v e m e n t o f safety at
 League club g round s, with Fo ot ba ll and the C o m m u n i t y s c h e m e s , with the
 imp r ov e me n t o f pit ches and hard surface play areas, and with specific
 security m e a s u r e s such as the installation o f cl ose d circuit t ele vis ion at
 League grounds.

                                ASSAULTS ON R E FE R E E S

           M e m o r a n d u m r ela tive to p r o c e e d i n g s in C o u r t s of Law
           f ollowing A ss a u lt s u p o n R ef er ee s a n d a n ci ll a ry m a t t e r s
                      to be c o n s id e r e d by C o u n t y A sso ciations

    T h e s u bj e c t o f this M e m o r a n d u m is o f n e c e s s i t y a ve ry w i d e o n e and
c o n s e q u e n t l y o nly t h o s e matters w h ic h it is thought to be o f i m p or t an c e
to C o u n t y A s s o c i a t i o n s and to R e f e r e e s are de ai t with. In no s e n s e is it
inte nded fully and c o m p l e t e l y to set out the a ppropriat e law but is me ant
to alert C o u n t y A s s o c i a t i o n s and R e f e r e e s as to p os s i b l e p r o c e e d i n g s
f o l l o w i n g a s sa ul t s u po n R e f e r e e s .
    A. It might be appropriat e first o f ali to give a picture o f the v arious
t y p es o f a s sa ul t s and wha t they i n v o l v e so far as C ou rt s o f L a w are
concerned.
    T h e y are: —
       (i) C o m m o n a s s a u l t
       (ii) A ss a u l t s o c c a s i o n i n g actual bod il y harm
       (iii) A ss a u l t s i n v o l v i n g g r i e v o u s bodily harm> and
      (iv) W o u n d i n g with int ent t o c a u s e g r i e v o u s bo di ly harm
   (a) D ea li ng with t h o s e a s s a ul t s k n o w n as c o m m o n a s s a u l t s , th e y be ing
s uc h as to be o f a trivial nature w ithout bruising or dis turbing the skin: —

    Court p r o c e e d i n g s in th es e mat ters can o n l y be ins tit uted at the
in s ta n ce o f the a gg r ie v ed per-son, n a m e l y the R ef e r e e . T h e R ef er ee
c o m p l a i n a n t mu st s ati sfy a B e n c h o f lay Ma gi st ra te s that he has be en
u n l aw fu l l y a s sa u l t e d . T h e Magist rat es may inflict u po n the D e f e n da n t
Player a hne o f £ 50 or s e n t e n c e him to a term o f i mp r i s o n m e n t for two
mo n th s . T h e Mag ist rat es al so h a ve p o w e r t o o r d e r c o s t s to be paid by the
D e f e n d a n t Pl ayer. O f t e n the assailant is bo un d o v e r in his o w n
r e c o g n i s a n c e to k e e p the p e a c e . Invariably c o s t s are incurred by the
p e r so n w h o m a k e s the c o m pl a i n t and it is not a l w a y s p o s s i b l e to r e cov er
t h es e .
  Foo tba ll Dis ci pl ina ry C o m m i t t e s can far better de al with this t yp e of
assaul t than c an the Courts.

   A Dis ciplinar y C o m m i t t e e can awa rd w hat p r o v e s to be a m or e telling
p u n i s hm e nt than c an a Cour t. It is in ad v is ab l e that m o n e y shoul d be
s pe nt in taking p r o c e e d i n g s for c o m m o n a s saul t and the matter shoul d be
reported bv the R e f e r e e to the C o u n t y A s s o c i a t i o n and dealt with in the
usual way .

  (b) The next ty pe o f as saul t is that w h i ch o c c a s i o n s actual b od il y harm.
Kor this type o f o f f e n c e the Pol ice h a ve p o w e r o f arrest upon r eas onable
mis pic ion o f the o tie nee h avi ng b e e n c o m m u t e d and it is a matter which
shoul d no r ma ll y be p r o s e c u t e d by the Pol ice . The o f f e n c e c o m e s within
the c ate gory of what is k n o w n as an " i n d i ct ab le o f f e n c e " w hi ch means
that it must be tried hy a Jury un l es s the a c c u s e d player g i v e s his c ons ent
in w hi c h c a s e it c an be tried summarily b ef o r e Magist rat es .
                                                      APPENDIX                                                     347


     T h e term “ actual bodily h a r m ” includes an y hurt, o rin ju ry calculated
t o i n t e r f e r e w ith t h e h e a l t h o r c o m f o r t o f t h e a g g r i e v e d p e r s o n . It n e e d
n o t b e o f a p e r m a n e n t n a t u r e n o r a m o u n t t o g r i e v o u s b o d i l y h a r m . It m a y
b e t h o u g h t th a t a b r o k e n to o th o r a b a d b ru is e m ig ht a m o u n t to actu al
b o d i l y h a r m . In the c a se o f a n a lle g a tio n o f a ctu a l bod ily h a r m th e facts
s h o u ld be rep o rted by th e R e fe re e to th e P o lice w ith o u t d e la y a n d th e
c o m p l a i n t s h o u ld b e a c c o m p a n i e d by th e n a m e o f t h e guilty p la y e r a nd
t h e n a m e s o f s u c h w i t n e s s e s a s c a n b e o b t a i n e d . T h e R e f e r e e m u s t a ls o
r e p o r t th e m a t t e r to th e C o u n t y A s s o c i a t i o n i n t h e u s u a l w a y a g a i n giving
t h e n a m e s o f t h e P l a y e r a n d o f t h e w i t n e s s e s , if a n y . a n d t h e C o u n t y
 A s s o c i a t i o n s h o u l d c o n t a c t th e P o l i c e w i t h o u t d e l a y in o r d e r t o a s s i s t th e
 R e f e r e e . If t h e C o u n t y A s s o c ia tio n h a s ta k e n th e wise s te p of a p p o in tin g
a n H o n o r a r y S o l i c i t o r it m ig h t b e w i s e t o r e q u e s t h i m t o c o n t a c t the
 Po li ce t o s e e th a t a c t i o n is t a k e n . I n t h e c a s e o f t h i s t y p e o f a s s a u l t th e
m a x i m u m p e n a l t y w h i c h c a n b e a w a r d e d in a M a g i s t r a t e s ’ C o u r t is a fine
o f £ 4 00 o r six m o n t h s i m p r i s o n m e n t o r b o t h . I f t h e c a s e is h e a r d b e f o r e a
J u r y th e m a x i m u m t e r m o f i m p r i s o n m e n t is a t e r m o f f iv e y e a r s . A referee
w o u ld be u n w ise p erson ally to sta rt p r o c ee d in g s a lle g in g actual bodily
harm un less th e P o lice refu se to u n d e r ta k e th e p r o sec u tio n a n d e v e n t h e n
h e s h o u l d c o n s u l t w ith th e C o u n t y A s s o c i a t i o n . T h e r e a s o n f o r t h i s is th a t
if s u c h a c a s e is d e a l t w it h b e f o r e a J u r y it w o u l d b e a l m o s t e s s e n t i a l f o r
 So li c it o rs a n d C o u n s e l to b e e n g a g e d a n d t h i s m i g h t i n v o l v e t h e R e f e r e e

 t h e ir H o n o r a r y S o li c it o r to l e a r n w h a t m i g h t b e i n v o l v e d .
     (c) T h e thi rd t y p e o f c a s e is t h a t wh i c h is k n o w n a s a n a s s a u l t c a us in g
g r ievous bod ily h a r m a n d is o n e w h e r e a p e r s o n u n l a wf u l l y a n d m a l i ciously

a c t ual bodily h a r m c h a r g e a s d e s c r i b e d in (ii) a b o v e a n d t h e p en a l t ies are

                                                   ADVERTI SI NG

              A d v e r t i s i n g o n p l a y e r s ' c l o t h i n g is p e r m i t t e d b y t h e F o o t b a l l
      A s s o c i a t i o n , in a c c o r d a n c e wi t h t h e f o l l o w i n g D e c i s i o n s o f C o u n c i l : —

                                         DECISION OF CO UN CIL

                       r e l a t i n g t o c l o t h i n g o f p l a y e r s a n d m a t c h of f i c i a l s

                                    J u l y 1 9 8 9 a n d unt i l f u r t h e r n o t i c e



A)   Introducti on

     1) Thi s D e c i s i o n o f C o un ci l de als wi th i te ms that may be carried on
        the c l ot hi ng o f players and ma t ch officials. T he Rule s o f A s s o c i a ­
        tions, L e a gu e s and C o m p e t i t i o n s may pr ovide that C lub s obt ain
        p e r mi s si o n from such A s s o c i a t i o n , Leag ue or C o m pe ti t io n
        before carrying any o f the items listed in Section C b e l o w in
        ma t c h e s under their jurisdicti on.

     2 ) Thi s D ec i s i o n shall remain in force until such time as the C ounc i l
         shall vary it. D is ci pl inar y action ma y be taken agains t C l ub s or
         mat c h o ff i ci al s c arrying i te ms o n c l o t h i n g in breach o f this D e c i ­
         sion.

     3 ) Whe r e the R ul e s o f an A s s o c i a t i o n , L eag ue or C om p e t i t i o n
         require C l ub s to o bt a in pe rmi ssi on prior to placing a dvertis ing on
         the c l ot hi ng o f their players, a new application m u st be m a d e to
         the a pp ro p ri at e a ut hor ity e ach time it is p r o p o s e d to a m e n d or
         c h a n g e the advertising. There is, s ubject to the p r o v i s i o n s o f
         Section ( C) 6 b e lo w , no restriction on the n u mb er o f s uch c h a ng e s
         that m a y take place during the c o u r s e o f e ach s ea son.


B)   T h e f o l l o w i n g i te ms are no t c ons i de re d to be advertising:—

     1) A Club e m b l e m , pr ov i de d it is o f an area n o greater than 1 0 0 sq
        c m s ( 1 6 sq ins).

     2 ) T h e trade mark o r n a m e o f the c l ot hi ng manufac tur er o r a c o m b i ­

         e m b l e m if bot h carried.

                                                 APPENDIX                                                    355

The General C o mm i tt ee shall hav e power to declare a seat vacant should a
me mb er absent himself f r o m ........................................................................ consecutive
meetings without an explanation deemed to be satisfactory.
   6. M E M B E R S H I P Membership shall consist o f ...................................... pla\ ■
ing and ............. ■........................... non-playing members. ( A n y special conditions
relating to membership should be stated here.)
Candi dates for election shall be proposed and s ec ond ed by Club members.
A register o f me mber s o f the Club shall be kept by the Secretary.
In the event o f n on -pay me nt o f subscription b y .........................................................
membership shall be d ee me d to be terminated.
A member wishing to resign shall give notice to this effect in writing to the
Secretary, such notice to be ac co mpa ni e d by pa yment o f all Club dues at
that date.
   7. S U B S C R I P T I O N The Annual Subscription to the Club shall be:—
(a) N o n- pl ay ing M e m b e r s ............................
(b) Playing M e m b e r s ........................................
Subscriptions shall be payable not later t h a n ........................................... annually.
   8. A N N U A L M E E T I N G T h e Annu al General Meeting shall be held
 not later t h a n .................................................................... in each year. The Secretary
shall give 21 clear d a y ’s notice o f such Meeting to all members.
The Financial Statement and Secretary's report shall be received by the
Meeting which will also elect the Officers and General C ommi tt ee by
ballot, appoint auditors and transact any other business.
    9. E X T R A O R D I N A R Y G E N E R A L M E E T I N G An Extraordinary
General Meeting ma y be conv ene d by the General Commi tt ee when
deemed desirable and also upon the written request o f ...........................................
members.
The Secretary shall give seven clear days' notice to all members o f such
 Meeting at w h i c h ................................................... Members shall form a quorum.
    10. F I N A N C E The General Commi tt ee shall c ause to be kept proper
books o f account which shall be audited yearly.
Official receipts for all monies received shall be signed by t h e ............................
The General C o mmi t te e shall authorise che que s to be signed by at least
two o f its Members.
    11. A L T E R A T I O N T O T H E R U L E S N o alteration in these Rules
shall be mad e except at the Annual General Meeting or at an
Extraordinary General Meeting c onve ne d for that purpose and only if
 supported b y .................................. o f those present and voting at such Meeting.
 N oti ce o f proposed alteration to these Rules must be given in writing to the
 Secretary by t h e ................................................................in each year, and notified to
 members on notice o f Meeting.
   12. O T H E R B U S I N E S S A n y matters not governed by the foregoing
Rules shall be dealt with by the General Co mmi t te e, the decisi on o f which
body shall be final and binding.
(Note. It ma y be found neces sary to amend or add to these Rules to meet
specific local circumst ances. )

Application to Join a Lea gue
  (i)    The next step is to apply to join o ne o f the local leagues and to play
competitive football.
